loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing merchandise stock

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli, a 56-year-old rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur, is married to Ricarte and they have six children. Her oldest child is now 31 years old. She still has children who go to school. She and her husband work very hard to be able to provide for the family’s needs and sustain their children’s education.

She spends most of her time helping her husband maintain their farm. As they needed inputs for their rice farm, she applied to CEVI and asked to borrow 8,000 PHP. She will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs that she needs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Karane

texts.en:
Karane J. sells used clothes and shoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock first class clothes and bedsheets to sell.  Karane is 29 years-old and is married with a husband that is a director. She has three children and they go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Ta-Kuru Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Ta-Kuru” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariatu B. (pictured left) is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married and has three children who are attending primary school. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells cooked bulgur. With her share of this loan, she will buy bulgur wheat and cooking ingredients such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. wholesale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy bulgur wheat and cooking ingredients such as palm-oil, etc.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa P. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 23 aout 2007, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans le Banc Villageois et a 06 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement. Cette activité lui rapporte des bénéfices qui lui permettent d'épargner et d'acheter des équipements, par exemple un poste téléviseur pour la famille. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
48-year-old Awa P. is married and has 6 dependent children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois since August 23, 2007. During her three years with Banc Villageois, she has received and repaid 6 loans without any difficulty.
She makes a living selling fresh fish and this new loan will allow her to expand her inventory. Her business generates profits that allow her to set money aside and to buy equipment, for example a TV for her family. Her goal is to help her husband provide for their family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap B., who lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province, is 29 years old. She is a farmer who owns 2.2 hectares of land, where she cultivates rice to sell in order to support her family. Now she has a problem because the soil in her field is infertile and has a lot of insects. To improve production, Mrs. Pheap B. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Thea Seng, owns agricultural machinery and is a fisherman. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is studying in a local public school. The youngest is one year old. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Djiguiya (Hope) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et  au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles très variés tels, la restauration et la vente du bois de chauffe, de céréales, de légumes, de plastiques etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Fatoumata  Mallé est un membre du groupe qui vend des légumes : carottes chou, betteraves, radis, haricots vert, concombres, salades, tomates etc.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des légumes de toutes sortes au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend. Elle se procure  en légumes dans les différents coins de brousse avec les jardiniers et au marché de Koutiala. 
Pour ses activités elle a une place au cœur du marché Hamdallaye. Elle vend ses légumes en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle  constituée principalement  de femmes. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 130 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Fatoumata Mallé compte réaliser 150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women of Koutiala who know each other well and who live in traditional big families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are on average 43 years old with 4 children or more. This group of women trades in varied ways such as, a restaurant, and the sale of heating wood , cereals, vegetables, plastics etc To increase the scope of their activities, the members decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. They are on their tenth group loan and all the preceding loans were properly repaid. Fatoumata Mallé is a member of the group which sells vegetables: carrots cabbage, beets, radish, French beans, cucumbers, legumes, tomatos etc. She intends to use the loan to buy vegetables of all the kinds she sells. She gets vegetables from the surrounding countryside gardeners and at the market of Koutiala. For her activities she has a place in the middle of the Hamdallaye market. She sells vegetables retail for cash to customers made up mainly of women. While the members of the group intend to procure an average loan of 130.000FCFA each during this cycle, Fatoumata Mallé intends to borrow 150.000FCFA. In addition to repaying the loans, they use part of the income to meet current family expenses. She wishes to see this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened, to be able to diversify her products.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi D. is married to a sawmill operator and lives with her five dependents. Her educational background is senior high school.

Esi moves around Abura selling watermelon that has been cut into sizable portions and uses her income to support her husband in providing for the general welfare of the home.

Esi will use the loan to purchase more watermelon and other kinds of fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more watermelon and other kinds of fruit to sell

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso Group

texts.es: DORIS ES LA TESORERA DE LA ALCOM LUZ Y PROGRESO, QUIEN PARTICIPA DESDE HACE MAS DE DOS AÑOS, CON SUS SIETE INTEGRANTES MAS, EL GRUPO SE CARACTERIZA POR SER SOLIDARIO ENTRE ELLOS. NOS CUENTA QUE ELLA EMPEZÒ HACE TRES AÑOS A VENDER PEQUEÑOS PRODUCTOS COMO ARROZ, FIDEOS, LECHE EN UN ESPACIO DE SU CASA; AL PRINCIPIO LE COMPRABAN SOLO SUS FAMILIARES, DESPUES SUS VECINOS, POKO A POKO EMPEZO A MEJORAR SUS VENTAS Y FUE SURTIENDO EN EL TRANSCURSO DE LOS MESES, TAMBIEN SURGIO EL PROBLEMA DE BAJAR SUS INGRESOS DE VENTAS DEBIDO A QUE FIABA A  MUCHAS PERSONAS Y FUE POR ESO QUE SUS PRODUCTOS FUERON MENORANDO, SUS INGRESOS LE SIRVIERON PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA, LE HACIA FALTA EL TANQUE DE AGUA DE SU CASA, QUE ES MUY ESCENCIAL PARA COCINAR, LIMPIEZA DE SU HOGAR, EN PARTE APOYA EN EDUCACION A SUS TRES NIÑOS, QUIENES ESTUDIAN AUN EN EL COLEGIO DE EDADES 05,14 Y 16 AÑOS, EL ULTIMO PRESTAMO QUE VA A RECIBIR ES PARA COMPRAR FIERROS, ARENA, LADRILLOS, PORQUE DESEA DARLES UN MEJOR AMBIENTE Y COMODIDAD A SUS HIJOS (CUARTOS).
texts.en:
Doris is the treasurer for the Alcom Luz y Progreso group, which she's been a member of for more than two years along with six other people. The group is known for being tight-knit. Doris tells us that three years ago she began selling small products like rice, noodles, and milk from a spot in her house. At first only her relatives bought from her, and then her neighbors did. Little by little she began to improve sales and over the months the business continued to develop, but the problem also arose of her income decreasing as she extended credit to a lot of people, which diminished her inventory. Doris used her income to complete construction on her house. She didn't have a water tank, which is essential for cooking and housecleaning. She also partially supports the education of her three children, aged five, fourteen, and sixteen, who go to school. She used her last loan to buy tools, sand, and bricks because she wanted to provide a better environment and give her children more comforts (rooms) at home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, two boys and two girls, who all attend school. She is married to a businessman who supplies fruit to restaurant operators. She has been operating her business selling fresh water for five years, from home to her neighboring community. Previously she was selling soft drinks (juices). With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to open another stall and also renovate her existing stall and purchase a water pump.

 Fatuma hopes that in future she will be able to put up another tank to enable her to sell water in large quantity. She decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans and expand her business. She owns a home with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, open another stall, and renovate her old stall

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, El Buen Futuro 1 (The Good Future). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her nine children, eight of whom live with her after she raised them as a single mom. She says that her most difficult challenge is to support her nine children.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying taking care of her children.

Santa is excited to be taking out her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over eight years.  Four months ago she changed and moved her business. She started with a small butcher shop in the public market of her community. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her butcher shop and food sales (fried pork) by buying different kinds of meats. She will use the profits to repair her house and save for her future. She wants to have a better home structure and live well and quietly with her family. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to invest in her business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy meats

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg N. is from the town of Artik in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Gevorg’s goal is to provide a university education for his seventeen year old daughter and nineteen year old son.  He would also like to fulfill his wife’s dream to renovate the family home.

To meet these goals, Gevorg would like to expand his furniture production business.  He has been in this business for eleven years, running the company since his father’s retirement.  Gevorg is looking to the favorable terms and service of microfinance to invest in his business.

He wants a loan to purchase additional raw materials for the furniture business.  According to his business plan, this investment will grow his family income by twenty percent.

Gevorg is a well respected business man in Artik and enjoys living close to his extended family and friends.  The proceeds from the investment will also help Gevorg to support his parents and his brother’s family.

loans.use: the purchase of raw material

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is a trader. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She sells foodstuffs, mainly cassava, and also sells bathroom slippers. She will use the loan she will take out to further expand her business by buying more slippers for sale. She will later use the profit she will acquire from her business to cater for her kids and also help her husband to pay the utility bills and other family expenses.

loans.use: further expand her business by buying more slippers for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Rose has a charcoal selling business. She has been in this business for 5 years and works 7 days a week. Rose sells her products retail from home. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through rentals. The main business challenge(s) for Rose include transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand so that she can own a delivery van. 

Rose lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lekiremu Ole

texts.en:
Lekiremu, who is 42 years old, married to Lungat Ene Lekiremu and the father of three children, has been rearing animals for sale in Niavasha town for the last two years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy 10 calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Lekiremu hopes to buy a truck to transport his animals to the market when he wants to sell them.

loans.use: To buy 10 calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet C. is from the village of Unidos. She is 25 years old. Janet is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janet runs  a general store. Janet has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Janet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Janet is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the 14th loan taken by Janet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Z. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling generic drugs like pain relievers, anti-histamines and multivitamins in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional generic drugs like antibiotics. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, like antibiotics

loans.name: Trancito Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Transito G. es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones la misma que es muy amable y cordial.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 24, 18 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo es especial el cual está en una silla de ruedas y tiene que estar a su cuidado, sus dos últimas hijas estudian en la universidad. Su esposo labora en una carpintería, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Transito se dedica a la cría de  pollos y cuyes, actividad que desempeña hace 5 años, también se dedica a la agricultura en donde siembra hortalizas y todos sus productos los vende en su propia comunidad.

Es el segundo crédito y sus primas quienes conforman la banca comunal le han invitado, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y su alimento. Su meta es  tener un galpón de pollo más grande.
texts.en:
Señora Trancito G. is a member of the community bank Prosperidad (Prosperity). She lives in the Miraflores sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its architectural beauty. Its people maintain its culture and traditions and are kind and cordial.

This bank member is 52 years old. She is married and has children of 28, 26, 24, and 18 years of age. Her oldest daughter is married and lives indenpendently. Her second child, a son, has special needs: he is in a wheelchair and needs to be in her care. Her two youngest daughters study at the university. Her husband works as a carpenter. With their combined work as a couple, they have succeeded in constructing their own house.

Doña Trancito's work is raising chickens and guinea pigs. She has been doing this for 5 years. She also works in agriculture, planting vegetables and selling all her products in her own community.

This is her second loan. Her cousins who are in the community bank invited her to join. She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed. Her goal is to have a bigger chicken coop.

loans.use: Buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works with her husband to produce a juice that is made out of sorghum. She is 34 years old and has four children who range in age from four to 13. In the picture you can see the containers that she uses to prepare her juice. Rose has been in this business for five years.  

She has applied for a loan to buy more sorghum to turn into juice. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save money, provide food for her family and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make into a juice

loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by raising hogs, buying and selling rope, and with a veterinarian business. Her husband, Ricardo, age 44, works as a fisherman. They have four children who are between 11 and 21 years old. Almira joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Almira has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,500 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to buy medicines and vaccines for her hogs and paraphernalia so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Almira is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and vaccines for the pigs

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Juma has an electrical shop business, which he has run for less than one year.
To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electrical items, such as electrical wires, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Juma hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, he hopes to own another branch of the same business.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical items for resale

loans.name: Nhath

texts.en:
Mr. Nhath T. was born in 1961 and lives in Stueng village in Kandal province. He earns his living by selling sugar palm and palm juice. He is also a construction worker, where he is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. With both occupations he still does not earn enough income to support and improve the family's living.  He asks for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Ieng Lin, stays at home and takes care her children and her home.
This couple has five children. Two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is construction worker, and the other two are students and also help support their father's business. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika K. is 31 and married. She was born and lived in the Republic of Tadjikistan and grew up in a large family of farmers. From early childhood she had to help her parents in the field where her family cultivated tomatoes, beets and peppers. At the age of 14, Malika’s family moved to Kyrgyzstan, where they continue the business of farming.
 
In 2002 Malika got married and soon became the mother of two children. In order to find a means of subsistence for her family, she decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. With the initial capital of 5,000 KGS, she managed to develop a farm with a monthly profit of 10,000 KGS from selling meat products. Being a very purposeful and positive person, Malika works hard to support her family.

Malika plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Malika is planning to give higher education to her children and purchase a car for her family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon was born in 1955.  She is married to Mr. Chhoy who was also born in 1955. They have two children, one is a security guard at a hotel and the other is a student at the local public school.

Mrs. Phon is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows watermelon for a living. Her husband is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family.  Even with both their businesses, they still earn too small an income to support and improve their family living. Thus, in order to improve the family's condition, Mrs. Phon would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding to start a new business.  With the rest of the loan, she will buy a fishing boat for her husband.  Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy piglets for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Mariam has a medical clinic, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more medicine and beds for admitting patients.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for her family.  In the future, Mariam hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine and beds for admitting patients.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 33 years old and married, with three children who range in age from 2 to 9 years. She sells milk in her business. Her business is well-organized. She has one year of experience in her business and she works from 5 A.M. until 10 P.M. every day. Angelique currently employs two people to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of milk to sell. With the profit, Angelique will reinvest in her business and will be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of milk.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Creativas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 31años y dos hijas que estudian en un colegio primario. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ceviche, (comida preparada a base de pescado fresco, limón, ají y sal) que ofrece los días domingos de cada semana con el apoyo de su pareja y sus hijas; su capital de inicio fue de S/ 200.00  nuevos soles, el  trabajo que desarrolla le brinda muchas satisfacciones, siendo sus   principales consumidores  transeúntes, vecinos y amigos.

Con este crédito de S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación del cebiche como: pescado fresco  de la costa,  limón, sal, ají, cebolla, entre otras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de cebada y frutas de la región para la preparación de refrescos que acompañan a este sabroso plato. 

Lucila es muy alegre y trabajadora, su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de salchipapas (comida al paso) para vender por las noches en su localidad. Está agradecida con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda al  contribuir con la realización de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the ‘Las Creativas II’ Communal Bank, located in the District of Tarapoto within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 31 years old, single, and has two children in elementary school.

She works selling ceviche (a dish prepared using raw fish, lemon, hot pepper and salt) every Sunday with her partner and her daughters. She started with 200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. Her work is very satisfying for her and her main customers are people passing by, neighbors and friends.

With this loan of 800 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase supplies for making ceviche such as fresh fish from the coast, lemon, salt, hot pepper, onion, and other items. She will also invest part of the loan in barley and regional fruit to make drinks to accompany the delicious ceviche.

Lucila is very happy and hardworking. Her dream is to have a business selling hot dogs at night in her area. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support provided so that she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fresh fish from the coast, lemons, salt, hot peppers, onions, toasted corn, yucca and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Nelzon

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 32 años vive en el Municipio de Entre Ríos del trópico de Cochabamba, empezó a trabajar a muy temprana edad junto a su madre, como ayudante en la comercialización de fruta de temporada. Fue aprendiendo poco a poco, hoy en día el también comercializa.

Nelzon  se independizo a muy temprana edad, ya que su padre falleció, y tuvo que trabajar junto a su madre, posteriormente se independizo,  poco a poco siguió adelante, no le quedaba de otro que seguir trabajando duro, para salir adelante. Ya que la situación está cada vez más difícil en el país.
El crédito que solicita es para comercio de fruta de temporada, más específicamente para comprar fruta, Nelson necesita un impulso, para  seguir creciendo,  su sueño de toda su vida es comercializar al por mayor. Ahora con el crédito seguirá ampliando su capital.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Entre Río in the tropics of Cochabamba. He began to work alongside his mother selling seasonal fruit at a very early age. Bit by bit he learnt about the business and today he is a fruit seller as well. 

Nelzon became independent at a very early age after the death of his father, working with his mother to move forward with his life. Since the situation in his country is becoming increasingly difficult, he has no other option than to work very hard to get ahead.  

Nelzon needs a boost to keep expanding his business, so he is applying for a loan to buy and sell seasonal fruit. All his life he has dreamed of selling in bulk and now with this loan he can continue to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to increase his working capital to sell fruit

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim (in the photo) is 29 years old and her husband, Bunly, is 33 years old. They have been married since 2004 and just have a young daughter. The family lives in a village on National Road number two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sarim and her husband are rice farmers. They also raise pigs at home. Sarim hopes to expand her pig farming by buying more piglets. So, she is asking for her first loan of $500.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells cassava, plantain and other items at Besease, a village at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Araba has been selling cassava, plantain and other items for eight years. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband to provide the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy plantain and cassava to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest. In this picture, she is taking out some of the cassava she sells.

loans.use: to buy plantain and cassava to resell

loans.name: Gibril

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Gibril. He is married and has 4 adult children. In 2007, he established his cinema and show football matches business. He began his business after retiring from his job. Gibril decided to do such a business and has realized quite a lot from this business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL to buy chairs and benches, make repairs and extend his hall. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, he plans to get another satellite dish and decoder with multiple channels and educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy chairs and benches, and make repairs and extend his hall

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Mwalimu, a married man with four children, two of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mwalimu has operated a fruit-retailing business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He also sells vegetables. Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business, Mwalimu wants to purchase sacks of fruits to sell with a loan of Kshs 20,000. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business and dreams of expanding in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza de sus iglesias y su centro histórico, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años de edad que está estudiando en el jardín de infantes. Vive con sus padres, su papá es guardia de seguridad y su mamá labora en un restaurante de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora María es una profecional en pastelería y trabaja en un local de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. En su casa realiza pasteles pero solo bajo pedido y en sus tiempos libres ayuda en el negocio de su madre. 

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de una maquina batidora que le hace falta para realizar los pasteles en su casa. 

Su meta es tener su cafetería y pastelería.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city has cold weather and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of the beauty of its churches and its historical center. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 30 years old and a single mother of a five-year-old son who is a kindergarten student. She lives with her parents. Her father is a security guard and her mother manages her own restaurant. María does not own a home and lives with her family in a rental property.

Sra. María is a professional pastry maker and works at a shop from Monday to Friday from 6am to 2pm. When she is at home, María makes pastries only upon request. During her free time, she helps out at her mother’s business.

This is her second loan through the Communal Bank and she will invest the funds in the purchase of a mixer so that she can make pastries at home. Her dream is to open a cafeteria and pastry shop.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Reny

texts.en:
Reny is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her parent. She is a part-time teacher in an elementary school. The income from being a part-time teacher is not sufficient to fully support her family. Therefore, Reny also operates a kiosk business to generate more income.

Reny is dreaming of improving her kiosk business by adding more stock such as: rice, cooking oil, eggs, tea, milk, sugar, coffee, various beverage, etc. She is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. She really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, eggs, tea, milk, sugar, coffee, various beverages, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Quirina Gengque

texts.en:
Quirina Genggue is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 12 years old.

Quirina has been in the business of raising hogs for 5 years. She earns about 7,500 PHP per month from it. Quirina also makes banana cues and rice cakes that she sells to the people in her community.

Quirina plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed, flour and bananas. She hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: purchase pig feed, flour and bananas

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 47, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a general store in front of her house for the past 12 years. Hong lives with her two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hong sells many kinds of products in her general store such as candies, snack foods, detergents, soaps, and beverages. Hong requires a loan to buy a range of different products in bulk for her general store. This will allow her to restock her store at a lower price and increase the range of products that she offers to customers. She hopes that this will attract additional customers and increase the income of her business.

She hopes that through the loan, she will be abL. to generate sufficient additional income to further expand her business, improve her family's living conditions and save money for her sons' education fees.

loans.use: To buy a range of different products (candies, snack foods, detergents, etc.) in bulk.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío de 19 años, vive con su mamá y sus 6 hermanos, a los que quiere y aprecia. Y juntos viven en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Está joven señorita, hábil y con mucho futuro. Estudia en el instituto de bellas artes de su localidad, donde está aprendiendo a pintar hermosos cuadros, pues el arte lo lleva en las venas, ya que su familia se dedica a la artesanía. Según cuenta le falta 2 años para culminar sus estudios; pero desde ahora pinta hermosos cuadros al óleo; los cuales comercializa a buen precio. Además de dedicarse al bordado de disfraces, faldas y manteles. Ya tienen dos años emprendiendo su propio negocio y según afirma le va muy bien y cada día tienen más pedidos. Ahora ella quiere trabajar muy duro, para expandir su negocio y juntar el dinero necesario para poder estudiar la carrera de gastronomía, pues es otro de sus sueños. Como también desarrollar el arte del dibujo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura logrará concretar sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rocío de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas, hilos de colores, blondas y demás accesorios para la elaboración de los 25 disfraces que tiene como pedido.
texts.en:
19-year-old Rocío lives with her mom and her 6 siblings who she loves and is fond of.  They live together in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  This young lady is talented and has a good future ahead of her.

Rocío is currently studying at the Institute of Fine Arts in her town where she is learning to paint beautiful pictures.  She has art in her blood as her family are craftspeople.  She tells us that she has two years left until she finishes her studies but she already paints beautiful oil paintings which she sells for a good price.  In addition, she also embroiders costumes, skirts and tablecloths.  She has been working in her own business for two years.  She says that it is doing very well and that she has more and more orders every day.  Now she would like to work very hard in order to expand her business and get together the money she needs to study for a degree in cookery as this is another of her dreams.  She also wants to develop her skills in the art of drawing.

Rocío belongs to the 'Telarmachay' community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She is certain that she will manage to achieve her goals and she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  With your support, Rocío will invest the money she has requested in buying fabric, colored threads, lace and other accessories to make 25 costumes that she has orders for.

loans.use: to buy fabric, colored threads, lace and accessories to make 25 costumes

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, 28 years old, is tailor who earns $6 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns $4 per day. They have two children, and both of them are studying in school. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $20 on electricity, $40 on school fees, and $15 on transportation. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fabric to make clothes to sell. This loan can help her to continue her career and even make more income because she can buy more fabric to make clothes to sell. She plans to open a tailoring shop when she can make a good profit and can have more customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sara Cecilia

texts.es:
Sara, vive con su esposo e hijos, es casada y agricultora, ella colabora con su esposo en la siembra maíz y plátano este negocio lo comenzó por  iniciativa propia y con la ayuda de su esposo, ya hace quince años que se dedica a la agricultura y no tiene un horario establecido para atender las labores que demanda la agricultura.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos para el cultivo, como abono y herbicidas, Esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su cosecha y prevenirlo de cualquier plaga, con ello su cultivos.
La aspiracion de Sara es tener buenos resultados, que generen ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara is married and lives with her husband and children. She is a farmer, and she and her husband grow corn and plantains.  

She started this business at her own initiative, with her husband's help. She has been farming for 15 years, and doesn't have set hours for serving her customers. She is applying for the loan in order to buy agricultural supplies for her crop, such as fertilizer and herbicides. 

This purchase will help her improve her harvest and protect her crop from any pests. Sara's ambition is to have good results that generate profits; so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her crop.

loans.name: Rosa Adelaida

texts.es: Rosa Adelaida tiene 45 años, ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura que tiene ubicado en su vivienda. Trabaja todos los días de la semana los encargos que sus clientes le solicitan  cada fin de semana. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, botones, zipper, hilos, tijeras y agujas. Con la ayuda del crédito mejorara y aumentará la producción de sus prendas para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa Adelaida, 45, provides tailoring services in a shop she has at home.  She works every day of the week on customer orders placed every weekend.  She is asking for a loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, thread, scissors and needles.  With help from the loan she’ll increase production of articles of clothing to obtain improved income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, thread, scissors and needles.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chork, 49, a villager from Kompong Chhnang province, has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops for a living. She was chosen to be the leader of this group, which consists of three members. They have different purposes in using this fund: Chork and Som want to buy some piglets to raise; Ke wants to use it to buy more stocks of merchandise to sell. Chork has lived with her three children since her husband passed away. Chork will use her increase in income to support her last born child’s education. She wants to send him to  a university after he finishes high school.

loans.use: to buy some piglets to raise

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and rice per kilograms. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice to sell.

Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana,  su estado civil soltera  nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra,  vive actualmente en la zona Cañada El Carmen. Su negocio esta ubicado  en la avenida cerca de su domicilio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida (Pollos a la Broaster) hace 1 año, trabaja de lunes a domingo de horas 18:30 a 23.30. La señora demuestra ser responsable y trabajadora. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de una cocina freidora de pollos y el saldo para comprar mesas y sillas. La señora esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio, incrementar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Ana is single and was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She currently lives in Cañada El Carmen. Her business is located in the avenue close to her home. She has been selling food (Broasted chicken) for a year and works Monday to Sunday from 18:30 to 23:30. The lady has proved to be responsible and hardworking. The loan given to the lady is to buy a deep fryer for chickens and with the balance tables and chairs. The lady is very grateful to Emprender for the trust placed in her and for giving her the opportunity of growing her business, increasing her income and so improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer for chickens as a capital investment.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra, 54, is a widow with two children. She lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She plants, harvests and sells fruit to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

 Isidra has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru:
Айнагуль  проживает в селе Атбашы на севере Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Айнагуль    с мужем откармливают скот, начав этот бизнес в 2009 году. На сегодняшний день,   Айнагуль    в своем хозяйстве имеет 10 голов овец и  1 лошадь. Также, Айнагуль занимает выпечкой овощных пирожков и самс (кыргызские мясные пирожки) и продает их на воскресном скотном рынке, что также служит небольшим доходом в бюджет ее семьи.   
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Айнагуль  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и  перепродажи.    Доходы   Айнагуль планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Ainagul lives in the village of At-Bashy in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  Similar to many families living in the rural areas, Ainagul and her husband are raising livestock, which they have started in 2009. Currently Ainagul owns 10 sheep and 1 horse. Also, Ainagul bakes vegetable pirozhki (baked stuffed buns) and sams (Kyrgyzstani buns with meat filling) and sells them at a Sunday livestock market which also brings small income into her family's budget. In order to further expand her business, Ainagul  has come to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. Ainagul is planning to invest the income into building a large barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Wilma is buying and selling a variety of fish like sardines, mackerel, and trout. She is using their motorela or motorcycle in selling and delivering the fish, and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.
Wilma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc was born in 1974. She has two sons. One of them is working in the army. The other one is a worker. Her husband and she sell poultry eggs in the market to earn a living. Her husband's income is about 3,000,000 VND and Duc also earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Duc has done this job for 12 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

Duc's challenge in life and work is lacking capital to expand her business and to raise her family’s living standard. Her dream is having a more spacious house, a fuller family life,  and a larger-scale business. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. She can invest in her business to gain earnings and save profit for her family’s life. 

Duc is a hardworking woman and has a passion for business. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would again like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to retail more poultry eggs.

loans.use: to retail more poultry eggs.

loans.name: Edwin Misael

texts.es:
Edwin vive en casa familiar en compañía de sus hermanos y sobrinos, él no tiene hijos, su negocio es cultivar granos básicos, aprendió el oficio de muy joven y hoy en día lo realiza solo, con los ingresos que genera puede subsistir.
Piensa utilizar el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, con los que espera tener una producción mayor de granos básicos, si todo sale bien podrá abastecer a sus clientes de granos básicos y tendrá alimento suficiente para su familia, tiene la esperanza que las circunstancias económicas sean más favorables.
Sus objetivos son mantenerse trabajando y resarcir lo más pronto posible el crédito.

loans.use: comprar insumos agrícolas, con los que espera tener una producción mayor de granos básicos,

loans.name: Laetitia Tchotcho

texts.en:
Born on March 3rd, 1980 in Aného, Miss Laetitia Tchotcho K. is a graduate of a fashion house in Lomé. When she returned to Aného five years ago she opened her own sewing shop. She noticed that many of her clients were asking for embroidery work so she went to do some vocational training in embroidery over the last five months. Intelligent and sincere, Miss K. likes to do good work. She charms her clients by the quality of her service. Today, to be able to completely satisfy her numerous and demanding clients, she wants to equip her sewing shop with an embroidery machine and use all her talents. To do this she is asking for a loan of $700 to buy an embroidery machine to meet the new demands of her clients. This will allow her to increase her revenue and assure her financial independence.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 3 Mars 1980 à Aného, Mlle K. Laetitia Tchotcho est diplômée d’une maison de couture à Lomé. Revenue à Aného, elle a ouvert son atelier de couture il y a 5 ans. Elle a remarqué que beaucoup de ses clientes demandent à se faire broder leurs habits et elle est allée faire un stage en broderie au cours de ces cinq derniers mois. Intelligente, sincère et aimant le travail bien fait, elle séduit sa clientèle par la qualité de son service. Aujourd’hui, pour pouvoir donner une satisfaction totale à ses nombreux et exigeants clients, elle veut doter son atelier d’une machine à broder et faire valoir tous ses talents. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 pour acquérir la machine à broder afin d’être à la hauteur des nouvelles exigences de ses clients. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et d’assurer son autonomie financière.

loans.use: buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Philoude

texts.en:
Philoude has a dynamic personality that no doubt comes from raising her children, which after taking in some from her extended family, she is now responsible for ten young boys and girls. She stands out from the crowd of hundreds of merchants in the large market that closes off an entire main street through the large city of Trou-du-Nord. Her business has grown rapidly, but now Philoude needs additional capital provided by this loan to expand further so she can continue developing her business in order to make enough to feed, clothe and care for her ten children.

NOTE: Philoude is a leader of her solidarity group. She and her business represent the nine other members of this group of micro-entrepreneurs, who each will receive a share of this $1,200 loan to fund their respective businesses. As members of a solidarity group, Philoude and the other nine micro-entrepreneurs have gone through Esperanza´s business training courses and have proven to be committed to their businesses and to provide for their families. If a member of the group is unable to make a payment, the other members are responsible for making up the difference and helping the person to improve. This group-lending method creates a social support network within the community as well as an accountability system to ensure that not only are loans paid back on time, but that the loan capital is invested in developing their businesses and providing for the basic necessities of their families.

loans.use: Purchase jeans, wrap skirts, blouses, shorts and T-shirts

loans.name: Digxi Xiomara

texts.en:
My name is Digxi B., I work selling used clothing. I own my business for two years. My customers prefer to buy from me because I carry good quality clothing at a low price. But at this moment I need to increase my inventory to increase my sells and profits to pay the education of my son who is starting school and to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Digxi B. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes me prefieren ya que vendo buena ropa y a precios muy bajos, pero en estos momentos necesito tener mas inventario para tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias ya que tengo que pagar los estudios de mi hijo que esta ingresando a la escuela y tambien para la alimentacion de mi familia.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Mr. Korng I. is 68 years old and a father of 2 children. He and his wife ( picture here) own a store sellI. grocery products to the people in their community and can approximately make $2.50 each day. One of their children helps in financI. the household by workI. as a motor-taxi driver, while the other child is enrolled in school. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for the son to operate his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son to operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Embala

texts.en: Embala is 29 years old and lives in the Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz with his two children. He has been running a general store for four years and is applying for  a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods for the store. He hopes that offering more goods in his general store will help improve his income.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.es:
Sra. Aparicia started her business carrying regional products (herbs, fruits, wheat flour, beans, peas) from the Sierra region of northern Peru to Lima for sale there. Her business was going well until her oldest daughter died, the pain of which lead her to stop working for a while. Once she overcame that terrible tragedy, she opened a shop in the "ovalo" (presumably, an oval-shaped market) in her local region of Ancash in Peru. The store attracted many shoppers and is now the largest shop in the area. Sra. Aparicia is a member of the Manuela Ramos de Tinco community bank and the loans that she's received from the bank have hugely helped her to grow her business.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$332), to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy bulk supplies of 1.5-litre soft drinks, pasta, cookies, snacks, chocolates and milk.

Sra. Aparicia, 57, is married and has 4 children. Her husband raises peaches and both work hard for the good of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Aparicia inició su negocio haciendo viajes a la ciudad de Lima llevaba productos de la sierra ( hierbas, frutas, harina preparada de trigo, de haba, arveja) al cono norte de Lima. Su negocio le fue bien hasta que murió su hija mayor, este dolor hizo que un tiempo deje de trabajar, una ves superado ese dolor, abrió una bodega en el ovalo del Distrito de Tinco, Provincia de Carhuaz, Región Ancash, tuvo gran acogida por la población, hasta la fecha es la bodega mas grande del distrito. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos de Tinco, los prestamos que le otorgó esta institución le ayudó mucho para hacer crecer su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 1000.00 soles ($ 332), el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará 5 paquetes de gaseosa de un litro y medio, dos paquetes de fideos, 5 cajas de galletas, 5 tiras de chisitos (bocaditos), 2 cajas de chocolate y una caja de leche).

La señora Aparicia tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la producción de melocotones, ambos trabajan para sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Mrs. C. is a married, 45-year-old mother of two who sells pet supplies—such as pet food, vaccinations, apparel, etc.—for a living.

She has had this business for over 8 years, and she tells us that she has a steady flow of customers who purchase products from her every week.

Lucia says that thanks to this business, she can help her husband cover both the household expenses and the education of her children, who have already finished school and are now entering college.

She is requesting this loan so that she can restock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia tiene 45 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la ventas de artículos y suplementos para veterinarias como comidas para mascotas, vacunas, ropas, collares, etc.

El negocio lo tiene hace más de 8 años, y según nos cuenta la misma, posee clientes fijos que cada semana compran de ella sus productos.

Lucia dice que gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su marido a cubrir los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos quienes ya culminaron el colegio y ahora deben empezar la universidad.

Desea el crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías para reponer el stock.

loans.use: Purchase of pet food, vaccinations, shampoo, powder, collars, pet apparel, etc.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah O. is 33 years old, married with 3 children, and hails from Araromin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, and she has been in her business since 2003 and needs the loan of $275 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Thi Hao

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hao, 49 years old, has 2 children who are carpenters. Her husband passed away, therefore, she had to raise her children on her own. Fortunately, her children are loving and dutiful. Her family income is 4.4 – 5 USD/ day. These days, since her 2 children are going into the workforce, she only stays at home to breed the pigs, increasing family income. She never borrowed money from other agencies because of complicated paperwork. However, since she knows the convenience of Binh Minh CDC Microeconomic Program, she wants to borrow 150 USD to buy pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Hảo, 49 tuổi, có 2 con đang làm thợ mộc. Chồng mất, một mình chị chăm lo, nuôi dưỡng các con. Được cái, các con chị ngoan ngoãn, thương yêu mẹ và chăm lo cho gia đình. Thu nhập gia đình chị từ 70000-80000đồng một ngày. Giờ, hai con chị đã đi làm, chị chỉ cần ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu vì thấy thủ tục rất phức tạp, nhưng từ khi được biết tới sự thuận lợi của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc, chị đã vay 2006000đồng để mua cám cho lợn.

loans.use: buy pig mash

loans.name: Rajan's Group

texts.en:
My name is Rajan M. and I was born in the historic city of Harrapa, Pakistan. Currently living in Chichawatni, Pakistan, I am a mother of five children including four boys and one girl, all of whom attend a local school. My husband runs a cycle rental store and he earns $5 to $6 daily out of this business. We require a loan to help expand and improve our business, thus being able to better provide for the needs of our growing children.

I will share this loan with four other entrepreneurs including: Shahnaz B., to buy a sewing machine; Khalida I., to expand her family’s shoes business; Rabia B., to expand her tailored clothing business; and Nazia B., to buy a dairy cow. These women share practicing values of punctuality, responsibility, and solidarity.

loans.use: Expand cycle rental store

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
There are six people in Ignacio's family: his five children who are ages 15,13,12, 9, and 7 years old, and himself. Ignacio has been a widower for some time.

He collects plastics, fish baits, glass, iron, and other recyclable materials. In the marketplace, he is assessed to be a worker of mediocre competence since there are others who do the same work.

The loan he needs presently is to buy more basic material whose prices are still minimal. Ignacio already solicited other loans previously and paid them off in a punctual and responsible manner. Thus, he has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La familia de ignacio está compuesta por seis personas, sus cinco hijos que son de 15, 13, 12, 9 y 7 años respectivamente y él. Ignacio quedo viudo hace un tiempo atrás.

Se dedica a la recolección de plásticos , cebo, vidrio, fierros y otros materiales los cuales los entrega a las recicladoras. La competencia de Ignacio en el mercado es de nivel medio ya que también hay otras personas que se dedican a esta actividad.

el presente prestamo lo requiere para la adquisición de materia prima en general cuyos precios son mínimos. ignacio ya solicitó con anterioridad otros créditos los cuales canceló de manera puntual y responsable por lo que tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sindi Eli

texts.id:
Bags production, especially bags sewing has been Sindi's occupation for more than 5 years. She sews bags everyday to fulfill either orders from art-shops around her home or personal orders.

Sindi uses her own money to purchase raw materials, i.e. clothes, that she should pay Rp 15,000 per meter, which will be able to be made into 3 bags. The bags are sold Rp 25,000 each. Actually Sindi earn quite good income from the business, but nowadays, the price of the materials, i.e clothes, thread, and knit or accessories are increasing. That is why, Sindi expect to earn loan that will be used for increasing the capital of her business to keep it running.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha jahit tas yang menjadi profesi Sindi sudah dijalani lebih dari 5 tahun, dan sampai sekarang masih bertahan. Setiap hari dia menjahit tas, baik itu pesanan pribadi maupun pesanan dari artshop langganannya. Saat ini modal yang dipakai masih miliknya sendiri, diaman dia harus membali kain yang harga per meternya Rp.15.000 yang nantinya bisa menghasilkan 3 buah tas. Harga jual per tas bisa mencapai 25.000. Sebenarnya keuntungan yang didapat lumayan, tetapi saat ini semua bahan membuat tas seperti kain, benang dan hiasan/aksesoris harganya naik. Oleh karena itu dia mengharapkan mendapat bantuan pinjaman modal untuk tetap bisa meneruskan bisnisnya ini.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is fifty years old. She is married and has five children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in rice, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and other such foods on top of a table in the local market.

Through hard work, she has managed to support two of her children as they finished senior high school (and who are now preparing to enter university this year), yet her other children are still in junior high school. Despite the relative success of her business, she is convinced that her business can thrive even more with an increase in capital. As such, she is requesting a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans to increase her stock and to generate greater income. Eventually, she hopes that the expected increase in income from this particular loan will allow her to put up a decent shelter for her and her family.

Margaret belongs to the community group called God is Able Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing the stock of goods (i.e., more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans).

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara belongs to Banco Comunal Las Asucenas II, located in Jr Bellavista, block 9 post 32 in the Calleria District in the Ucayali Department. She is 47 years old and is mother to three children. With her first loan of S. 300 from Manuela Ramos, Clara invested in her beauty shop. Her shop is located in the city center and has many customers who know that Clara can provide beautiful hairstyles, as well as provide in-home services.

With this loan of S. 1,500, which will be repaid in five months, Clara will purchase shampoo, dyes, and other hair products. Clara is very charismatic and attends to all customers who come to her beauty shop. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for the backing provided.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el Jr Bellavista cdra. 9 puesto 32, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 3 hijos. Clara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en su peluquería. Su Peluquería queda en el centro de la ciudad y tiene muchos clientes que saben que Clara les hace C., peinados bonitos, ademas da sus servicios a domicilio.. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará champú, tintes y líquidos para peinados. Clara es muy carismática para atender a todos(as) sus clientes que llegan a su peluquería, para ser atendidas por ella. Y agradece a movimiento Manuela Ramos por el respaldo que le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase various items for a beauty shop.

loans.name: Devota S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Devota M.. She is married and has 4 children aged between 11 and 3. She has one dependent who lives with her because he is orphan. In 2002, Devota established her red palm oil business. Working six days a week, and 9 - 12 hours a day, she earns about US $330 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband.

Devota requires a loan in order to purchase more red palm oil in bulk. In the future, Devota plans to establish another business. She thanks you for your support. SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To purchase more red palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 30 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 1 year old. She has been a phone voucher and juice seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde tiene 30 años, es madre de un hijo, quien es sus ganas de seguir adelante, en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida, los lleva a vender por los alrededores de su zona, dejándolos a crédito o al contado. Clotilde   y su pareja Reynon trabajan juntos, ambos se esfuerzan por brindar a su hijo lo necesario, esperando que en el mañana sea un hombre de bien y útil a la sociedad.  Clotilde quiere seguir surgiendo en este negocio, por eso que decidió comprar más de estos productos y una vitrina para exhibirlos, en adelante, le gustaría ser exportadora minoritaria, por ello requiere de un préstamo para realizar su meta.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 30 years old and is the mother of 1 child who is the reason why she wants to continue moving forward. Currently, she sells beauty products from a very well-known cosmetics line in and around the area she lives in. She sells for cash or credit. Clotilde and her partner, Reynon, work together, both putting in their best efforts to provide their child with every necessity, hoping that in the future he'll be a good and useful person in society. Clotilde wants to continue growing her business, that's why she decided to buy more beauty products and a window to display them. In the future, she'd like to be a small exporter. She requires a loan to realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up her business and buy a window to display her products.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Maria tiene 32 años y 1 hijo de 2 años. 
Maria tiene un bodega en la casa de su padre, empezó hace 3 años. Empezó  vendiendo  solamente gaseosas pero fue  aumentado su negocio poco a poco y ahora vende mas productos gaseosas, golosina, arroz, azúcar, etcétera. Maria trabaja sola, su esposo se fue a Argentina para buscar trabajo. Con su negocio apoya a su padre y hermana con quien ella vive. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería productos diversos, (golosinas, abarrotes).
Maria sueña con aumentar su negocio y también  poner un librería.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Mar del Plata. Maria is 32 years old and has a two year old son. She has a grocery store in her father's home which she established 3 years ago. She started selling only soft drinks but started slowly expanding her business and now sells more products such as candies, rice, sugar, etc. Maria works alone since her husband left for Argentina in search of work. With her business she supports her father and sister whom she lives with. Maria needs a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in various merchandise (candies, groceries). Maria dreams of expanding her business and also of opening a bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in various merchandise for grocery store.

loans.name: Razia Mai M.azam Group

texts.en:
Razia Mai baji is a 52-year-old lady and resides in a city named Shah Rukn, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 50 years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. All of her sons are involved in a food-selling business. Both of her daughters stay at home and do household work.

Razia baji’s husband is a mason by profession with an experience of 30 years. Razia baji herself has a decorative embroidery business. She does embroidery on scarves and sells them in cloth markets, earning US$ 3 per scarf. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy mason's tools for her husband.

She is the group leader of several more members from her locality. Khamir baji wants a loan to buy seeds to re-sell. Ameeran baji wants a loan to buy tools for agriculture. Allah Jeevai baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Kaneeza baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for delivering loads.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mr. Sang S. is 22 years old and is married to Yan Srey Mom, 26. They are residents of Kandal Province. The young couple makes a living working for a garment factory as garment workers. They currently get a salary of US$ 180 per month. They both are responsible for one young child who is attending school.

The young couple's living conditions are not so good because their house is so old and small for them. Therefore, Sang S. and Yan Srey Mom decided to request a loan to use as capital plus their savings to purchase house equipment to repair and decorate their house. The loan will help their family's life be a little more comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase house equipment

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
S. was born in 1960 and is a widow. She currently lives with two children in Kandal Province of Cambodia. Both of her children are single; one of her single sons' name is Moeung Sok, who is employed as an accountant supervisor for a company.

She works as a staff member of MARISTOP Organization, and currently gets a salary of $200 per month. S. needs a $1200 loan to buy a motorcycle to use for riding to work, and the remainder of the loan will be used to decorate her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for riding to work

loans.name: Shaja Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Shaja M. is the group leader of the Shaja M. group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Arafa and Hamyra want to receive a loan for their tailoring business. They want to buy two new machines for their business.  Makhtar Ahmad  wants to receive a loan for his general store. He wants to buy necessary material for his business and complete his stock. Shaja M. wants to receive a loan for his fruit cart business. 

They want to say that these loans will be used in full for growing their businesses. They all want to thank Kiva for its efforts in Afghanistan to support poor people.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Paska

texts.en:
Paska E. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Paska is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a fire-brigade militant. She has three children, who all go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her beer-selling business and build a house for rental purposes

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 51 years old and lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has owned a grocery store for seven years, and has requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad went into the grocery business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. When he first started his store, he didn’t have the necessary start-up capitA.. Mohamad is successful in his work because he knows how to treat his customers, who include friends and neighbors amongst others. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Olga Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Olga Elvira U. D. Z. tiene 51 años, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo, abandono la carrera debido a que se caso y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 01 hijo que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
