Olga se dedica a la venta D. menú y tiene una bodega en sociedad con su cuñada, inicio su bodega hace 4 años con algunos abarrotes que ha ido ampliando poco a poco, hace 2 años se dedica a la venta D. menú y desayuno, negocio que le da muchas ganancias y que le han permitido comprar utensilios y ollas para su negocio el mismo que desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. insumos para la preparación D. alimentos para su bodega y para la venta D. menú.
Olga tiene el gran sueño D. construir su casa y que su hijo sea profesional.
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Elvira U. D. Z., 51, lives in AA.HH Aurora Díaz district of Salaverry, in the Trujillos province, in the La Libertad department of Perú. She studied to be an Executive Secretary, but she left that career because she got married and became a housewife. She has a son who is economically dependent upon her. Olga sells menu style foods, and she has a store with her sister-in-law. She started her store 4 years ago with some groceries, and little by little she has been expanding the business. Two years ago she started selling menu items and breakfast. This business has produced good earnings. It has allowed her to buy utensils and pots for the business, which she runs in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN from her community bank, “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, she bought groceries to stock her store. With a loan of 1200 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy supplies for food and menu item preparation. She will then sell the food she prepares. Olga has the big dream of building a house and that her son becomes a professional. She belongs to the mothers' club in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn J. O. is a 30-year-old mother of four children. Her husband died four years ago, and she is now raising the children on her own. She lives in a Nylanda slum where she sells tomatoes and small fish called Omena. Rosalyn's goals are to continue to raise her children, send them to school, and feed them properly. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to increase her stock.  

Rosalyn recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To increase stock of her fish selling business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim baji operates a business making paranda. Paranda is an item which is worn by women to tie their hair. Its use has become fashionable. People buy this item as gifts for others. Shamim baji is the wife of L. A. who owns a two-room brick house. They have been living there for the past 15 years. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy materials like colored thread and beads for her paranda business.

loans.use: To buy material for making paranda

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Natividad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Shatojinas Laboriosas”, vive en el Barrio San Martin, Distrito de Shatoja, Provincia El Dorado. Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 01  hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Natividad, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas y nos comenta que le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Ella manifiesta que esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me da  Manuela Ramos  de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Natividad belongs to the “Shatojinas Laboriosas” Communal Bank and lives in the San Martin neighborhood, Shatoja district in the province of El Dorado, which is in the San Martín department. She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and is the mother of one child who she still supports. Natividad is a happy, persevering and capable woman. She works selling used clothing and she tells us that it is going very well for her as she already has clients who know her and her business. She is characterized by her strength and perseverance, which have helped her to grow independently as a woman and she is very proud of what she has achieved. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, she will buy more clothing merchandise to vary her stock such as: pants, shorts, blouses in all sizes and models, polo shirts and dresses for adults and girls. She reports that she is very proud of what she has accomplished and she did it with great enthusiasm and optimism. She says: I am thankful for the opportunity that Manuela Ramos gives me to count on the loans that help me to develop as a woman and a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothing in quantity

loans.name: Mercury

texts.en:
Mercury G. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Mercury is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercury owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling charcoal. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling charcoal products in the local community. Mercury has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercury joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercury is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional charcoal to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercury from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang S., 27, does handicraft work weaving baskets for sale. She can make around 10 sets of baskets a day using tools to weave. She also provides her finished products to her husband to sell door-to-door in the community. This couple was married years ago, but they have no child yet. Eang S. is taking out her loan to order additional raw materials to weave baskets.

Note: Mrs. Eang S. was not available at the time, so her husband is shown in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To order additional raw materials to weave baskets

loans.name: Rizia

texts.en:
Rizia is a member of the Ushirikiano borrowers group.  She is 46 years old and a mother of two.  Her children are aged 13 and 10.  She also cares for other two dependents.

Rizia started her own cafe business selling food 10 years ago.  She works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings (about $225 US).

This is Rizia's first loan from BRAC Tanzania.  She requests the amount of 200,000 shillings in order to buy more rice and wheat for her business. With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rizia hope to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and wheat for her cafe

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng R., age 51, is a widow and has four children. She lives with her children in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling a kind of tools to tie the cows and buffaloes, typically earning a gross income of US $10 per day. She has to travel far away from her home to operate her business, and mostly she is able to generate maximum income in the outskirt of the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, R. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, R. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase more products, a purchase that she sees a great opportunity to resell them for more income to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing ties of animals to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeun Tep Group Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeun T. is a group leader of five members who all live in Tnaot village in Takeo province. She is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she has many requests, but she does not have enough silk to meet customers' demands. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Vuth Horn, is a rock breaker. Mrs. Saroeun T. is 43 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are weavers, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest of whom is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy silk to make more cloth to meet customer demand

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae D. C., 19, is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. Cherry Mae is married and has a small child.  To make a living, she recently started her own business venture in the services sector, transporting passengers from the local community.

In 2009, Cherry Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Now she is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services that her business is providing.  This will be Cherry Mae's first loan from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it even further. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of materials needed to expand the services provided

loans.name: Filda's Group

texts.en:
Y. Filda, 28 years old, is married and has four children between the ages of three and 13. She also helps to take care of her parents in the village.

For six years, Filda has run a business selling high-quality clothes and cosmetics in Buikwe. From this work, she is able to make about 80,000 UGX a week in profits. Before she began to receive loans, Filda sold only cosmetics, but now she also sells clothes because she has the capital to do so. This in addition to her friendly disposition has won her many customers and hence more profits. She has a dream of becoming a wholesaler as well as building a residential house for her children.

At the moment, Filda needs a loan to be able to add more capital to her business, since she used some of the money from the business to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale in her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda G. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business in the retail sector operating a variety store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell from her variety store

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha P. is 29 years old. He lives in Preak Sam Raung Village in the Kandal Province. He is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. His wife, Mrs. Van Ny, is employed in a garment factory.

Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to resell. This will allow him to earn more income to support his family's livelihood.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to resell

loans.name: Nen

texts.en: Mrs. Nen C. lives in Ping Pong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support the rice field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seed. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Theourn, is a laborer who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Nen C. is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Serifat

texts.en:
Serifat sells foods, like yams, garri (cassava flakes) and rice, in her shop in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for 6 years. She is happily married with 5 children and she is 45 years old.

Serifat is a client of the Lift above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and throughout Africa. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more food to sell. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Jorge Rudi

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge Rudi vive en la comunidad de san Carlos perteneciente a Santa Rita, El vive con su esposa, ella  es empleada quien colabora a su esposo en los gastos de la familia. Ambos quieren emprender un nuevo negocio con el crédito solicitado, quieren utilizarlo para la compra de chanchos para la cría.

El cliente esta agradecido con la institución por la confianza depositada.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Rudi lives in the community of San Carlos which belongs to the municipality of Santa Rita. He lives with his wife. She works and helps her husband with family expenses. They both want to start a new business with the loan money. They hope to use it to purchase pigs and breed them. He is thankful for the trust placed in him by this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Omar Abel

texts.es:
el sr Omar Abel A. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre con Deysi Yamileth Avila,  
tiene 04 hijos. Su compañera de hogar trabaja en una empacadora de camaron y el vende productos de uso personal, tambien vende controles remotos universales para televisores, extensiones electricas, focos, baterias. estos productos los vende en el Amatillo frontera con El Salvador, tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus productos son vendidos ya que muchas personas que viajan necesitan de este tipo de mercaderia. esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Omar Abel A. is 33 years old. He lives in common law marriage with Deysi Yamileth Avila. He has four children. His partner at home works in a shrimp packing plant and he sells personal products. He also sells universal remotes for televisions, extension cords, lightbulbs, and batteries. He sells these products on the Amatillo border with El Salvador. He has little time to spend on this type of activity. His products sell because many people who travel need this type of merchandise. He is asking for the loan to purchase more merchandise wholesale and thus have more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of toothpaste, toothbrushes, creams, razors, soap.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha P. is 52 years old and she lives in Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. Her husband, Sang Soun, is laborer in the local village. Pha lives with her husband and five children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, three of whom are students at the local school, while the fifth child is a farmer. Pha is a rice middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell for better income. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira, a 35-year-old married mother of two children, opened a small business seven years ago selling perfumes, accessories and beauty products. This work provides extra revenue for her family. Today, Samira is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more merchandise to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 32 years old, married with two children.  Her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  Judith rents a one roomed house where she stays with ten people.  There is electricity and piped water at home.  The family gets three meals a day.  Judith resides and works seven days a week in a semi-urban area located in the outskirts of Kampala in Busega.  

Judith sells second hand clothes and receives at least 20 customers a day.  Besides this clothing business Judith is a teacher in a nearby school.  Judith has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her eleventh loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.use: Buy bales of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Farawa

texts.en:
Farawa C. is 31 years old and married to a businessman. She has four children who all go to school. C. is currently in the business of selling rice and beans in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and rice. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant and purchase more tables and chairs.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and rice

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 26 years old and he is still single.  Jean de Dieu owns a grocery store and this is his second successful year in this business. His business is open from early in the morning until late in the evening every day.

Although Jean de Dieu has been in this business for about two years, his original investment is still too low to earn enough profit from his sales.  To end this, Jean de Dieu is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can add cakes, cookies, and some other pastries.  In addition, he will sell foodstuffs like rice, different types of flour, sugar etc.  With this expansion, Jean de Dieu will be able to continue his life with a successful business.  The savings from additional profits that are not reinvested in his business will allow him to build his future.

loans.use: To purchase cakes, cookies, and some other pastries to resell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 41 years old, married to Lucy Njeri and they have three school-going children. He runs a cleaning and upholstery business in Naivasha town and this business is three years old. It has been very profitable and he has seen a potential for growth. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He had earlier taken out a loan of Kshs 30,000 which he repaid well and on time. He plans to buy a vacuum cleaner and buffing machine to make his work easier.

As demand for his services grow, he plans to employ other people to help him with the work in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a vacuum cleaner and a buffing machine

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel L., a 40-year-old mother of two, is a rice grower and sari-sari store owner from Trento Agusan del Sur, using her income to provide for her family's needs. She started her livelihood in 2005 and is working hard to realize her dream of having a bigger farm. Raquel is now requesting a loan of Php 11,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest and additional merchandise for her store.

loans.use: Farm supplies and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise operates a general merchandise shop in Nairobi where she sells music and video cassettes and tapes as well as household products and utensils. She previously sold electronics and clothes until 1998 when she began her current business. She has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her inventory of music and video tapes and household items. She is a member of Yes We Can Self Help Group whose members guarantee each other’s loans. A mother of three children aged between twelve and one and a half years, Loise hopes to provide a comfortable life for her children and buy a house. She describes herself as hard working.

loans.use: To add inventory

loans.name: Ange

texts.fr:
Jeune homme couturier   de 46 ans , célibataire avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l’age varie entre 8 et 5 ans, il est  dans la couture il y a plus de 15 ans , il excelle dans la couture dame et la broderie pour lui c’est très rentable parce que les dames sont les meilleures de ses clients.

Des que le prêt lui sera octroyé , il va acheter des pagnes en gros , des métrages et fourniture de couture comme des rouleaux de doublures , lots de fermetures, dentelles… pour coudre  des robes et chemises  prêt a porter a vendre au lieu d’attendre les commandes des clients. 
 
Dans ses projets d’avenir il a l’intention d’ouvrir un grand atelier de Coupe Couture et Formation  déjà qu’a l’heure actuelle il a  trois (3) couturières  qui sont en formation chez lui.
Faire beaucoup plus d’épargne selon lui ; est l’une des stratégies pour qu’il puisse accroître son activité, certes les commandes sont multiples mais il s’efforce toujours de respecter  les délais  avec ses clients pour ne pas les décourager
texts.en:
This young man, 46, is a tailor and single but raising three children whose age varies from 8 to 5 years. He has been a tailor for 15 years and excels in sewing women's clothing and doing embroidery, which brings in a good deal of income since women are among his best customers. As soon as he receives his loan, he intends to buy lengths of African print cloth wholesale, other cloth by the meter, and sewing notions such as bolts of lining material, packs of zippers, lace, etc., to use to make dresses and shirts ready-to-wear, to display for sale instead of waiting for orders from customers. Among his plans for the future, he intends to open a big workshop of cutting, sewing, and training and right now he already has three seamstresses who are in training with him. He says that being able to put aside more in savings will allow him to grow his business. He does get a lot of orders but he works hard at getting them ready on time so as not to discourage the customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing supplies, African print cloth and other fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. lives in Trapeang Kabbas village in the Takeo province. She is 26 years old. She owns a general store in the local village and can earn some money from selling groceries to support her family. Her husband Mr. Rort Mony is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land on which to cultivate rice to sell. 

Now Mrs. Mom N. has a problem because her family does not have a motorbike to use to support all her family’s business. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Mom N. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru:
Nazar D. jivet v qorode Baku. On nedavno obruchilsya . Emu 26 let. On jivet so svoyey materyu i smotrit za ney. Ve tom biznese on uje 5 let. Etot maqazin bil maqazinom eqo otca. S detstva on pomoqal pape a seychas etot maqazin stal eqo maqazinom.

Nazar teper nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit noviy tavari dlya mitya posud i odejdi, takje iz za toqo chto u nas mnoqo pokupayut ris takje xotel on kupit ris. Kaka vi videte v eqo maqazine malo produkta on xotelbi za schet kredi ta uvelichit doxodnost i kliyentov v maqazine.
texts.en:
Nazar D. lives in Baku. He is recently engaged. He is 26 years old. He lives with his mother and takes care of her. He has been doing this business for five years. His store belonged to his father. Since childhood, he helped his father there, and now the store is his. Nazar now needs 2000 AZN to buy new goods such as dish washing supplies and clothes. Additionally, since many people locally buy rice he would like to buy rice as well. As you can see, his store has too few products and he wants to take out a loan to increase his income and the number of customers in his store.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy new products

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa D. sells secondhand bed sheets at Abura. Adjoa has been through junior high school. She is married and takes care of six children. Her husband is a mortuary attendant.

Adjoa has been dealing in secondhand goods for four years now. Her loan will be used to buy bales of secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new revenues from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bales of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba B. is from the village of Turod. She is 30 years old. Melba is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Melba runs a general store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Melba joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melba is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Melba from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Marcely

texts.en:
Marcely D. is from the town of Banga. She is 30 years old. Marcely is married and has two children, aged seven and one. Marcely owns and operates a rice farm. Marcely has been engaged in her business for over nine years.

Marcely joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Marcely has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marcely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marcely from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: The Women´s Bank ¨women Of Faith¨ Group

texts.en:
The name of this group translates as The Women´s Bank ¨Women of Faith.¨ The nine women members live in Pococi, Limon, located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. 

This will be the group's first loan with Fundación Mujer. The members of this group were referred to Fundación Mujer by an acquaintance in a nearby village who had had a positive experience with the organization in the past. The name of this group, ¨Women of Faith¨ was chosen by the members and to them, it signifies that each member is a woman of faith  who is optimistic and confident that she will be successful in her endeavours.  These entrepreneurs feel that with hard work and dedication, they will have great success. 

During the Women´s Empowerment classes (which accompany the issuance of all loans granted from Fundación Mujer to groups of this size), the members of this group displayed exceptional interest in learning how best to manage their micro-businesses. They have acquired skills that provide a solid foundation on which to launch a small business in a way to maximize revenue and reduce costs. Additionally, the women who have been elected to the Board of Directors (Secundina, Yorleny, Carmen and Angela) possess a wealth of knowledge  and experience acquired by working with  women´s groups. This wisdom will surely be valuable as this group moves forward. 

The women of this group are involved mainly in two types of productive activities : pig rearing and the production of bread and tamales. Each individual member will receive 150,000 Colones  to invest in her business as she sees fit. The women involved in pig rearing will use this loan to purchase piglets as well as animal feed. The women involved in food production will use this loan to purchase raw materials necessary for bread and tamale production. Tamales are a staple Costa Rican food eaten all year round and especially around Christmas time.  

Secundina B. C. is a 54-year-old mother of 5 who lives with her husband and two children in Pococi. She is also the elected president of this group. Secundina plans to use this loan to invest in ingredients to make bread and tamales which she will sell in her community. She starts selling her products in the street at 8 AM every day, and she works until everything is sold.  A main obstacle for Secundina and other members of this group has been a lack of access to working capital, the high cost of raw materials, and difficulty securing a consistent market for her (their) goods.  Secundina´s main goal is to secure a fixed market for her goods, so as to secure a steady flow of income and to allow her to spend more time producing goods instead of spending so much time selling her products in the street. 

Secundina admits there are advantages and disadvantages to the group lending model. She says that the model allows women who would otherwise be denied a loan, the ability to secure startup capital. This is because many women in the Pococi community do not know anyone with a constant salary who can act as a guarantor. This debilitating factor is overcome by the group model, whereby each member acts as a guarantor for other group members. Secundina notes that a disadvantage of her group is that she fears some of the members may have trouble repaying their loans, but she is nevertheless a ¨Woman of Faith.¨

loans.use: For the purchase of piglets, animal feed, and raw materials for bread making.

loans.name: Kyosimba Onanya Kibuga Group-Mpigi

texts.en: Fort-eight year old N. Gertrude belongs to Kyosimba group-Mpigi.  It is with persuasion from a close friend that she took up the gauntlet to start this clothes sales business. Her business has now lasted 15 years and she envisages even better prospects with the acquisition of this loan, as she will be able to resell more and make more profit. She was, prior to this, a hairdresser, and in a week, her profits equate to 550,000 shillings. With this loan this happy go lucky and amiable mother of 9 is anticipating going on a buying spree. With more clothes purchased she says she will be able to resell more.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Maria tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio, la experiencia ha sido muy agradable. Las ganas de sobrevivir y mantener a su familia es lo que hacen que Lesbia se levante muy temprano, para atender a sus clientes.  A pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa como es la competencia que existe pero no todas ofrecen el mejor servicio que ella proporciona. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes  y pan. Ella sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida para proporcionarles lo necesario.
texts.en: Sra. Lesbia Maria owns a corner shop that she operates from her house.  This isn't the first time that she has borrowed money for her business and she likes the benefits of borrowing.  Her need to support her family is the reason that Lesbia gets up every day to tend to her customers.  Despite the challenges she faces, she perseveres, and even though there is a lot of competition in the market, she has succeeded by providing excellent service to her customers.  She will use this loan to buy snacks, cold drinks, detergents and bread.  Her greatest hope is for a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Verónica de 25 años, tiene una tienda mixta panadería/víveres. Vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Inicio obteniendo dinero como comerciante de Cd, poco a poco le comenzó a gustar el ser comerciante así que decidió que con sus ahorros tendría una panadería, pero con la ayuda de su mama pudo comprar víveres y convertir una su panadería en una tienda mixta de venta de víveres y panadería, desde hace tres años viene trabajando desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h30 todos los días. Vende cada pan a $ 0.10c/u, y los víveres como la libra de arroz a $ 0.35c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, lácteos, enlatados, arroz para su tienda mixta. En el futuro agrandar el local y surtir mas la parte de la panadería.
texts.en:
Veronica, 25, has a bakery / general store. She lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urban area in which most of inhabitants are street vendors).

She started earning money as a CD (compact disc) trader, little by little she began to like being salesperson and decided that with her savings she would have a bakery. With the help of her mother, she was able to buy food as well and covert the bakery into a general store combination.  For the last 3 years she has worked from 7:00 am until 9:30 pm everyday.  She sells bread at $0.10 each and food provisions such as rice at $0.35 per pound.

With the loan she wants to buy flour, milk, canned goods and rice for her general store. In the future, she would like to enlarge the store and expand the bakery.

loans.use: Flour, canned goods and rice

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married Lebanese man who is the main income provider for his household. He has seven years of experience working with tires. Since 2008, he has been running his own tire shop where he sells new tires and repairs old tires. He works independently in his business and has built a good reputation and become well known in his town. 

This man is requesting a loan of $1200 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new wholesale tires to sell. In the future, he would like to continue to expand his business and increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase tires

loans.name: Joeylynda

texts.en:
Joeylynda C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old. Joeylynda is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is only 3 years old. Joeylynda is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells in her community. It is her family's source of income so she works hard to keep their farm productive. Joeylynda has been engaged in farming for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Joeylynda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joeylynda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Joeylynda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is from the village of Caputol, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia runs a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from operating a retail store in the local community.

Aurelia has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. Aurelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Aurelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital of her Business

loans.name: John

texts.es: John, de 19 años, es un joven emprendedor con aspiraciones de triunfar en la vida, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Este joven emprendedor, decidió independizarse y ayudar en la economía de su hogar, es así que sus días de semana se dedica a vender ropa, que por medio de pedidos se abastece de dicha mercadería, de igual manera trabaja con su motocarro, ofreciendo el servicio de transporte a sus vecinos. Pero el fin de semana se dedica al alquiler de luces sicodélicas, que tiene mucha demanda en los eventos como: quince años, aniversarios. De esta manera se ha propuesto salir adelante y apoyar la educación de sus hermanos; que aún son menores. Él es amante de todo tipo de trabajo que se presente y su anhelo es tener un negocio bien constituido. Accede al primer crédito con MFP, y hace compromiso de cumplir oportunamente las cuotas, de esa manera adherirse a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cables para luces, y llantas para su moto carro, en el que continuará ofreciendo servicio de transporte.
texts.en: John is 19 years old. He is a young business owner with great aspirations in life. He lives with his parents but his greatest wish is to improve the quality of their life. He decided to set out on his own and to contribute to the household finances. During business days he sells clothing, usually by taking orders for such items. He also has a motorcycle rickshaw and he offers transportation services to his neighbors. On the weekends he manages another business, renting lighting for special events, such as: sweet sixteen parties and anniversaries. He has set his mind on reaching his goals and to help pay for his younger siblings' education. He loves any work opportunity that presents itself and his goal is to have a well-established business. He requests a first time loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to making his payments on time, to ensure he will be able to access future loans. The loan he requests now will be used to purchase lighting cables and tires for his rickshaw, with which he will continue to offer transportation services.

loans.use: To purchase tires and lighting cables.

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
Casimiro vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas. La ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
 
Casimiro se dedica a la fabricación de artículos confeccionados de materiales textiles como por ejemplo ropa de vestir, ternos, etc. Hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va regular. Casimiro que espera recibir S/.500 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar materiales como por ejemplo telas, botones, hilos y muchas cosas más.

Casimiro pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Casimiro lives with his wife and three children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department, 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is a delightful city which dates back to Inca times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Casimiro makes items from textiles such as, for example, clothes, suits, etc.  He has been in this business for several years and it is going ok.  Casimiro hopes to receive 500 Peruvian soles.  He will use this money to increase his business capital and buy materials such as, for example, fabric, buttons, threads and many other items.

Casimiro is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials such as, for example, fabric, buttons, threads and many other items

loans.name: María Fidelina

texts.es:
María Fidelina tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio en donD. ofrece en venta artículos D. oficina y productos D. belleza. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido a la calidad D. atención que brinda y al tiempo que tiene trabajando en el rubro. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Fidelina is 52 years old and married.  She lives with her family in the agricultural district of TambogranD..  This zone has a semitropical climate, and is mainly known for producing fruits like mangos and lemons.  It belongs to the Piura province, which is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small establishment in her home where she sells office products and beauty products.  The business is well-received due to the quality of service she provides and the amount of time she has been working in this field.  This business activity allows her to help her family with the daily finances.

María wishes to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to be able to satisfy her current demand.  In order to do this, she has seen the necessity of requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles, which will help her achieve her objective.

loans.use: To get more merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed K. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Mohammed has a grocery shop business, which he has run for less than one year.
To help expand his business, Mohammed has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as food, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Mohammed hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more items (such as food) for resale

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea E. is from the village of Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 25 years old. Lea is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Lea owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

location.town: Brgy. Model Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Jonaldine

texts.en:
Jonaldine B. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Jonaldine is single. To make a living, Jonaldine owns & operates a business venture selling fish in the market. Jonaldine has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jonaldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonaldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jonaldine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jonaldine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Marco Fermin

texts.es:
Marco, es un joven de 24 años de edad, reside en  Santa María, departamento de Usulután, esta casado, vive junto a su esposa, su madre, aun no tienen hijos, en el hogar solamente él trabaja, posee un taller de enderezado y pintura, comenzó a trabajar como empleado en talleres, luego decidió instalar su propio taller el cual no tiene un horario especifico para atender.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos para el taller, esta compra es muy importe para realizar su trabajo diario, ya que de ellos depende la rapidez y calidad del servicio prestado a los clientes.

El objetivo de Marco es ampliar el taller, aumentar la clientela, y vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Marco, 24, lives in Santa María, Usulután Department.  He’s married and lives with his wife and his mother; they don’t have children yet.  He is the only one who works in his home.  He has a Body Shop.  He started out as an employee of shops but then decided to open up his own shop.  He does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the shop.  This is a very important purchase for him in order to do his daily work because the speed and quality of service provided to customers depends on them.

Marco’s goal is to expand the shop, increase customers and to live in better conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Hâm

texts.en:
Hâm P., age 51, is a local farmer in Kompong Cham province. Her husband works as a motor taxi driver.  Together they earn 3.50 dollars per day to use for the family’s needs.  Besides her farming business, Hâm P. also sells vegetables to earn extra income.  The most imporant factor in their success is that this couple always pay attention in their work and are also very friendly. 

Hâm P. has four children, the oldest is married.   Two of their children are factory workers who receive wages of 80 dollars per month.  Hâm P. used this loan for US$800 to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables to sell, and by buying a trailer to connect to her motorcycle to pick up items to sell in the local market.  She hopes this loan will make their living easier than before. 

Hâm P. and her young child are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell and to buy a trailer to transport her products to the market.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat M. N. is a businessman who operates a boutique. He has employed one person in his business, which is two years old. He earns KES 17,000 per month from his job where he works as a mechanic.  

He was previously selling bananas for a living. He hopes to establish a wholesale business within five years. With 50,000 KES, he will buy bags and second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy bags and second-hand clothes

loans.name: Leonce

texts.en:
Leonce is 35 years old and is married with two children of his own, ages 4 and 7 years, and three adopted children. He makes a living as the owner of a clothing store.  His business is well organized, and he employs one person to help him. Leonce has ten years' experience and works from 8am until 8pm every day.
 
Leonce's business is currently too small to satisfy his customers. To remedy this, he has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. in order to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell. He hopes to increase the number of his customers as well his profits. If successful, Leonce will save for the future and  satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and married with five adult children. She is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling vegetables like squash, cabbage, spices and tomatoes in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

Editha joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This is the first loan that Editha has requested from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió  hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.
Su préstamo anterior, que fue por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio venta de prendas de vestir.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará un fardo de ropa  de segunda mano que contiene: medias, chompas, casacas, dice que lo compra y lo vende en la ciudad de  Puno.  Trabaja junto con su esposo quien también realiza servicio de mototaxi (transportista). 
Su sueño es tener más mercaderías y mejorar el negocio.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones  porque es una distracción.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the “3 de Mayo” comunal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 40 years old and she has 2 chilren. She studied through the 3rd year of secondary school.

She used her previous loan, which was for PEN 300.00, to invest in her business of selling clothing items. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years. 

She will use this new loan, in the amount of PEN 500.00, to buy a bale of second-hand clothing that contains: socks, sweaters, and jackets. She says she will buy it and sell [the clothing] in the city of Puno. She works with her husband, who also works as a motorcycle taxi driver.

Her dream is to have more merchandise and improve her business.

What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings because they are a nice distraction.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is married. Her husband has four buffaloes at his home. He sells their milk to customers in the community and to milk shops. Zahra is a housewife who stays at home and carries out her household duties. But in her spare time, she also helps her husband to take care of the buffalo. Zahra is a mother of three sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting an education.
Zahra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to help her husband to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo, which will allow him to get more milk and sell in larger quantities. This will provide a better income. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Zahra hopes that an investment will bring better profits to him and help her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como ser: fideos, azúcar, arroz y demás productos para su tienda; con la venta de estos productos cubre los gastos de su familia. La señora vive en casa propia  con su hija menor  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz; es separada  y tiene dos hijos pero el mayor ya es casado. Juana cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, pues es cliente antigua desde al año 2006.
texts.en: Juana has a general store.  The loan she needs is to buy products such as:  noodles, sugar, rice and other items for her store; with the sale of this merchandise, she covers her family’s expenses.  She lives in her own house with a minor daughter, and it is located in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone in the city of La Paz; she is separated and also has two sons, but the oldest is already married.  Juana finds herself very satisfied with the loans that have been granted to her previously, as she has been a client since 2006.

loans.use: buy noodles, sugar, rice and other supplies for her general store.

loans.name: Ñañopytyvomba Group

texts.es:
El comité Ñañopytyvomba se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité trabajan activamente, en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Sra. Dolores es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de sabanas, frazadas, fundas, edredones y demás, desde hace ya unos años. Todos los vecinos del barrio ya la conocen y gracias a eso ha podido hacerse de una gran clientela. Este trabajo la ha ayudado a salir adelante, ya que genera un poco mas de ingresos y esta pudiendo solventar todos los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de sabanas, edredones, colchas y demás, para poder aumentar la variedad de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
The Ñañopytyvomba committee was formed by several neighbors from the town of Santaní.  All the members of the committee work actively, in an environment of cooperation and respect.  The members formed a very united group which is capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit.

Dolores is a saleswoman who has been selling sheets, bedspreads, pillowcases, comforters, etc. for some years.  All her neighbors know her and, thanks to this fact, she has been able to form a good customer base.  This work has helped her to get ahead since she makes a little extra income and is able to cover all her household expenses.

Dolores is requesting a loan to buy sheets, comforters, bedspreads, etc. so that she can increase the variety of merchandise she sells.

loans.use: Compra de sabanas, edredones, colchas y demás.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and works with the local Chogoria hospital as well as carrying out farming. She has been in active farming for the last 10 years with her produce of bananas, maize, beans and eggs being sold to the local market. She is married with three children. Two of the children are still in school. 

Philis has requested a loan of 55,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This is Philis' second loan from Juhudi. Her first loan was for 35,000 KES. She says the income will help her to educate her children and expand her farming acreage, especially that of bananas.

She says pests and poor markets for the farm are the major challenges. She is happy with Juhudi loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia  is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Virginia  has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods & sacks of rice for retailing per kilogram.

Virginia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virginia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & sacks of rice for retailing per kilogram.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  Betty has a food stall. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  

Betty sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Betty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes. The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to start going to villages for foodstuffs. Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs  like bunches of bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She makes baskets for a living. She does not have a basket shop yet but hopes to have one in the future. Emelie has regular customers who buy her baskets.

Emelie requested this loan to buy materials to make baskets. Emelie wants to earn better so she can sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: buy materials to make baskets

loans.name: Bintimohamed

texts.en:
Bintimohamed is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling clothes at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of clothes. Bintimohamed dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora y valiente, es madre soltera de siete hijos, quienes son mayores y gracias a su entrega pudo darles una buena educación. Ella vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hija que es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de siete meses. Juntas trabajan para salir adelante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su nieto. Su trabajo consiste en la venta abarrotes, para lo cual posee un tienda y por lo que siempre esta abastecida de variados productos, siendo obtenidos al por mayor y a menor precio. Dicho negocio esta instalado en el interior de su casa, y cuya calle es muy transita, por ello la afluencia de gente que eso le ha generado mucha ventaja para su negocio. Para Ana, la venta de bedidas heladas es lo que más solicta, pues se encuentra en una época del año donde hay mucha calor. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de su tiempo para poder realizar las labores de su hogar y poder cuidar a su nieta. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo qur espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para su bodega, además de provisionarse de bebidas.
texts.en:
59-year-old Ana is a hard-working and brave woman.  She is a single mother and has seven grown-up children.  Thanks to her devotion, she was able to provide her children with a good education.  Ana lives in her own home together with her daughter who is a single mother and has a seven-month-old son.  They both work to get ahead and provide Ana's grandson with a better quality of life.

Ana's business is selling groceries.  She owns a store which is always stocked with a wide variety of products.  She obtains her products wholesale, for a lower price.  This business is located inside Ana's home.  She lives on a very busy street and there are a lot of people.  This has given her a great advantage in her business.  What Ana's customers are most requesting is for her to sell iced drinks as it is very hot during this time of year.  What Ana likes about her work is that she can make time to carry out her housework and care for her grandson.

This will be Ana's fourth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support so that she can continue in her work.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy merchandise for her store.  She will also stock up with drinks.

loans.use: to buy more products including drinks

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 33 years old and married with three children, between the aged 3 and 8 years old. He sells shoes in the market. He has been in this business for two years and works from 6 a.m until 6 p.m every day of the week.

Celestin has requested a loan from Kiva lenders from Vision Finance Company in order to support his business through the purchasing of more shoes to sell. With this profit, Celestin will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.es:
Desiderio, en su primer préstamo hizo varios proyectos en la hortalizas, logro pagar el préstamo y le quedo un margen de ganancia, esto le motivo a continuar trabajando con este apoyo, el cual le permite mejorar sus cultivos y tener beneficios para su familia.
El presente préstamo será utilizado en la compra de semillas de tomates, chiles y ejotes, además de comprar poliducto, mariposas, abono  y pago de mano de obra, también la compra de maya para mosquitos, todos estos materiales son necesarios para iniciar la nueva siembra, y a través del préstamo lograra tener todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
In his first loan, Desiderio carried out various farming projects. He succeeded in paying back the loan and earned a margin of profit. This motivated him to continue working with this support, which helps him improve his crop and have benefits for his family. 

The current loan will be used to purchase seeds for tomatoes, chilies, and green beans. He will also purchase polyduct plastic tubing, butterflies, fertilizer, and wages for hired help. All of these materials are necessary to begin sowing. With the loan, he will be able to have everything he needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, polyduct plastic tubing, butterflies, fertilizer, and to pay for hired help.

loans.name: Akou Sophie

texts.fr:
Akou Sophie est une femme   âgée 34 ans. Elle est mariée à un déclarant en douane. 
Akou Sophie travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Akou Sophie vend des pagnes et des sous-vêtements de manière ambulante. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle mène seule son activité. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir  vendre en saison de pluies.
Akou Sophie a requis son 2ième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et des sous-vêtements. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akou Sophie voudrait ouvrir une boutique de lingerie. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit aider et subvenir au mieux aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akou Sophie, age 34, is married to a customs agent. She's been working as a reseller since 2004. She sells pagnes (colorful African cloth) and underwear as a traveling saleswoman. 

She purchases her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. She runs her business alone. At this time, her main problem is not being able to sell during the rainy season.

Akou Sophie is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy pagnes and underwear. In the forthcoming years, she would like to open a lingerie shop.

She says that with her profits, she intends to provide for her family the best she can.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) and underwear

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 52 years old and married with a child. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elma has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Elma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sisimukha Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Sisismukha Group in Western Kenya! Paul is the facilitator of the Sisimukha group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Paul takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Paul had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paul  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Paul will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Paul is pictured with his group members in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora  Julia    se dedica a la venta de artesanías desde hace siete años.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es  ordenar  sus artesanías y visitar a las localidades vecinas  para que vean su mercancía.
Tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes y tambien vende dulces y refrescos.
Es soltera pero eso no le  da miedo para enfrentarse a la vida  ya que  ella sola trabaja  y maneja su tiempo.
Pidió  el préstamo para comprar más  mercancía como es: trajes típicos, bolsas tejidas, aretes, collares y blusas tejidas.
L e da las gracias a fundación  por ser parte de  las cosas buenas que le han pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Julia has been selling handicrafts for seven years.  What she likes the most about her business is ordering the handicrafts and visiting neighboring place so that her merchandise can be seen.

She also has a grocery store, and she sells sweets and soft drinks.  She is single, but this does not make her afraid to face life.  She works alone, and she manages her time.

She asked for the loan to buy more merchandise like typical dress, woven bags, earrings, necklaces, and woven blouses.

She thanks the Fundación for being part of the good things that have happened in her life.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is a married man having five children. He is 45 years old and resides at Sinusa, Ozamis City: Philippines. 

Rufino owns and operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living and has been three years in this business. Each month, he earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Rufino has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Rufino wants to make improvements of his house and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, 42 years old, is married and has four children ranging from thirteen to twenty-two years of age. He is a talkative and social man. For the last six years, he has been selling fruits and vegetables along a busy road. He faces the business challenge of insufficient funds. He hopes that by using the requested loan of KES 20,000 he will be able to improve his business by adding stocks of kale, spinach, tomatoes, and peppers. Samuel hopes and dreams of becoming a wholesaler of vegetables in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more kale, spinach, tomatoes and peppers to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Marina has a retail shop that sells toys, clothing and accessories. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Marina is a new member of HSPFI, and has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more toys, clothing and accessories to sell. In the future, Marina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more toys, clothing and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 26-year-old modest lady from Lambwe town, Western Kenya. She is married to Patrick and they have two children.
Caroline operates a home products stall in Lambwe town where she sells items such as water basins, buckets, cups and other utensils. She has been doing this for the last five years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from Kiva partner KADET, which she will use to buy a stock of home products such as basins and buckets. She will use her profits to purchase more stock. Her dream is to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy stocks of home products (such as basins and buckets) for resale.

loans.name: Gianmarco

texts.es:
Gianmarco es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, quienes eran muy humildes y no podían cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Gianmarco trabaja como obrero en una granja de pollos de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Gianmarco se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de 8 cerdos y materiales de construcción, tales como madera, fierros, alambres, clavos, entre otros, para poder hacer la construcción de un pequeño corral para la crianza de sus cerdos; de esta manera Gianmarco espera poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una granja de crianza de diversos animales, así pues él desea salir adelante y ver a su pequeño convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Gianmarco is 21 years old and lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial, with his wife and their small child whom they love very much. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, who together with his wife dedicates all his effort to supporting the family. Unfortunately he was not able to study a professional career, as since he was very young he has had to work in order to support his parents who are very humble and don't have enough resources to cover all of their living expenses.  

Through his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, on a daily basis Gianmarco works as a laborer on a chicken farm in his city. He works approximately 10 hours a day and enjoys his work, and believes he does well because he treats others well. 

Gianmarco is very grateful for Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they provide he will be able to buy 8 pigs and construction materials like wood, screws, nails, and others in order to construct a small corral in which to raise them. This way Gianmarco is hoping to continue working and dedicating himself to his dream of having his own farm where he can raise various types of animals. It is through this business that he plans to get ahead and become an independent professional.

loans.use: to buy pigs and construction materials

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 29 years old. She is married with three children aged between 2,5 and 7 years, all of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been farming for the past 6 years. With the loan from kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.
