For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Delida Yosabeth

texts.es:
Delida, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de profesor y tienen un hijo de dos años y viven en casa propia.

Delida, es empleada en un hospital nacional, porque tiene varios años de trabajar en ese mismo lugar; de esa manera aporta para los gastos del hogar y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.
 
Delida, necesita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos para su hijo, porque continuamente lo tiene en tratamiento.

El sueño de Delida, es que su hijo mejore y que crezca sano y que tenga una buena salud.

loans.use: para comprar medicamentos para su hijo, porque continuamente lo tiene en tratamiento.

loans.name: Charanai Srileap

texts.en: Srileap is 19 years old and lives with her mother (pictured here because Srileap was unavailable), her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She operates a restaurant where she sells rice and local Khmer dishes.  Most of Srileap's clients are soldiers who are stationed near her shop.  She employs three workers at her restaurant and usually generates between $10 and $20 in revenue per day.  She hopes to use this loan to buy more chairs and tables in order to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her restaurant (tables, chairs)

loans.name: Juana Leonarda

texts.en:
My name is Juana Z.. I sell a variety of products for ladies and gentlemen. I have owned my business for 4 years, and I have a lot of clients because I am located on the outside of the communal market place of our city. At this moment, I want to buy more merchandise to have a better variety of products because sales are very good these days. With the profits, I intend to feel my family and to buy medicines for my mother, who is ill.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juana Z. me dedico a la venta de productos varios para damas y caballeros, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mi clientes son excelentes ya que estoy ubicada en las afueras del mercado comunal de nuestra ciudad, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas mercaderia para tener una mayor variedad de productos porque estos dias son muy buenos para vender, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y comprar medicinas a mi madre que esta enferma.

loans.use: to buy talcum, hair clips, earrings, necklaces, tooth paste, cotton tips, shampoos, soaps, nail polish, toys, and deodorants.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru:
Alijon is 21 years old, he is a bachelor and has a high school education. He has 3 years of trading experience. He sells bicycle parts. Prior to this he helped his father to trade and then took the initiative and took on family responsibilities. He also fixes bicycles and sells bicycle parts at home.

Alijon became a MicroInvest client in 2006 when he received a $350 loan. In the beginning he only had one kiosk and his assets were worth $700. After receiving credit he acquired a second kiosk. Today his assets have increased to $1,120 and he has all types of parts in his inventory, not just locally made ones, but also ones made abroad. He plans to use the new loan to expand his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гаффоров Алиджон-21лет. Холост образование среднее. Опыт работы в торговле три года. Он торгует запчастями велосипеда. Раньше помогал отцу в торговле, затем взял инициативу и заботу о семье в свои руки. Также он занимается ремонтом велосипеда и продажей запчастей дома. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2006 году. Он получил займ в размере 350$. В начальном степе кредитования у него была только одна торговая точка (лавка) и активы его составляли 700$. После получения кредита он приобрел еще одну торговую точку. Сейчас его активы возросли до 1120,$ и он имеет в ассортименте все виды запчастей для велосипеда не только местного производства, но и производства других стран. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент товара.

loans.use: to increase product assortment

loans.name: Sayyara

texts.en: Sayyara (her husband is pictured) is 43 and a mother of three. She lives in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijian. Sayyara has raised cattle for four years. She fattens the cattle and then sells it. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy 2 cows for  fattenning and selling.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena is a woman who works hard for her two little children of 5 and 2 years, who need a lot of care from her. Maria's husband is a temporary employee, and so they cannot always be sure that they can count no having the job. Thinking about the worse case scenario, and to have a income in addition of what her husband makes, Maria decided to start selling merchandise and she came across shoe catalogues, which is what she is currently selling. Little by little her clientele has grown, and she has more and more orders for shoes.

This is why she is requesting a loan for US$275 to be paid in a period of 5 months. With this money, Maria Magdalena will be able to cover the orders she already has for the winter season that is starting. In addition, she will be able to buy a few more shoes to have in inventory to offer to her clients. With your help, Maria will be able to support her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

María Magdalena, es una mujer que lucha por sus dos pequeños hijos de 5 y 2 años, quienes necesitan de mucho cuidado por parte de ella. El esposo de María es empleado temporal, y por lo tanto no están seguros de que siempre pueda contar con ese trabajo. Previniendo que lo peor pase y para poder un ingreso extra a lo que gana el esposo. María decidió comenzar a vender mercancía, y se topó con los catálogos de zapatos, que es lo que está vendiendo actualmente, poco a poco ha ido creciendo su cartera de clientes, y cada vez son más los que le hacen pedidos de zapatos.

Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $275 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Y con este dinero María Magdalena podrá surtir los pedidos que le han hecho hasta el día de hoy. Para la temporada de invierno que ya está comenzando. Además de poder comprar un poco de más zapatos para tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar a sus dos hijos adelante.

loans.use: Covering existing orders and buying winter inventory.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia B. brings a touch of the Congo to Tanzania.  In 2006, she established a business selling dresses made in the styles traditional to the former Zaire (now the Democratic Republic of Congo).  Eugenia is from the Muha tribe, which comes from the Kigoma region in the far west of Tanzania, on the border of Congo.  It is this connection with Congo and its influence on her homeland that inspired and enabled Eugenia to establish her business here in Dar es Salaam.  Also, the many refugees from the DRC who live here due to the civil war in their homeland are happy to have found a neighbour selling their traditional dress.

Eugenia has already repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires another of $400 to purchase additional stock.  She is a single mother of two - Noela, aged 15, and Baby, aged 9.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, which in turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia E. is thirty-nine years old and married to Elías Servín, a cameraman at a local television station. Together they have two children and live in their own house.

Since childhood she has devoted herself to working laboriously to create a better life for herself. She began her career as a seamstress with her aunt. However, soon she wished to venture out on her own. After meeting her husband, Elías, she was able to become an independent businesswoman. Together they own their own party decoration business.

Today, Antonia works as a party decorator in her shop. She helps in the fight against poverty by giving jobs to other poor people in her neighborhood. What started as a struggle to improve her own situation in life, has now grown to also providing for her husband and two children. Her dream is to give her children a great childhood and help them grow into intelligent and hardworking adults. She wishes to expand her decorating business and asks for a loan to buy linens, fake flowers, glue, Styrofoam, and other decorating materials.

loans.use: To buy linen, artificial flowers, glue, Styrofoam, etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela Ngumia is 35 years old. She is married and has three children, who are aged 11, 14, and 16.

In 2006, Angela established a clothing business. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

Angela thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Cheav

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheav K., age 38, is married with three children. Her husband grows a variety of vegetables, normally earning about $4 a day. They have three children. Two are students and other one is a blacksmith with a salary of $60 a month.

This couple will use this loan to purchase bamboo, a water pump, fertilizers, petroleum, a good bean seed, and to make a trap to grow beans.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo, a water pump, fertilizers, petroleum, and a good bean seed.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 39 years old he has three children who are students. His old father lives with him and he is responsible of his treatment. He has a small general store and applied to get $1200 to purchase a new ice box and some new goods, make new shelves and paint the shop. He wants to expand his project and increase his income, and provide a good life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and some new goods

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Sela K. is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is married and has two children.  Everyday, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her village and brings it home for processing.  After refining the fish, she resells the products to her customers.  Due to increased demand, Sela wants to increase her sales, and is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish, which she will process and resell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. sells fish that he catches on his “Awam Sea,” which is a popular canoe here in Ghana. He is married, but his wife's income is not sufficient for John and his 3 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand his business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian belongs the bank Banco Comunal “Solidaridad”, her home is located in the Municipal city of 6 de Diciembre Mz A Lt 1, District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and she is the mother of 3 children, 1 older child and 2 younger ones. Her husband is employed. Lilian wants to help out economically at home, and because of this she has asked for a loan of 300.00 Soles (Peruvian currency) from Manuela Ramos. She currently runs a small clothing sales business and she travels once a month to the city of Tacna to buy clothing. She wakes up every day at 6 am to go to the market and leaves everything ready at home, so she can run her business. Lilian delivers ordered clothing from 10 am until 1pm, when she rests and eats. She continues working from 5 pm to 9:30 pm. With this loan of 1,500 Soles from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 5 moths, Lilian will buy 3 dozen blouses, 3 dozen pieces of underwear, etc. Lilian is very happy, because she says she has a stable client base, which she has won through her effort and perseverance. She feels like her dreams are coming true, and the greatest satisfaction she gets is that her family doesn’t have to suffer the lack of so many things, this makes her feel like a strong person.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Lilian pertenece al Banco Comunal “Solidaridad” su domicilio esta ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal 6 de Diciembre Mz A Lt 1, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 1 mayor y dos menores de edad, su esposo es empleado. Lilian quiere ayudar económicamente en casa, es así que solicitó un préstamo a Manuela Ramos por S/. 300.00 soles. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ropa, donde Lilian viaja una vez por mes hasta la ciudad de Tacna para comprar las prendas. Cada día se levanta a las 6.00 am. Para ir al mercado, dejar todo listo en casa para luego dedicarse a su negocio. Lilian reparte sus pedidos desde las 10:00am hasta la 1:00 pm de ahí se da el tiempo de almorzar y descansar y desde las 5:00pm hasta las 9:30 pm vuelve a su labor. Con este préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 docenas de blusas, 3 docenas de ropa interior, etc. Lilian esta muy contenta, porque tiene clientes estables la cual se ha ganado a base de esfuerzo y perseverancia, siente que sus sueños se están realizando y la mejor satisfacción que siente es que su familia ya no tiene que sufrir tantas necesidades y eso la hace sentir fuerte.

loans.use: To purchase clothing at wholesale value.

loans.name: Mariam A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Mariam  M..  She is married and has four children aged between 2 and 17. She has two other  dependents who live with her because they are orphans.  In 1998, Mariam  established her livestock-keeping business. Mariam  requires a loan in order to buy animal feed and drugs. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and drugs

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Le Thi B. is 57 years old. She joined TYM in 2004 and used her first loan to raise and trade ornamental birds. This business is the family's main source of income. In 2006, to create jobs for her two grown-up sons, she bravely borrowed a loan to open a mechanical workshop. This business goes on smoothly and brings about VND 100,000 per day. With an income of VND 5 million/month, the economy of Mrs. B.'s family is more stable. That is why she has money to send a child to university. She now wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy more raw materials for the workshop.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more raw materials for the workshop

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria tiene 43 años, es juliaqueña, vive con su pareja, Pedro, el cual es triciclista (transporte de pasajeros en triciclo) y con sus hijos Jaime de 12 y Cristina de 8.  Se dedica a la producción de helados durante todo el día, en su casa, donde tiene su pequeña fábrica de helados, la cual le demanda mucho tiempo y dedicación.  Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace ya 20 años, pero su propio negocio lo abrió hace 8 años, tiempo en el cual va creciendo poco a poco.  A Gregoria le gusta su trabajo, los años y la experiencia ganada son suficientes como para que Gregoria ya no le encuentre dificultad y que le ponga mucho más dedicación día a día.  Su anhelo es ver a sus hijos con un futuro estable económicamente.  Con el dinero que Gregoria solicita podrá comprar más insumos para elaborar sus helados.  Con el tiempo, quiere que su negocio sea mucho más grande, y si es posible poner otro tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 43 year old resident of Juliaca. She lives with her spouse Pedro who works driving a tricycle taxi, and their two children, Jaime who is 12 and Cristina who is 8. She spends her days working making ice cream at home where she has her small ice cream factory. This requires much hard work and dedication. She has been working in this activity for the last 20 years, and has been running her own business for 8 years. During that time, the business has grown little by little. Gregoria enjoys her work and her many years of experience allowed her to do the work with little difficulty. She works hard every day. Her goal is to see her children enjoy a stable economic future. With the loan that Gregoria is requesting she will purchase more ingredients for ice cream production. Over time she hopes that her business will become much larger, and if possible she would like to open another kind of business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for ice cream production.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S., 31, and her husband, Mr. Tev Ros, 34, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1994 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school.

Mrs. Mom has been weaving for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her parents when she was fourteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middle man, who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a motor taxi driver in his village.

Mom is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Mrs. Khy Y. is a farmer in the Smaung village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice. She earns very little income to provide a high quality of life for her family. In order to improve her living conditions, she has decided to request a loan to buy eight piglets and pig foodto start a pig breeding business. Mrs. Khy Y. is 45 years old widow and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food to start up a pig breeding business

loans.name: Chheng Oin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng Oin N. is the leader of a group of four who all live in Pour Steang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a duck breeder. Since her duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it; therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Y Im, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Shamsiniso

texts.en:
Shamsiniso D. is 20 years old. She is not married and is living with her parents. She is a well-known seamstress in her community, seeing that she has been working there for more than 4 years. Shamsiniso decided to take advantage of her reputation and bought a tailoring machine and since then she is providing the service of a tailor.

The entrepreneur says that she has now a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order traditional dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Now she is requesting a loan of 700 USD for a term of 6 months for purchasing new modern fabrics for sewing traditional dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Shamsiniso and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new modern fabrics

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa has had a small shop and has been a cassava seller in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Penyeriziki loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more shop items and cassava for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mtumwa is 39 years old, married, and has four children, ages 15, 9, 7, and 3.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and shop items for her business

loans.name: María De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora María M. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de tortillas en su municipio de Chinandega en el mercado Central donde posee nueve años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Actualmente con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio dedica su tiempo a preparar el maíz todos los día para su respectiva elaboración y venta de tortillas y esta vez ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dicho maíz. Espera ser beneficiada con este crédito para así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. makes tortillas in the municipality of Chinandega in the Central market, something she has been doing for nine years. With great effort and sacrifice she dedicates her time to preparing corn every day in order to make and sell tortillas. She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase corn. She hopes to receive this loan in order to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw material

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Y. Abra  exerce depuis 2007 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et de céréales, elle a commencé depuis peu le commerce de charbons de bois, actuellement elle voudrait agrandir son stock de charbons de bois et de céréales, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 17 sacs d’haricots, 20 sacs de maïs et 30  sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée  a un monsieur qui est chauffeur, elle a 02 enfants, avec le revenu de son activité elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer
texts.en:
Since 2007, Abra Y. has been selling food staples and cereals, and also, since recently, charcoal. At this time, she would like to bolster her stock of charcoal and cereals, and she's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES to buy 17 sacks of beans, 20 sacks of corn, and 30 sacks of charcoal. She's married to a gentlemen who is a driver, and she has two children. With the profits of her business, she helps her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 17 sacks of beans, 20 sacks of corn, and 30 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 51 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado céntrico de su ciudad, atiende todas las mañanas para vender los platos típicos de su zona, ofreciendo a su clientela desayunos y almuerzos. Leonarda ya lleva más de 15 años en esta labor que le ha ayudado significativamente a seguir adelante, para lograr esos resultados se levanta a las 4 de la madrugada para vender sus comidas, y por la buena sazón y la atención cálida que ofrece ha sabido conquistar a sus clientes que siempre acuden a ella a consumir sus platos, y por ello su negocio es rentable. Para más adelante Leonarda desea seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio, implementándolo con nuevos cubiertos para el servicio. Es la sexta vez que Leonarda está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, es una de las personas más activas de su banco comunal y su deseo es seguir trabajando por el bienestar en común. El dinero requerido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, como sacos de arroz, azúcar y demás productos para abastecerse de lo necesario para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 51 years old and lives with her 3 children in their own home. She sells food in the central market of her city. She serves the typical dishes of her region every morning, offering her customers breakfasts and lunches. Leonarda has been conducting her business for more than 15 years and it has helped her significantly to get ahead. In order to achieve these results she gets up at 4:00 in the morning to sell her foods, and through the good flavor and the attention to quality that she offers she has won over her customers and now they always come to her for the dishes; for this reason her business is profitable.

In the future Leonarda desires to keep working to better her business, beginning with new place settings for the service. It is the sixth time that Leonarda is soliciting a loan with MFP. She is one of the most active people in her communal bank and her desire is to continue working for the common well being of the members. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of primary products such as sacks of rice, sugar and additional products to stock the necessities for the preparation of her food.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of groceries for the preparation of her food.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 26 años, vive en su casa propia, al lado de su hermana y su pequeña sobrina. Tras mucho esfuerzo y gracias a sus ahorros pudo poner en marcha su pequeña bodega, en la cual trabaja todos los días para que le arroje buenos resultados. Siempre apoya a su hermana y a su sobrina, la cual es su adoración, y quiere brindarle lo mejor, ya que a pesar que aún no tiene hijos, ve en su pequeña sobrina a una hija. Adela trabaja desde tempranas horas en la mañana y prolonga su trabajo hasta las 9 de la noche, esta labor es muy cansada, ya que tiene que permanecer durante casi todo el día atendiéndolo pero, tener que cuidar a su sobrina en el transcurso del día hace que sea más llevadero, además ha hecho muy buenas amigas en sus clientas que siempre visitan su bodega por el gran carisma que tiene. Adela nota que su clientela sigue creciendo haciendo más rentable su trabajo y es por eso que en el futuro quiere expandirlo comprando todos los productos que necesita para su bodega. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, prometiendo ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Adela is 26 years old and lives in her own home which she shares with her sister and small niece. After much effort and savings she was able to start her small grocery store where she works every day in hopes of maximizing her profits. She supports her sister and her niece who is her adoration and wants to provide them with the best for, even though she has no children of her own, she considers her niece a daughter. Adela works from early morning until 9pm. This is exhausting work since she must spend most of the day at work. However, since she also babysits her niece, this pleasurable activity makes her work day more tolerable. Additionally, many of her customers have become good friends and they visit her at the store because of her great charisma. Adela has noticed that ther customer base continues to grow making her business even more profitable and this is the reason she want to increase her inventory thereby offering all the products her customers want. This is her first loan from PRISMA Microfinancing and she vows to be punctual with her repayments. With the requested funds she will buy merchandise to increase her available inventory in order to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda, or “Luz” as she is often called in their village, is happily married to Nomer and blessed with two children. They live in Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte of Nueva Vizcaya. Their eldest is now in the third year of high school while the youngest is now in elementary school. They have great ambition for their children and are doing their best to finance their studies.

Luz buys and sells vegetables in their village while her husband is working as a rice and vegetable vendor. According to Luz, she is able to gain a net income of PHP200 per day. She wants to acquire more products; therefore, she is applying for a loan of PHP5, 000 as working capital to improve her vending business.

loans.use: Business capital

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Theam

texts.en:
Theam T. is 54 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother blessed with five children, two of whom are married. Two are employed. Her daughter is a hairdresser and her son is a mirror cutter. They provide a little income to meet their family’s living expense.

Theam plants vegetables on the land in front of her home, She grows cabbage and onions. Theam sells her crops every two moths, after she plants. To alleviate the hard physical labor, Theam asks for a loan to purchase two cows to plow the land. She will rent them to other farmers for addition income.

loans.use: Purchase two cows.

loans.name: Hayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо – 49 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Она занимается продажей детского и женского нижнего белья. Она торгует на втором этаже рынка «Чоршанбе» города Худжанда, а также на "Джумабазаре" и "Якшанбебазаре" города Худжанда. Хайринисо закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Хайринисо кредитуется у нас с 2004 года. Она очень прилежный клиент. Хайринисо просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего женского и детского белья их хлопчатобумажной ткани. Тогда у Хайринисо увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
Hayriniso is a 49-year old mother of four. She is married. She sells children's and women's underwear on the first floor of Hojannd's Chorshanbe market as well as at Hojand's Jumabazar and Yakshanbebazar markets. Two or three times a month Hayriniso travels to Istaravshan's wholesale market or Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan to purchase goods. Hayriniso has been our client since 2004, and she has always been an excellent client. This time she is applying for a loan in order to purchase women's and children's cotton underwear for the summer season. This would allow Hayriniso increasing the variety of goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's and children's underwear

loans.name: Naghma Muhammad Siddique Group

texts.en:
Naghma baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 18 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. She is an uneducated lady but her mother gave her the skill to sew clothes. She started a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband's name is M. S.. He is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. Naghma baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) because her husband is currently driving a rented one and pays half of his income to the owner.
 
This group loan consists of three additional people: 

Asmat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. 
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood and nails for her furniture making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: “Naghma baji is seated on the first left side in this photo”.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De  (Benkadi  Fofodiana) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de FOFODIANA,  commune de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 27  hectares.
Après les récoltes, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, de Marka-Coungo et de Fana à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 1 are married women who average 44 years of age and 4 children. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in the village of FOFODIANA, in the community of Tingolé, FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum, peanuts, and beans. They are on their fifth experience with the institution. The past loans were repaid on time. With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 27 hectares. After the harvests, a portion of their production is for their own consumption. The other portion is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tingolé, Marka-Coungo, and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mr. Sim Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people living in Ta Vong village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sim K. is the 59-year-old village bank president.

Mr. Sim K. is a hardworking man. His wife, Mrs. Em Sreng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. The couple has three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other is a waiter.

Although Mr. Sim K.’s family members try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to supP. their household. In order to improve their living standard, Mr. Sim K. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise. He will use the rest of the money to buy fertilizer to supP. their rice field.

Mr. Muy C. did not come to take his loan but his wife did, so she is shown in the photo. 

Six members in this group loans have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and fertilizer to support the rice field

loans.name: Aventino

texts.en: M. Aventino is 42 years old and married with six children, one of whom is still at school. For the past ten years Aventino has operated a spare parts retail business, and has sold stoves, pressure lamps and bicycle spare parts, among others. He will use his loan to purchase more spare parts for motorcycles, cars, bicycles, and so forth. His dream is to set up a large spare parts shop so that he can become a leading competitor in the Masaka market, selling in both retail and wholesale. Moreover, he hopes to be able to educate his child.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for motorcycles, cars, bicycles, etc.

loans.name: Maybel Ruth

texts.en:
Maybel Ruth R. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old and single with one infant child. To make a living, Maybel Ruth grows fruits and vegetables that she sells. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maybel Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maybel Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be invested in her business. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des engrais et effectuer des labours

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
This is Fely M., 66 years old. She seems to never get tired of the things she does. Her family lives in Pangarap Village, Caloocan City.

Fely has been in business for the last fifteen years. Through the years, she gets to add on new business ventures one after the other. She now has a small pharmacy and a general store where she sells purified drinking water in large plastic containers and soft drinks as well. She is earning P20,000 a month.

She is very thankful that her family now enjoys better living conditions as opposed to the poor life they had when they used to live amongst the squatter families in the metro.

Having become a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006 was one of her treasured experiences. She currently needs a loan in the amount of P20,000 so she can purchase inventory for her store and pharmacy.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon C. is a 32 year old mother of three children, all of whom are students. Suon runs a small market shop, selling various produce, such as fresh vegetable and meat. Suon has run her shop for more than a year and is earning an average of $5 per day.

Her husband is a construction foreman, which helps provide for their family. In order to increase her income, Suon C. has requested a loan of US$1000 to buy an old truck to use for providing a transportation service.

loans.use: To buy an old truck for providing a transportation service

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea I. is a villager I. Tuol Kandal village I. Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She now faces a small problem with this farming because her field has infertile soil. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to plow the field. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Yang Sdeng, is a fisherman who catches a few fish to support the family. Mrs. Kunthea I. is the mother of two children who attend the local school. 
Her husband is on the right I. the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides and to plow the field

loans.name: Konga

texts.en:
Konga M. is currently in the business of selling dried fish in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil and onions to sell.  Konga is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a motor boat for her husband for fishing.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Bella Vista (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bella vista está formado por socias que viven por distintas partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad el resultado de la fusión de tres culturas ricas en simbolismo, tradición y arte: Cañarí, Inca y Español. Su gente está llena de amabilidad y son muy cordiales y así lo demuestran nuestras socias.

La Sra. Blanca S. es socia del banco comunal Bella Vista, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha procreado 5 hijos que se encuentran de 30, 27, 25, 23, 22 años de edad, solo uno de ellos es reconocido por su padre el resto llevan su apellido, siendo dos sus hijos casados y sus tres hijos viven en unión libre y todos ellos viven independientes, su nieto es el único que vive con ella ya que lo crió desde muy pequeño, tiene 10 años de edad, estudia en la escuela Ezequiel Crespo, pero es su progenitora la que le paga los estudios, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

Blanca se dedica a la venta de pinchos(Carne asada en palitos), pescado frito, fritada, sus productos son vendidos en la vereda de su casa, lleva ya 15 años trabajando en este negocio  y cuenta con permisos del municipio para trabajar en las fiestas de Cuenca, se lleva bien con todas las socias creando un buen ambiente de trabajo y compañerismo, es su primer ciclo en la fundación, nos comenta que fue su hermana la que la incentivo para que formara parte de este grupo,  y con el préstamo que la fundación Espoir, le hace va a invertir en su negocio ya que necesita comprar algunas cosas más, su gran sueño es tener su propia casa.

La Sra. Claudia S. es socia del banco comunal Bella Vista, vive en el centro del la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 28 años de edad, es divorciada y nos comento que tomaron esta decisión por no haber comprensión en su hogar, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, estudia en la escuela Arzobispo Serrano Aguilar, la casa en la que habita es de su hermana.

Claudia es ama de casa, cuida a sus sobrinos obteniendo un sueldo extra, pero también tienen un pequeño negocio de panadería, tiene 3 meses trabajando en este, nos comento que para iniciar este negocio tuvo que tomar un curso intensivo de panadería y pastelería, ella trabaja solo a base de pedidos, es su primer ciclo en la fundación y fue su familia la que la incentivo para ser socia de su bankito, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando mas materiales que le hacen falta en su panadería, su gran sueño es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
The Bella Vista communal bank is made up of members who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. The city is a fusion of three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition, and art: Cañarí, Inca, and Spanish. The people are friendly and cordial, and so are the members.

One member is Blanca S.. She is 50 years old and a mother of five, aged 30, 27, 25, 23, and 22. Their father acknowledges only one, though all carry his last name. Two are married and three live in a civil union. One 10-year-old grandson lives with Blanca and studies in the Ezequiel Crespo School. Their house is rented.

For 15 years, Blanca has had a business selling pinchos (roasted meat on a stick), fried fish, and fritada (fried meat). She sells from the sidewalk of her house and also has city permits to sell at the Cuenca festivals. She gets along well with all the other members of the communal bank, creating a good atmosphere of work and companionship. This is her 1st loan cycle, and with the money she will invest in her business, as there are a few things she still needs. Her dream is to have her own house.

Claudia S. is also a member of Bella Vista. She lives in the center of the city. She is 28 years old, divorced, and has a 10-year-old boy who studies at the Archbishop Serrano Aguilar School.

Claudia is a homemaker and looks after her nephews to make some extra money, and also has a small bakery business. She has been doing this for three months, and took an intensive course in baking and cake making before beginning. Her products are sold only to people who order them. Her family encouraged her to join the communal bank. This is her 1st loan cycle and she will use the money to invest in materials she is lacking in her bakery. Her dream is to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, oil, flour, napkins, cutlery, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finishing the interior and exterior of his house

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna H. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Edna is married and has 3 school-aged children. Edna owns & operates specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 23 years old, married, and has one child. He has been working as a farmer since 2005. He cultivates all kind of vegetables according to the season.  He then uses a pick-up to take his harvested produce to the agricultural market with which he works. Khaled's work has improved during his time as a farmer and he plans to reinforce it. To do so, Khaled is asking to borrow $1,200 USD to buy additional farming supplies, seeds and fertilizers to improve and expand his cultivation of the land.

loans.use: To buy additional farming supplies, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her business

loans.name: Dilbarhon Melibaeva`s Group

texts.ru:
Дилбархон 47 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей: сын и дочь. Сын находится на заработках в России, а дочь проживает вместе с мужем. Дилбархон активно занимается розничной торговлей товаров повседневного спроса с маленького ларька около дома. Этим бизнесом она начала заниматься два года тому назад. Кредит запрашивается для закупа новой продукции для ларька.Это позволит ей увеличить доход, т.к. это единственный такого рода ларек в округе. 

Мадинахон 26 лет. Она проживает вместе с родителями и братьями. Вся семья занимается полеводством. В данное очень много времени уделяют подготовке к весенное посевной. В этом году они собираются посеять картофель. Кредит будет использован для закупа семян. 

Хуртожихон, 51, вдова. Ее сын находится на заработках в России. Она занимается разведением и откормом домашнего скота. Кредит запрашивается для покупки дойной коровы, что позволит ей производить молоко и молочные продукты. 

Нигора, 39. У нее трое детей: старшая дочь работает поваром, остальные двое школьники. Супруг работает таксистом. Она сама занимается реализацией овощей и круп на рынке Аравана. В основном она реализует лук, картофель, жмых. Кредит запрашивается для увеличения товарного запаса овощей. 

Учкунбеку 22 года. Он проживает вместе с родителями и младшим братом. Сам клиент занимается птицеводством и пчеловодством. В бизнесе участвуют практически все члены семьи. Кредит будет использован для закупа 1 коровы. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Dilbarhon is 47 years old. She is a widow and has two children: a son and a daughter. Her son works in Russia, and the daughter lives with her husband. Dilbarhon is actively involved in retail sales of everyday-use goods at a small retail store near her home. She started this business two years ago. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of new merchandise for the store. This will help Dilbarhon increase her income because this is the only store of this type in the area. Madinahon is 26 years old. She lives together with her parents and brothers. The whole family is involved in farming. They currently spend a lot of time preparing for the spring sowing. This year, they plan to plant potatoes. The loan will be used for the purchase of seeds. Hurtojihon is 51 years old. She is a widow. Her son is in Russia for work. She is involved in breeding and feeding domestic livestock. Hurtojihon is requesting the loan for the purchase of a dairy cow, which will allow her to produce milk and dairy products. Nigora is 39 years old. She has three children. The oldest daughter works as a cook, and the other two go to school. Nigora’s husband works as a taxi driver. She is involved in sales of vegetables and grains at the Aravan market. She primarily sells onions, potatoes and pomace. Nigora is requesting the loan in order to increase the stock of vegetables. Uchkunbek is 22 years old. He lives together with his parents and younger brother. He is involved in bird husbandry and beekeeping. The whole family participates in this business. The loan will be used for the purchase of 1 cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people are part of a village bank loan, and they all live in Chanlak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sophea S. is the village bank president, and was selected by all the members. The group members will use the loan for different purposes. She is a vegetable seller in the market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sophea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables for reselling. Her husband, Mr. Pech Rous, is a farmer who rents a plot of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Through this activity, the couple supports two children, who are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for re-selling.

loans.name: Mbayang

texts.fr: Mbayang N. est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 05 ans et a 10 fois de suite été bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de sucre et développe parallèlement une embouche ovine. son nouveau prêt lui permettra de faire la promotion de son projet. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbayang N. is a 55 year old married mother of seven who has been a member of hte Keur Ngalgou microfinance association for five years, and has received 10 consecutive loans. She has a small sugar business and is setting up a sheep rearing business, and this new loan would enable her to promote her project effectively. Her ultimate goal is to look after her family's needs. .

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her business

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 41 years old and married with three children who are 8, 10 and 12 years old.  Viateur has been a butcher for a long time ago.  The hours of his business are from morning until late in the evening hours.

Viateur is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his sales.  With this additional business, Viateur will also start to sell the meat of goats, sheep and pigs.  If successful, Viateur will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to start saving and reinvesting in his business by creating many sources of income, as well as create jobs for the people in his community.

loans.use: A large quantity of various meat for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy Z. bakes various kinds of bread and pastries at Takoradi.  Lucy attended a commercial school where she acquired the skills of baking and cooking both local and continental dishes.  She is married and has three beautiful children. Her husband works with the gold mines. Lucy has been baking for some time now. She helps her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will enable her to buy more ingredients so she can bake more products to meet the demands of her increasing number of customers. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to help in the payment of the water bills and other expenses.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Kaina Evangelina

texts.es:
Karina de 22 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas)  de Guayaquil, ella es vendedora de productos de belleza por catalogo. 

Una amiga de Karina la inscribió como vendedora después de saber que Karina necesitaba trabajo, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha promocionado los productos. Trabaja todos los días, veden perfumes, cremas, shampoo, etc. 

Para tener mas ingresos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes y cosméticos. En el futuro quiere ser directora de las vendedoras y tener un local de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Karina is 22-years-old. She lives in an urban neighborhood in Orquideas ("Orchids") (named for the many orchids that flourished there originally) in Guayaquil. She sells beauty products from catalogs. A friend of Karina enrolled her as a salesperson after learning that she needed work. Little by little, with effort and dedication, Karina has promoted her products. She works everyday selling perfumes, creams, shampoo, etc. In order to have a better income she wants to use the loan to buy perfumes and cosmetics to sell. In the future she wants to be a director of sales and have her own cosmetics shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Sixty-year-old Rogelio S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is married and has two children. His oldest child is 24. He is involved in farming. He tills 5 hectares of land, where he plants and harvests rice crops. According to him, his rice field produces 400 sacks of rice every harvest. His wife sells their harvest at his town's local market. Rogelio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Rogelio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del 12º ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Reimunda Giménez quien es una mujer muy trabajadora. Ella tiene  29 años, tiene 4 hijos se dedica a vender pescado, tiene su puesto en el mercado y también vende en su casa.
Ella trabaja todo el día en la venta de pescado que le genera el ingreso para ayudar a su marido quien no tiene trabajo fijo, y de esta manera mantienen a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado para seguir trabajando en esta actividad.
texts.en:
This group is currently working on their 12th loan cycle. One of the members is Reimunda Giménez, who is a very hardworking woman. She is 29 years old and has 4 children. She sells fish from a stall in the market, and she also sells from her home. She works all day selling fish, and this generates an income that helps her husband to support the family, since he does not have a regular job. She requests this loan to buy fish so that she can continue to work in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia B. is from the village of Villaflor Oroq. City  Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Lucia is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation using a "motorcab" in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used for reconditioning the motorcab. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Lucia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Reconditioning of the motorcab

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj T. is 59 years old and lives with his wife in Tuv province in central Mongolia. He and his wife have been living for the past twenty-five years in the home where they raised their children. Their children are now grown and live separately.

Davaadorj operates a taxi service in his local area, using his own car to transport people to and from points in his province. He started his transportation business in 2005 after working in the public transportation sector as a driver for thirty-seven years. He has steadily grown his private business over the last five years and has built a solid local customer base.

Davaadorj has used his business growth and success to renovate his home, making it more comfortable for his family. He is a modest and hardworking man and says, "I work hard to provide my children with a happy life.”

Today, as his car is beginning to age, Davaadorj hopes to soon make needed repairs. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase new tires and make repairs to his car.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Faride Esther

texts.es: Desde hace 13 años cuando se casó se dedicó a su hogar y para no descuidarlo se invento su propio negocio, así comenzó Faride Carbonó su microempresa de “Miscelánea y variedades Fari”, ella es una mujer casada y con dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años, que consiguió su clientela primaria haciendo manicure y pedicure y simultáneamente aprendió el arte de la bisutería de manera autodidacta a través de revistas especializadas, con ello agregó este producto a su negocio  y posteriormente, la venta de minutos de celulares; también fue apoyada por  una amiga que vive en  Estados Unidos, ella le mandaba mercancías cosméticas, perfumes y Faride las vendía, así también fue como agregó multiusos a crédito y gradualmente ha ido adicionando muchos productos como ropa femenina y cosméticos. De esta manera y ha ido creciendo y  desarrollando lo que hoy tiene: una miscelánea. Su credikiva, es su primer crédito, con él quiere obtener un capital adicional para comprar productos que han solicitado sus clientes y que ampliaran el espectro de otras personas que nunca le han comprado, como jeans para damas, perfumería, cosmético e insumos para elaborar productos de bisutería.  Su sueño es aumentar sus ingresos mediante su trabajo para dejarle algo para que sus hijos tengan un futuro promisorio.
texts.en:
Since she was married 13 years ago, she has taken care of her home, and so as not to neglect it she created her own business. This is how Faride Carbonó began her microbusiness “Miscelánea y variedades Fari” (Fari's Variety and Miscellany). She is a married woman with two children ages 9 and 12 who found her first customers doing manicures and pedicures, and at the same time she taught herself the art of costume jewelry through specialist magazines. She then added this product to her business and later added sales of cell phone minutes; she was also supported by a friend who lives in the United States. This friend sent her cosmetics merchandise and perfumes, and Faride sold them. This was also how she added multi-use credits and gradually she has added many products like women's clothing and cosmetics. In this manner, she has been growing and developing what she now has: a miscellany. Her Kiva loan is her first loan. With it, she wants to obtain additional capital to buy products that her customers have requested and that would broaden the spectrum to other people who have never bought from her, such as ladies' jeans, perfumes, cosmetics and supplies for making costume jewelry. Her dream is to increase her income through her work to leave something so her children have a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ladies' jeans, perfumes, cosmetics and supplies for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. Her husband contributes to the family's basic needs through his earnings as a real estate agent.

For the last four years, Mariam has sold mitumba (secondhand clothes) from door-to-door. She faces the major challenge of delayed payments: many of her customers purchase clothes on credit and take a while to make payments. She hopes to open a retail shop in future.

Mariam decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase water pipes to start another business selling fresh water.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes to start a business selling fresh water

loans.name: Freol

texts.es: Freol de 32 años, es un hombre trabajador y alegre, esta casado con Rosa, de 42 años, ambos viven en su casa propia en la localidad de Miraflores. Como todo hombre, es decidido y hábil; por más de 10 años se dedicó a la agricultura tiempo suficiente para entregarle a su digno oficio; vitalidad y juventud. Sus principales cultivos son de maíz, papa y arveja; los que a la actualidad le rindieron muy bien ya que la demanda de estos sembríos nunca decae. Freol desea en el futuro sembrar en mayores cantidades y de esa manera, poder abastecer a sus clientes mayoristas que diariamente compran su cosecha en el mercado central de su ciudad, en ocasiones la venta es demasiado buena por lo que a veces se le acaba rápido los productos que vende. Es el noveno crédito con MFP, además todos los socios de su banco comunal están muy contentos de que sea parte de su grupo, por ser una persona responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono y remedio para el cultivo de maíz que dentro de unos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Freol, 32, is a cheerful, hard working man.  He’s married to Rosa, 42.  They live in their own house in Miraflores.  Like all men he is dedicated and skilled.  For over ten years he has been a farmer, a long enough time to give his dignified work vitality and youth.  His main crops are corn, potatoes and peas which are good producers because demand for these crops never drops.

Freol would like to plant larger amounts in the future so that he can supply the customers that are wholesalers that come by daily to buy his crops at the city’s Central Market.  Sometimes sales are so good that he runs out of product quickly.

This is his 9th loan with MFP.  All the group members are happy that he’s part of the group because he’s a responsible person.

He will use the requested funds to buy manure and remedy for the corn crops that will be harvested in a few months.

loans.use: To buy manure for his next corn planting.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is a member of the Communal Bank Grand Power, located in the district of Ilave, in the province of Ilave, and the department of Puno. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She has an incomplete primary school education.

Armida has been working with Manuela Ramos for six years. The first loan she got was for 300 PEN and she used it to buy flour to bake bread. 

She now needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use for her business. 

Her dream is to expand her business of making one kind of bread, to make all types of bread; she would also like to have a grocery store. The thing she likes about working with the Communal Bank is that it facilitates participation and being able to express oneself without fear of anyone.

loans.use: Increase her business of selling breads.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah M., aged 26, runs a retail shop in Bissil market where she sells maize, sugar, beans and cooking oil/fat. Her customers are Bissil livestock traders and people from the neighboring area. She is married to Enoch Nzau and together they have two children aged seven and four. She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer.

Peninah has been running this business for two years and makes a monthly profit of Kshs 24,500. With the loan she will buy maize, beans, cooking oil and sugar to increase the stock in her shop. If the loan boosts her business, she will open up a grain shop and specialize in selling grains.

In the future, Peninah dreams of supplying grain, wholesale, from rural areas to urban areas. Peninah describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignment of drugs.

loans.name: Halhaman

texts.en: Halhaman M. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old child in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife works for the vocational training center in her town. He owns a taxi service transporting people back and forth from Bayan-Ulgii to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started this business in 2009 and has built a stable operation. He has found success with his new business within a very short period and his earnings have enabled him to buy his own car. His current car is outdated therefore he needs to improve his car with a newer car. Halhaman is a very modest and decent man and says, "My goals are to increase my working capital for my business and have my own capital." He is requesting a 3,600,000 MNT loan in order to buy a new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Raelonda

texts.en:
Raelonda C. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Raelonda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Raelonda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods  and snack foods in the local community. Raelonda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Raelonda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raelonda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Raelonda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Raelonda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 33 years old and married.  She owns a business that sells different items such as soaps, curry powder, and other items. Her husband works as a businessman.  She has been selling these items for 12 years.  Her loan will be used to buy more items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build  a house on the plot of land she bought.

loans.use: To purchase items such as soaps, curry powder, and  handbags

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: The photograph shows Horn O. at work growing fruit O. her farm. Horn O. and her husband make their daily revenue by working as local farmers in the village. This couple has been married for a few years, but they have not had children yet. The family owns a medium-sized piece of farmland where they plant jackfruit, banana, and mango trees, and they always get a good result from their planting. In order to earn an extra profit, Horn O. wishes to buy a piece of land to grow more fruit crops in a larger amount than at the present time. This loan will provide her family with this additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in order to grow more fruit crops

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma pertenece al banco comunal “Camino Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella vende ropa interior (lencería) de adultos y niños por catálogo, desde hace 8 años. También Norma es peluquera y trabaja medio día (durante la tarde), de lunes a sábado en una peluquería. Además realiza trabajos  particulares como peluquera, pero a domicilio. 
Con este préstamo comprará un catálogo de ropa interior actualizado de otoño - invierno y los encargos de sus clientes. Para lo que viajará a Santiago, como todos los meses, cada 15 días.
Norma vive con su esposo, quien recibe una pequeña pensión y su hija quien es mayor de edad y trabaja de forma dependiente medio día.
El sueño de Norma es tener una peluquería.
Para Norma Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo que le ha permitido crecer en su negocio, ya que gracias a los préstamos puede comprar los materiales de peluquería para trabajar de manera particular y ha mantenido su negocio de ropa interior.
Además le han servido mucho el talleres de educación emprendedora, especialmente uno referente a cómo ahorrar organizando sus gastos y ganancias, el cual se les enseño a su grupo durante una reunión de Fondo Esperanza, de parte de su asesor.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the “Camino Esperanza” (Hope Road) communal bank in the city of Viña del Mar.  She has sold underwear (lingerie) for adults and children via catalogue for the last 8 years.  She is also a barber and works half days (in the afternoon) from Monday through Saturday in a barber shop.  In addition, she provides private in-home barber services.

She will use this loan to buy a current fall-winter lingerie catalogue and her customer’s pending orders.  To do so, she will travel to Santiago like she does monthly, every two weeks.
