Norma lives with her husband who receives a small pension and her adult daughter who works independently half days.Norma’s dream is to own a barber shop.

For Norma, Fondo Esperanza has been a great help in that it has made it possible for her business to grow because thanks to the loans she has been able to buy barber supplies to work privately and has been able to stay in the lingerie business. In addition the business training workshops, especially those on how to save by organizing costs and profits, have been very useful.  These were taught by her Fondo Esperanza advisor during a group meeting.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune along the Chilean coast.  It is known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios some of the old homes in the city have.  It is also known as Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: For the fall-winter catalogue and for lingerie orders.

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of Furao Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Delia is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Delia A..

Delia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia raises livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Delia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase hog feed and other supplies. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and other supplies

loans.name: Begum's Group

texts.en:
Begum is a housewife and prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She is 55 years old but still very active and does her work very well. Her husband’s name is K. and he is a mason by profession. He is very good at his work and builds homes and buildings with great skill.

Begum gave birth to a son, Adil, and he is involved in a business selling fruits and vegetables. He couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial conditions of his parents, so he started this work in his early teens. His shop is located near his home and he offers quality fruits and vegetables to his clients at cheaper rates.

Begum has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to buy more seasonal vegetables and fruits for selling through his shop. He has been operating this business for more than 10 years and Begum is hopeful that an investment will help her son to improve his business and increase his income.

She a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loans, she never gave a cause to complain and met her responsibilities effectively. She is a resident of a small city called Kot Radha Kishen in Pakistan. She has been living there in a three-room brick house with her family for past 20 years.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some cosmetic things for her beauty salon

loans.name: Urpayan's Group

texts.en:
Urpayan B., 50, is the leader of this group. She and her husband and their kids live in the town of Tashkomur. Her husband is a truck driver. The oldest sons work in Russia and the youngest go to school. Urpayan herself is a cattle breeder. 

More than twenty years ago, her mother-in-law gave her a goat, and that’s when she decided to deepen this business. She succeeded and increased the business to fifteen head. Now it generates a monthly revenue of about $256. The loan will be spent on purchasing sheep for further reselling. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Bakyara Twekambe Group B, Ibanda

texts.en:
N. Kurusam is the leader of Bakyara Twekambe group B in Ibanda. She is 28 years old and married with two children who are twins. Kurusam has had a grocery store in Kyaruhanga that sells foodstuffs and other domestic items for four years; she is able to make 180,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) as weekly income. Her customers are basically the general public. 

Before starting her business, she sold her 10 goats and got an additional 100,000 UGX from her father. She is also involved in the rearing of chickens. Being hard working has enabled her to succeed. She hopes for an educated family and expanded business and at the moment, she needs a loan to be able to purchase more grocery products.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products for resale

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina, de 35 años, es una mujer  espontánea y trabajadora, convive con Roberto de 36 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. Ella desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra,  hoy es campesina, y con sus ahorros más el sueldo de su pareja compraron su propio terreno donde cultiva plantas de café, cacao, barbasco y hojas de coca. Esta actividad lo realiza todos los días, desde muy temprano dirigiéndose a trabajar en sus tierras, pues sabe que las ganancias obtengan por la venta de sus productos dependerá mucho de su esfuerzo. Su cosecha es trasladada desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde mejores precios recibe por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, sin embargo le es difícil trabajar en temporadas de lluvia, porque perjudican el rendimiento de su trabajo. En el futuro espera trabajar con la misma perseverancia que la caracteriza. Este es su  octavo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con el crédito comprará sacos de abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Enedina is 35 years old.  She is a spontaneous and hard-working woman who lives with 36 year-old Roberto and her three beloved children who she would like to provide with a good education. 

Since she was very young, Enedina's parents taught her to work on the farm.  She is now a farmer and, with her savings and her partner's wage, she bought her own plot of land where she grows coffee plants, cacao, barbasco and coca leaf.  Enedina carries out her work every day, from very early in the morning.  She goes out to work on her land since she knows that the profits she makes when she sells her products will depend a lot on her efforts.

Enedina transports her harvested crops from her community to the warehouse centers which are located in San Francisco. This is where she receives the best prices for her products.  What Enedina most enjoys about her work is harvesting since that is when she feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  In the future, Enedina hopes to work with the same perseverance that characterizes her now.  This is her eighth loan from MFP.  She says that this loan will help her greatly in making progress in her work.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank.  She will use her loan to buy sacks of manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 49-year-old, married woman with 7 children, 4 of whom are in school. Corazon is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, which she has had for 22 years.

Corazon requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Faima

texts.en:
Faima is 27 years of age.  She is married and has four children. Faima owns & operates a clothing business selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has 3 years of experience in this business. 

Faima needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit generated (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Faima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faima's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: purchase fabrics & clothing materials

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child.

Emmanuel is providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) services. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.

Emmanuel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emmanuel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Dios Bendice 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is one of the members of the “Dios Bendice” (God Bless) 3, 4 & 5 group which has 15 micro-businesswomen. They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc. Margarita lives in the city of La Romana. Its economy depends on tourism and the sugarcane industry. It also has a sizable population of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants who live in communities with very limited resources.

Margarita is very excited to receive her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business’ growth. She has had her business for about four years; she started it with some savings her husband had. He gave them to her to start up her business. She is running a candy shop stall, and she is planning on investing the new loan in buying snacks, juices, candies, gums, and many other products. She sells them by walking around and waiting for various schools to get out.

Margarita’s family is made up of herself, her long-term partner and their five children. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to have her own house. She really enjoys working and attending church. She will use her profits to invest in her business and to start building her house, little by little and with some help from her long-term partner.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juice, candies, etc.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado La Esperanza, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Cuenta actualmente con 17 miembros. Todas ellas trabajan activamente ya que saben que el trabajo es la única forma de salir adelante. Todas ellas tienen un propósito en común, y es procurar por un futuro mejor para sus familiares. El requisito esencial de este comité es la unidad, ya que son solidarias las unas con las otras.
La Sra. Primitiva se dedica a la venta de leche, ella cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas para repartir la leche, para que a la hora del desayuno ya esté en la mesa de sus clientes. Sueña con algún día pode tener una lecheria donde vender su producto.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas leche, ya que por cantidad le sera mas económico, y gracias a esto su margen de ganancia sera mayo.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” (The Hope) Communal Bank is in the city of San Lorenzo.  It currently has 17 members.  They all actively work because they know that the work is the only way to get ahead.  All of them have the same purpose, and that is to get a better future for their families. The essential requirement of this communal bank is unity because they are supportive of one another.

Primitiva sells milk.  She says that her work is very self-sacrificing because she gets up very early every day in order to deliver the milk.  She does this so that it is on her customers’ tables at breakfast time.

She dreams that one day she will be able to have a dairy where she can sell her product.

She is requesting the loan to buy more milk.  Buying in quantity is more economical.  Thanks to this, her profit margin will be greater.

loans.use: to buy milk to later sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a married woman with one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past two years, Edith has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Competition from other vegetable stall operators in the market is her major challenge.

Edith decided to join Yehu to access its loans. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a sewing machine to start a tailoring business. She dreams of establishing a good tailoring business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to start a tailoring business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, age 56, is a vendor of snack foods. She prepares and sells items such as rice cakes and suman (sweetened rice). She has been engaged in this business for five years. She and her husband have six children.

Elena has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks to offer for sale.
 
Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rthe aw ingredients needed for making snacks such as rice cakes and suman (sweetened rice) to offer for sale

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо жительница города Исфары. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Зебо более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает орехи, миндаль и изюм. Кредит берет для покупки сухофруктов, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Zebo lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Zebo has been involved in retail sales for over eight years.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells nuts, almonds and raisins.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dried fruits in order to increase the assortment of her products.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 24 years old and single. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. Joy raises pigs to earn a living. She has a small backyard piggery. Joy also sells fish to the people in her community. Joy buys directly from fishermen in her town.

Joy has requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. She hopes to save for her future family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a hardworking 29-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has two children. For the last four years, she has been weaving mats and baskets. She really thanks God for giving her talent in crafts because she is able to earn a living for her family. In the next five years, she wants to build her own home. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy beads and thread for weaving.

loans.use: to buy beads and thread.

loans.name: Avigail Judith

texts.es:
Avigail de 64 años es una mujer trabajadora que hace 11 años empezo vendiendo helados, Jugos y continuo con snacks ahora vende peluches. En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace sola de 8:00am hasta las 21:00pm de lunes a domingos. Unas de sus dificultades es cuando llega a enfermarse ya que no puede vender. Con el prestamp quiere comprar bebeidas y helados para mejorar sus ingresos. 

Unas de sus metas es poder tener un local mas grande para poder vender sus helados y peluches.
texts.en:
Avigail, age 64, is a hard-working woman.  Eleven years ago she started selling ice cream, juice, and continued with snacks.  She now sells stuffed animals.  She currently works alone from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. on Mondays through Sundays.  One of her difficulties is that when she gets sick, she is not able to sell.

She wants to use the loan to buy drinks and ice cream in order to improve her income.  One of her goals is to be able to have a larger place to sell her ice cream and stuffed animals.

loans.use: to buy drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.en:
Ambrocio is 39 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Three of his children are in high school together. Ambrocio's wife is a housekeeper, at the same time managing a small business in their village. Ambrocio engages in farming, planting rice in their village. 

To make extra income, Ambrocio has a hog raising business. He has been in this business for 20 years. Because of the increasing price of pig feed, Ambrocio needs additional working capital to maintain his business. He is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. 

In the future, Ambrocio wishes for the growth of his business. His goal is to gain more income in preparation for sending his children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Beber

texts.es: Beber, de 38 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y muy amable, convive con Juliana, y juntos tiene un hijo de dos años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Beber es la venta de pan, alimento que previamente los compra en la panadería y los lleva a vender de forma ambulante por diversas zonas de su barrio, así como en zonas aledañas. Paralelo a esto también brinda préstamo de dinero con intereses del 20% a 20 días, puede ser a vecinos, familiares y personas de confianza. Ambos negocios lo realiza desde hace 6 meses, y lo que le gusta es poder contar con un ingreso económico con el cual pueda pagar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, por ello considera rentable porque le ha ido bien en ambas actividades logrando tener ganancias, y sin tener muchos contratiempos con el pago de sus deudas. Tiene planes de crecer su capital de trabajo y abrir  un local denominado casas de empeño. Este sería el crédito número cinco con MFP, se siente bien con su grupo comunal, ya que son personas responsables. Por otro lado desea seguir contando con el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en préstamos, así también en la compra de pan.
texts.en: Beber is38 years old and a hardwroking and friendly man. He lives in a common-law marriage with his partner Juliana and together they have a 2 year old child. They live in their own house. Beber sells bread, which he buys previously from a bakery and then sells on the street in various areas of his neighbourhood as well as in areas close by. He also has a business loaning money at 20% for 20 days to neighbours, relatives and trust-worthy people. He has been running both businesses for 6 months and what he likes is to be able to count on an income with which to pay his household expenses. For this reason he thinks the businesses profitable as he is doing well and making profit without too many problems with the payment of his debts. He has plans to grow his working capital and open a denominated pawn house. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he feels good about his communal bank group as they are responsible people. On the other hand he wants to be able to continue counting with your support. With the amount requested, he will invest it in loans and also to buy bread.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Su Chiang

texts.es:
Su Chiang participa en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad de Su Chiang es la elaboración de productos en base a la Soya.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  

Su Chiang requiere el préstamo para comprar soya.   

Su Chiang se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Su Chiang is a member of Inti Pakareq, an Asociacion Arariwa community bank in Cusco. She operates a business making soy-based products.  She has owned the business for several years and is satisfied with the progress she's made.
 
Su Chiang will use this loan to buy supplies of soybeans for her business.

Su Chiang is grateful for the opportunity that this type of lending provides and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy soy for her retail business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has five children. 

Francisco has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. He has had this business for ten years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Francisco has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Francisco hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is 35 years old. She is very active and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. Her passion with her work enables her to create new designs which increases her sales and profits every month.

Her husband is a contractor as well as an animal seller. He purchases goats and sheep in their younger age from an animal market and then sells them for profit after raising them.

He has vast experience in this field and knows the ups and downs of his business very well.

Manzooran is the mother of three daughters and a son. Two of them study while the other two are not yet of school age.

She is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s animal sales business. With this loan investment, he will purchase goats and sheep in larger numbers and selling them to butchers at a profit.

Manzooran is hopeful that her husband will have greater success in his business after this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for animal selling business

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es:
El  grupo se llama San Judas y se integra de  tres señoras quien  cada una tiene su  respectiva actividad y viven en una localidad muy bonita ya que tiene un excobento.

La señora quien se le tomo la  entrevista se llama  María Flor de Luz, ella es casada con el señor  Amín y con quien procreo  una hija que tiene la edad de tres años, solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de refrescos, como también  es para darle mantenimientos a sus maquinitas de video  juego.
 Quien lo motivo a  esta actividad fue su esposo  ya que llego un señor quien daba rentado maquinitas y como  su esposo tenia  a unos  ahorros le  rento dos y después con el tiempo se las compro  y comenta que le va bien ya  que con  las ganancias  ha comprado mas que ya tiene quince  juegos.

 Lo que más desea  es que con su pequeña   actividad pueda mejorar cada día más sus  ingresos  para que con el tiempo  tenga una papelería.
 
  Quienes integran en el grupo son las  señoras: María  quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas y la señora Sonia,  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de ropas.
texts.en:
The group is called San Judas, and it is comprised of three women.  Each one of them has their respective business activity.  They live in a very pretty place because it has an ex-convent. 

María Flor de Luz is the woman who was interviewed.  She is married to Amín, and they have a three year old daughter.

She requested the loan to buy soft drinks.  She will also use the loan for maintenance on her video game machines.

Her husband motivated her in this business activity.  A man arrived who rented out the small machines.  As her husband had some savings, he rented two.  Later, as time passed, he bought the machines.  She says that it is going very well for her.  With the income she has bought more, and she now has 15 games.

What she wishes for the most is that with her small business she will be able to improve her income each day.  She wants this to, in time, open a stationery business.

María is a member of the group.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make food.  Sonia, the other member of the group, will use the loan to buy and sell clothes.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her small machines.

loans.name: Elaisa Mae

texts.en:
Elaisa Mae  is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Elaisa Mae  has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Elaisa Mae  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elaisa Mae  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenitas’s goal in life is to lift her family out of poverty. She is 50 years old and blessed with three children. Nenita is married to Lauro, a farmer in their village. Nenita operates a small store in which she sells different products. She has been in this business for two years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) monthly. Profits earned are used for allowances and food, and serve as a revolving capital in the business. 

Nenita's business needs additional products to sell such as canned goods, instant noodles, and beverages to increase her profits. She is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bakery bread, sugar, coffee and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 56 years old and lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four adult children.

Teofila has a general store in progress. Teofila, at this time, is operating her other business venture, raising crops, particularly corn. She has been in this business 20 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

In 2007, Teofila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Teofila hopes to expand her cornfield.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rebaz

texts.en:
Rebaz is a 23-year-old Iraqi man with a bakery. His bakery has been generating income for him for the past five years, allowing him to contribute to the living expenses of his family. Although he is single and living in a multi-generation household, he plays an active role in supporting the household.

In the past Rebaz took a loan from Relief International - Iraq, which allowed him to buy a large mixer machine for making the bread dough. After successfully repaying the first loan, Rebaz took a loan of 1,200 USD, which he would like to use to renovate the interior of the bakery. He plans to remove the smoky built-up residue from the walls and make the area cleaner and brighter.

Rebaz is under 30, qualifying for a youth loan.

loans.use: to renovate the interior of his bakery

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en:
Sambat, 34, lives in a rural village of Pursat province’s Bakan district, Cambodia. She is a single woman who makes a living by farming rice. Having been in this business for 3 years, she is able to earn about 45,000KHR per day but she can save about 30,000KHR each after daily expenses. 
Sambat has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.en: Ricardina lives with her husband (Simon) they have their own house and they sell milk she is a mother but her sons are adults already and they live at the city She is in the dairy business for more than 20 years She is a senior person but she is healthy and she likes to work she needs a loan to buy a new milking cow she hopes you can trust her

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Imunwanhen

texts.en: A business-woman with 24 years experience, Mrs Imunwanhen A. lives in Benin City with two children.  She needs the loan amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
Maliha, D/O M. D., is 30 and married and lives in District 7 of Kabul City. Her family has 4 members. She studied up to high school when the Taliban government started, and she and her family emigrated from Afghanistan where she was unable to complete her education.

After the fall of the Taliban Government she returned to Afghanistan and started a knitting business in order to financially support her family. She is at her 1st loan cycle, and through the loan amount she wants to purchase more materials for her business and earn as much income as possible to fulfill her and her family's daily requirements. She is happy with the loan process and wants to carry on with it.

loans.use: Buying More Knitting Materials

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Dr. Elsa is the owner of a bazar, which is located in her home. She began her business with money she earned from her orothodontist practice. With the earnings she made from her practice, she was able to invest in merchandise. She works from 7am-9pm. She also continues to practice her profession from her home. She sells gift items, stationary, pens and also has a photocopier where she can make copies. She has been involved in this activity for ten years.

Dr. Elsa wishes to adquire more products for her bazar, because she has been re-furbishing her home and her capital has seen a decrease. What's more, she has to meet the demand for more gift products and to do this, she needs to stock her business and tend to her customers.

Dr. Elsa is 35 years old, has four children, but only 3 are in school. She lives with her husband who helps her with maintenence work in the house. Her 13 year old daughter helps her in the bazar when Elsa is seeing patients. Her house is a two story cement home, which has recently seen some improvement works. The Doctor hopes to work with us and through which, improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Dra. Elsa es propietaria de un bazar que se encuentra en su domicilio. Lo inicio con el dinero que ganaba con su consultorio odontológico. Ella con la ganancia que tenia de su consultorio fue invirtiendo en mercadería. Atiende de 7am – 9pm.Además sigue ejerciendo su profesión allí en su domicilio. En el bazar vende todo lo que es artículos para regalos, papelería, plumas y también tiene una fotocopiadora y saca copias. Ella lleva 10 años dedicada a esta actividad.

La Dra. Elsa desea adquirir más productos para su bazar, porque ha estado adecuando su casa y su capital ha bajado un poco. Además ella tiene demanda de otros productos como mas artículos para regalos por eso quiere abastecerse y atender a sus clientes.

La Dra. Elsa tiene 35 años, de edad y 4 hijos, solo 3 estudian. Ella vive con su esposo quien le ayuda en la manutención del hogar. Su hija de 13 años le ayuda en el negocio cuando ella esta atendiendo a pacientes. Su casa es de 2 pisos de cemento y recién ha hecho algunas adecuaciones. La Dra. aspira trabajar con nosotros de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Supply her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin lives in the home of his mother-in-law with his wife and their children. It is located on "K" Street in the zone of "Alto Llojeta" in the city of La Paz. He is 29 years old and since he was very young he has been dedicated to fixing automobiles with varnish, veneer, paint, etc. He does this in a room of their house which faces the street. His wife put a little grocery shop in the same room, and there is mixing of paints and gasolines with the grocery products. For this reason they are requesting a loan to construct another space on the side, and in this way separate the grocery store and the garage.

This is is his first loan. Their flow of funds shows a sufficient income to cover the costs and repay the loan. The construction of this new space is very important because it will make both businesses more professional. Their desire to improve qualifies them for an opportunity to receive a micro credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Martin vive en casa de su suegra con su esposa y sus hijos, en la calle k de la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 29 años de edad desde muy joven se dedica al arreglo de automóviles, como ser chapeado, barnizado, pintado, etc. en una habitación de la casa que da a la calle; la esposa puso una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la misma habitación y esta mezclando pinturas, gasolina y otros con el producto de la tienda, por lo cual ellos solicitaron el crédito para construir un ambiente al lado y así separar lo que es tienda y lo que es el taller.

Este es su primer crédito; el flujo de fondos muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir costos y pago de crédito. La construcción de este nuevo ambiente es muy importante pues así el aspecto de ambos negocios será más profesional. Este deseo de superación los califica para darles una oportunidad de acceso al micro crédito.

loans.use: Construction that will separate Martin's auto business from his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Dulce María

texts.en: Dulce, 40 years old, is married with four children (3 girls and a boy).  Her husband is in the military and is working at Santo Domingo, the capital.  Dulce sells men’s underwear and shoes in her house.  She started the business two years ago in order to help her husband face the housing issues.  In fact, the military is not well paid in the country.  She’s now requesting a loan to buy more shoes and some pants because during all the holiday season, she’ll offer her products at lower prices.  This way, she’ll be promoting the pants that she’ll introduce to the business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of shoes to sell in the holiday season.  Also to introduce pants in the business

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mr. S. El is 65 years old and his wife Mrs. Tres Sio is 56 years old. The couple got married in 1979 and have 3 daughters. El and his family are currently in the fishing business. He started his fishing business in 1979. His wife helps him with selling fish in the local village. They both did not finish primary school. All of his daughters are married and help with the fishing too.

This is Mr S.'s first loan with MAXIMA. He will use this $500 loan to purchase fishing nets and a new fisher boat.

loans.use: Purchasing fishing net and one boat for fishing.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
Gina is part of the group called Mientras Tanto, Nueva Amistad (new friendship). She lives in the region of San Martin where she has a business selling grilled meats and snacks. Her children and her husband help her prepare these items in their home. With the loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she has been able to grow her business. She now has a covered space with tables and chairs to serve her clients, and her business is growing every day. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy materials for the roof, utensils for preparing and serving her food, as well as soft drinks.

La señora Gina pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Nueva Amistad”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, domiciliada en la Asociación de Vivienda Nueva Amistad Mz B Lote 1 donde también está ubicado su negocio de venta de salchipapas y asaditos . En su casa le apoyan los hijos y el esposo en la preparación de estos alimentos y con el apoyo del préstamo de Manuela Ramos ha podido incrementar su negocio, de tal forma que ahora cuenta con un espacio techado y mesas para atender a sus clientes que día a día van aumentando. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará calaminas para el techado, utensilios para el servicio y bebidas gaseosas. La señora Gina tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella se siente alentada por el apoyo de su familia y agradecida del apoyo de Manuela Ramos y tiene fuerzas para seguir adelante ya que sus niños aún son pequeños y quiere trabajar para poder educarlos. Está segura que su negocio es una gran oportunidad para crecer y poder cumplir con todas sus metas.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE ITEMS SHE NEEDS TO CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS, INCLUDING UTENSILS FOR PREPARING FOOD AND SERVING HER CUSTOMERS.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili, 37, has a small food stall. Her husband, M., is not working anymore, so to provide for her family's needs, she sells snacks and beverages at her small stall, earning about US$ 70 a month. She is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to buy more goods for her stall. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her stall

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun N. , 43, and her husband, Phum Pheary, were married in 1985. They have seven children; two sons and five daughters. Her family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Four of their children are selling flowers, two are studying, and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. N. has been in the business of growing and selling rose and jasmine flowers since 2000. She purchases them in her village and resells them in the city of Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker and farmer. They hope that their occupations will continue to support the family and allow their children to continue in school.

Mrs. N. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for traveling to Phnom Penh and for purchasing additional flowers for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and flowers for resale

loans.name: Usmonjon

texts.en: Usmonjon A. lives in the Spitamen region. He is 37 years old married with five children. He is engaged in the family business of growing and selling rice, onions, potatoes and carrots. Besides that, he also is engaged in wholesale tea trading. He has a good assortment of tea. Mr. A. is applying for a loan of 2,100 STJ for the required seasonal preparation that permits him to have the good yield and to yield the vegetables he can further trade.

loans.use: The required seasonal preparation

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Where there is an opportunity to sell her delicacies, Teresa is there. From Monday to Friday she sells delicacies from her small cart outside of a school. Weekends she is located inside a market and for seasons she has participated in fairs or in local holidays always selling her delicacies. Sadly, last week Teresa suffered from an automobile accident, which left her with a fracture of her arm. For that reason she has stopped working for a time. Happily she can count on the support of her husband who also works at the same thing that she does and who, these days, is her only company. For now, she hopes to recover and to be able to work again.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Donde sea que tenga la oportunidad de vender sus golosinas teresa esta ahí. De lunes a viernes ella vende en su pequeña carretilla golosinas afuera de un colegio. Los fines de semana se ubica dentro de un mercado y por temporadas participa en ferias o en fiestas patronales vendiendo siempre sus golosinas. Lamentablemente, la semana pasada Teresa sufrió de un accidente automovilístico, el cual la dejo con una fractura en su brazo, razón por la cual ha dejado de trabajar por un tiempo. Felizmente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también trabaja en lo mismo que ella y quien, por estos días, significa su única compañía. Por ahora, ella espera reestablecerse y poder volver a trabajar.

loans.use: To invest in her business of selling delicacies.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Born May 13, 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mrs. Jeanne P. is a widowed mother of four children, whom she takes care of alone. She has lived in Cotonou for over a decade, where she has been involved in sales, particularly selling various products such as canned goods, school supplies, pasta and soap, and making and selling lollipops and yogurt. She is an earnest woman who has excellent relations with those around her, which helps attract customers to her store. She is currently in great need of financial assistance in order to buy supplies. She is thus requesting this loan to satisfy her customers, who expect a lot from her.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 13 mai 1956 à COTONOU la capitale économique du BENIN, dame P. Jeanne est veuve et mère de 4 enfants tous à sa charge. Installée depuis plus d’une décennie à COTONOU, elle exerce dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de produits divers tels que les boîtes de conserves, les fournitures scolaires, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons et aussi la fabrication et la commercialisation des sucettes et de yaourt. De bonne moralité, elle entretient de très bonne relation avec son entourage ce qui lui permet d’attirer plus de clients. Actuellement elle manque cruellement de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner. Pour cela elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui attend beaucoup d’elle.

loans.use: Purchasing 15 bags of coal, repairing a refrigerator, purchasing three bowls of cassava flour and 30,000 CFA francs to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua N. is fifty years old. She is married with six children. She is a very resourceful woman and her biggest wish is to provide quality education for her children and give them better life opportunities. At the moment, three have completed senior high school, while the rest are in primary school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil for nine years now. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel, which is a by-product of palm oil. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to facilitate the production process and increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband, provide food for her family, and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called “So mu yie” (Handle with care) Trust Group and she was photographed at her group meeting. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Ahadjon

texts.en:
V. Ahadjon is 31 years old. He is married with three children. Ahadjon drives a taxi car. He has been engaged in this work for more than five years. The current business is the main source of income for his large family. In addition to his children and wife, he is also supporting his parents and brothers. Ahadjon has told us that this type of work requires a lot of effort. In order to obtain a decent wage he has to work at night, particularly in the early morning hours. Ahadjon has to get up early and go to bed late to try to not to lose any clients. Ahadjon has no higher education but he wants this for his children and younger brothers.

Ahadjon wants to fix his car in order to provide higher quality services and earn more to support his younger brothers with a higher education. Ahadjon requests 600 USD for the term of 6 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Ahadjon’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing the spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru:
Zebonisso S. lives in the Djallolidini Rumi region of Tajikistan. She is 30 years old, divorced and has 3 children. Zebonisso supports her family by herself, without any other help. She sells clothing at the "Barakat" market. Zebonisso wants to expand the assortment of goods she offers for sale and in turn increase goods turnover and for this purpose she has applied for this loan. Zebonisso is hoping to attract new customers to her stand by providing more clothing choices for sale. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Султанова Зебонисо проживает в районе Джаллолидини Руми. Возраст 30 лет, разведена и имеет троих детей. Обеспечивает семью без чьей-либо помощи. Занимается торговлей на рынке «Баракат». Торгует одеждой. Хочет увеличить товарооборот и ассортимент товаров , путем получения кредита. Таким образом она сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase goods turnover

loans.name: Orison

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Orison B. is a married 61-year-old woman with five children; she also supports two other dependents. All of her children and dependents are between 25 and 36 years of age. In 2007, Orison opened a pharmacy, from which she earns about 120 USD per month. Orison is requesting a loan of 875 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of medicine in bulk. Orison is assisted at her pharmacy by one employee and plans to increase the quantity and range of her offerings in the future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase medicines in bulk

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 33 años, es soltera, vive sola en la casa de sus padres.  Se dedica a confeccionar casacas, trajes, sacos, etc., en su sastrería, la cual ya lleva 8 años de funcionamiento.  Su trabajo comienza desde muy temprano y se alarga hasta la noche o según la cantidad de pedidos, a veces puede terminar temprano o muy tarde, aunque pueda ser cansado, Olga no se amilana y trabaja con mucho gusto, ya que ella tiene el pensamiento de que si elabora un traje con alegría este saldrá mucho mejor. Su deseo es progresar en su negocio, y tener una estabilidad económica para cumplir sus sueños.  Con el dinero solicitado comprará material, telas, hilos, etc., para producir de una mejor manera e incrementar sus ingresos económicos y así poder trabajar para que su sastrería en el futuro sea mucho más grande y cotizada.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old. She is single and lives alone in her parents' house. She dedicates herself to making clothing in her tailor's shop which she has been running for eight years. Her work starts very early and extends until late at night depending the quantity of orders. She sometimes finishes early or late. Although the work is tiring, Olga does not complain and she works with a lot of enthusiasm because her point of view is that if she makes a suit with joy it will turn out much better. Her wish is to improve in her business and to be economically stable so that she can fulfill her dreams. With the money from the loan she is requesting she will purchase materials such as fabric, thread, etc. to make better products and to increase her profits so that her shop can be much larger and valued.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal S., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhom Tem, 42, who live in a small village off of national road two about twenty kilometers South of Phnom Penh, were married in 1985 and have five children; three sons and two daughters. All of them study in the local school.

Mr. Sophal has been a mason for ten years. His wife has been selling vegetables for ten years as well. She buys vegetables from Ta Khmao market for resale at her village. Sophal is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables for his wife for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his wife to resell

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Rorn C. is 38 years old and she now lives in Pour Duos village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Mey Reth, is a construction worker. They both earn little income and they have difficulty in providing better conditions for their household. In order to improve this, Mrs. Sa Rorn C. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

She has four children, one of whom is a window designer, while another two attend the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Chham

texts.en:
Chham M. is 46 years old, a resident of Kompong Tom province. He plays the Khmer musical instrument to provide entertainment for wedding parties and other ceremonies, as well as raising pigs from his house. He started his businesses more than 10 years ago, and currently earns the money of approximately $5 a day. He is married to Mom Yorn, with five children. One of his daughters is employed as a garment worker in the Phnom Penh City. Mom Yorn is 46 years old and earns a living by selling Khmer cake as well as raising pigs with her husband.

Mr. M. has applied for a loan to buy more pig food and a pumping machine to pump water for his family's using. (The picture shows M.'s wife because he was not available.)

loans.use: To buy more pig food and a pumping machine.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Siem Reap Commune in Kandal Province, Cambodia. The group leader, Mrs. S., is 56 years old and sells vegetables at the Chom Bok Market. She has been selling vegetables since a year ago, and normally earns an income of $4 per day.

She is married and has three children; two of whom are married and the other one is single and employed as a garment worker. Her husband's name is Mr. Neang and he is a taxi driver who provides a service for tourists.

S. hopes to expand her business; thus, she requests a loan to buy various kinds of vegetables for sale. The three other borrowers include S., who is a fish seller and a widow; she needs a loan to buy more fish to sell. S. sells vegetables and she requests a loan to buy vegetables for sale. S. K. sells food and soft drink. She is applying for a loan to enlarge her investment.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya A. is 40-year-old woman who runs her own small business raising sheep and cattle for meat production. She sells fattened and raised animals to the local livestock bazaar or to the restaurants. She has been in this business since she got married. Because she was unemployed, her husband offered her an opportunity to begin raising cattle. Soon, this business start bringing stable income to her family, which consists of three children. 

Zulfiyya would like to expand her sheep herd and purchase one more calf. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase five sheep, one calf and fodder. Zulfiyya and her family count on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase five sheep, one calf, and fodder.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. is thirty–five years old. She is married and has a son who is currently in the basic school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Bekwai are involved in commercial activities. Abena’s husband is a mason by profession.

Abena trades to support her husband. She deals in secondhand textile materials such as towels and bed sheets. She buys bales of secondhand textiles from the wholesalers in Kumasi and retails her goods in her community. Abena has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy more bales of second hand textiles. It is her dream to support her husband financially to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure bales of second hand textiles

loans.name: Aloune Thiam

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune Thiam M. est un commerçant marié qui habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Il est jeune, mais il a commencé de faire le commerce depuis très longtemps.  Avant, il gérait une alimentation générale, mais actuellement il vend des fruits et il fait la navette entre Walo et Thies pour acheter des oignons et du riz et les revendre en gros.  Avec ce crédit il va acheter ces produits et utiliser les revenus pour soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alioune Thiam M. is a married merchant who lives in Thiès, a city located 70 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He's young, and yet he's been in this business for a very long time. Previously, he used to run a grocery store, but now he sells fruits. He also travels to Walo and back to get onions and rice supplies, that he resells wholesale. With this loan, he will get such supplies, and use the profits to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions and rice

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru: Абдувахобу 42 лет. У него есть жена и 5-ро детей. Три сына и две дочки. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Дочки помогают по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Абдувахоб пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Недавно он узнал у соседей, что можно взять кредит в нашей организации, для увеличения количества скота. Теперь он наш клиент.
texts.en:
Abduvahob is 42 years old. He is married with five children, three sons and two daughters. His adult sons have left for Russia, where they work and send money home to their parents. The parents are saving this money for their sons' weddings. The daughters help around the house. The mother processes wool and sells it at the market. Abduvahob herds cattle in the mountains and returns home very late. Recently his neighbors told him that he could get a loan from our organization and increase cattle herd. Now Abduvahob is our client.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Fiazullah

texts.en: This is Fiazullah, the son of M. J. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 49 and married with five children. He has a shop in which he sells shampoo, soap and other sanitary products. He is a very hard working and confident man. He wants to increase his business, but he doesn’t have so much money for it. So he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy materials for his shop and to complete the requirements. He is thankful to all lenders for establishing these kinds of programs around the world.

loans.use: To buy materials for his shop

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Mrs. Estella S., of legal age, is married and blessed with 2 children.  Her husband is a driver and she also manages a sari-sari store business in her home.  She is a member of the Paglaum co-op and is able to maintain her record as a member in good standing.  She accessed a loan from the co-op to capitalize her business, hoping to have a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: C. M., 22, is a younger mother who has one lovely kid who is enrolled in school. She is married to Sopear (pictured), 29, who works as a goldsmith in the market. She is currently buying and selling used goods from her home, and is earning an average of $2 income per day. C. M. just started running her investment in early 2009, and she still needs additional money in order to improve her investment. Because of the lack of capital, C. M. is looking for an $1100 loan from Kiva. She will use this loan to increase her business capital and to buy some equipment for her husband’s job.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Nishongul

texts.ru: Нишонгул женщина 46 лет. Замужем и имеет 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Нишонгул откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Нишонгул продает их на скотном рынке. Нишонгул кредитуется в нашей организации впервые. Она хочет взять займ для приобретения 2-х бычков. Нишонгул планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Нишонгул очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Nishongul is 46, married, and has two children. She, along with her husband, buys and raises cattle, which she feeds and sells. Her husband sells their cattle on the animal market. Nihongul is requesting her first loan from our organization. She wants a loan to purchase two bulls. She plans to increase the number of her livestock, so as to increase her family's profits. Nishongul likes the conditions of the loan and she is glad that such organizations like ours exist.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed and sale of cattle

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Калонова Сарвиноз проживает в районе Шахринава. Возраст 25 лет. Незамужем. Сарвиноз более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет дилерский центр, где торгует сим-картами и поплняет счет на телефоне. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sarvinoz K. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 25 years old and single. Sarvinoz has been involved in sales for over 5 years. She has a dealer center, where she sells SIM cards and refills phone accounts. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hard-working businesswoman. She has had a business selling used handbags for over seven years. She says that things are going okay, but times have been tough after the post-election violence in Kenya at the end of 2007. With a low level of stock, she says that she can’t attract a lot of customers.

With a child starting high school in January, Florence is concerned that she will not be able to afford the increased school fees. She would like to eventually take up small-scale farming in addition to the business she runs in town. With her loan proceeds, Florence will invest in a fresh supply of used handbags so that she can start bringing in the profits that she once did.

loans.use: More used handbags to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She has been in the business since 1990. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Cette dame vend uniquement des chaussures pour dame dans le Marché de Hédzranamoé à Lomé. Elle vend à la fois des sandalettes, des chaussures de sortie, des chaussures plates et différentes autres catégories de chaussures. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Ce commerce lui permet surtout de subvenir à ses propres besoins. Elle s’approvisionne le plus souvent dans le Grand Marché de Lomé ; des vendeuses ambulantes viennent en tout temps chez elle pour s’approvisionner. Pour renouveler son stock en baisse ces temps-ci, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 12 cartons de sandalettes, 15 cartons de chaussures de sortie et d’autres types de chaussures.
texts.en:
This lady sells only women's shoes at the Hédzranamoé Market of Lomé. All together, she sells sandalettes (flip flops), dress shoes, flats, and other types of shoes. She is not married and has no children to support. This business allows her above all to support herself. She usually stocks up at the Grand Market of Lomé; itinerant sales women come to her at any time to stock up. To renew her recently diminished inventory, she's requesting a WAGES loan to order 12 boxes of sandalettes, 15 boxes of dress shoes, and other types of footwear.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a very responsible husband and father.  He is 40years old and he is married to Myrna, 38 years old. They are blessed with two children: Melowin, 18 years old, a first year college student and Eron, four years old, already studying in a Day Care Center in their village.  Wilson is doing her best to provide the needs of his family and one of his goals is to send their children to school.  

Wilson has been managing a store and a bakeshop in their village. He has been in this kind of business for already two years and he always wanted to further grow his business, however, availability of sufficient capital hinders him. He hopes to avail a loan amounting to PHP7, 000 to be used as his additional working capital for his retail business. The loan will be of big help for the progress of his business so he prays that lenders will give him the opportunity of improving his general store and bakeshop

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron Harun A. is a former mason who retired back in 2001. His former work is most likely reflected in his strong-willed face. He is married with seven children who all depend on him for school fees.

Hezron retired from masonry and decided to concentrate on farming. First, it was for the family food production only but, as time went by, more needs arose. These needs needed money so he moved on to farming fresh farm produce which he has been doing since 2002.

Hezron requires a loan of Kshs 10,000 to expand his farming area and to buy more seedlings in time for the Christmas festivities. He also says he is proud of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his farming area and to buy seedlings

loans.name: Ballara

texts.en:
Ballara D. J.., 24 years old, is planning to settle down soon and have a family. But before he will engage to marriage, he wants to have a very stable farm or business, which he could rely on to supply his wife and children adequate food, clothes and other basic needs. He is planning to enrich the soil of his farm and he is interested in methodologies to make his harvest double in size.  

Ballara is requesting a loan of PHP5000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will help in buying farming necessities. Receiving the loan is truly worthwhile because this will give him and his family an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mr. Phanny Rorn Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phanny R. is the group leader of three members who all live in Trapeang Ampil village in Takeo province.

Mr. Phanny R. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Chi Srey Oun, raises pigs and chickens. Now she wants to expand her business because it is going well. Thus, Mr. Phanny R. decided to request a loan to buy some more piglets and chickens to raise. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and chickens for his wife's business

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is a young Palestinian man living in Bethlehem city. He has a small kiosk (stand) in the old city of Bethlehem at the vegetable & fruit market. Khader started this business 10 years ago when he was very young and he gained experience when he was even younger as his father also owns a vegetable and fruit shop and he used to help him.

Khader requested 2000 USD from FATEN to buy a large quantity of fruits and vegetables for Eid Al-Adha (a Muslim feast day), as wholesale merchants in such events request cash for providing the merchandise, especially since it becomes more expensive on such occasions. Also there is high demand next month as Christmas and New Year are coming in late December for Western Christians and early January for Eastern Christians.

Khader is still single and he hopes that very soon he will be economically independent and can afford the expected expenses of having a family. Khader appears in the picture at his business.

loans.use: Buy products for his vegetable and fruit kiosk

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia YOVANNA hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tienen una hija. La Hija Karol tiene 3 años y estudia en el jardín. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de condimentos y  distribución de los mismos en los mercados minoristas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para implementar una cabina de Internet en la plaza mayor del distrito de San Jerónimo. Ella desea comprar con los 1200 dólares suministros de computadoras.      

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yovanna has been a member of the communal bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) for one year. The member is a humble mother of one daughter, 28 years old and in a common-law relationship. Her daughter Karol is 3 years old and in kindergarten. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. The member varies her housework activities with a business selling and distributing condiments in the retail markets. She has been working in this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to all the determination she puts into her work. The member is a hard working woman and learns quickly in order to help her family progress. The member requires a loan to start an internet café in the main plaza in the San Jerónimo district. With the 1200 dollar loan, she will buy computer supplies. The member is very grateful for the opportunity brought by these means and promises to comply with the repayment timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requires the loan in order to start an internet cafe.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos en el caserío Quemazón, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 20 años de dedica a la comercialización de ganado caprino en un corral instalado en su casa. Usualmente compra las cabras para engordarlas y venderlas en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo o a los ocasionales compradores que visitan su caserío. Esta actividad es la única que sostiene a su familia. Motivo por el cual da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante.

Faustino se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más cabras para criarlas y venderlas luego de la temporada de fiestas de fin de año.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer mejoras en su vivienda, construída de material rústico, y brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les asegure un futuro prometedor. El es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Faustino is 46 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 4 children in Quemazón, in the district of Mórrope, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 20 years he has been raising goats in a coral at his home. Ordinarily he buys the goats to fatten them up and sell them in the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo or occasionally to buyers who visit his home. This is how he supports his family, and this is why he gives his all move his business forward. Faustino is asking for his first loan of 2000 PEN ($700) through “Edpyme Alternativa.” He will use the money to buy and raise additional goats so that he can sell them over the end of year holiday season. His greatest desire is to improve his rustic home and be able to provide his children the opportunity to get a quality education so that they will have a brighter future. He is a responsible father and is very dedicated to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goats

loans.name: Lima

texts.en:
Lima A. is 58 and married with 6 children (ages 10 - 24).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Lima has 7 years of experience in this business.  Lima needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 255 tala or US $106 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Lima joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lima's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Lima A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.99 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth J. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Elizabeth is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from the buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en:
Constantine is 28 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 6 years old. Constantine and her family live in Nyarugenge district, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here, Constantine has been in the business of selling clothes for about five years and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Constantine needs a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her original investment so that she is able to purchase more attractive styles for young people. With these attractive styles of clothes, Constantine will hopefully earn more profits and she will use these profits to reinvest in her business.

Once she arrives to this level, Constantine will continue to do her best so that she can keep her business financially stable.

loans.use: To buy additional styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children.

Elena owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Elena is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nuval

texts.en: Nuval C. is from the city of P-2 Lam-an, Ozamiz City. He is 25 years old. Nuval is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Nuval operates a motor-transport service. Nuval has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Nuval joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nuval has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Nuval is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing engine. This will be the second loan taken out by Nuval from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing engine

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem S., 27, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products.

She is employed in a local garment factory for an income of about USD 2.5 per day. Her husband provides transportation services to workers in the factory, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. (S.'s husband is pictured.)

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old one often needs repairs.

In the future she would like to use any additional profit to pay for her children’s school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.
