loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi de l’association Kotognogotala est un regroupement de 7  femmes   mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 7 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de  voisinage et  de parenté.
Depuis environ 10 ans, ces femmes du groupe Benkadi font la vente de riz,  de condiments alimentaires, du  bois de chauffe etc, et parmi elles se trouve une, à savoir Madame Astan Maïga, qui est  très sollicitée par ses clients pour la qualité du riz qu’elle offre. 
Elle s’approvisionne  sur place à San en gros et envisage acheter, 7 tonnes de riz qui seront revendus à San en demi gros et en détail à une clientèle constituée d’hommes et des femmes, en espèce et à crédit. 
 Tandis que Astan Maïga (qui ravitaille presque tous les policiers de la ville de San en riz) espère obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 42.000FCFA  les autres membres envisagent  avoir un bénéfice de 36.000FCFA, qui serviront à rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group, belonging to the Kotognogotala association, is a grouping of seven married women from the town of San, in Ségou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families, average 38 years of age and have at least seven children. They got to know each other through neighbors and relatives. For around ten years these women in the Benkadi group have been selling rice, food condiments, firewood etc.. Among them is one Astan Maïga, who is in great demand from her customers for the quality of the rice that she sells. She gets her supplies locally in San on a wholesale basis, and is planning to buy seven tons of rice which will be resold in San, partly wholsesale as well as retail to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit. While Astan Mäiga (who supplies rice to nearly all the policemen in San) hopes to make a monthly profit of 42,000FCFA, the other members of the group estimate that they will make a profit of 36,000FCFA, which will be used to repay their loan and provide for family needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en: Primitiva raises pigs to earn a living. She is 56 years old, married, with six children. She joined CEVI in 2005 but withdrew her membership to take a break. She rejoined because she thinks its program is really helpful to entrepreneurs like her who lack additional capital for their businesses. She recently applied for a loan of PHP 6,000. She will use it to buy additional piglets that she can raise. She will also purchase feed and supplements.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr: Née en Avril 1977, Z. Josiane est mariée à KILAYOSSI Rubin, un conducteur de taxi-auto. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec leur parents. Il y a deux ans environs que la famille s'est installée au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Josiane vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Josiane n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a près de quatre ans que Josiane mène comme activité, la vente d'oignons et aussi de lubrifiants au quartier N'Vènamédé à Cotonou. Josiane s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Josiane a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Josiane désire agrandir davantage son activité et mieux faire face aux différentes exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Josiane sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième pêt.
texts.en:
Born in April 1977, Josiane Z. is married to Rubin Kilayossi, a taxi driver. They have four children, all of whom live with their parents and go to school. About two years ago, the family settled in the Avotrou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Josiane helps her husband support the family, thanks to the income from her enterprise. Joisane finished only primary school. She has been selling onions and automotive lubricants in the N’Vènamede district of Cotonou for almost four years. Josiane purchases her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Josiane already had two previous loans from ALIDé, both of which were duly repaid. Josiane would like to expand her business and better meet the diverse needs of her clients. This is why she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of onions and cartons of motor oil [for resale]

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es: Agustín G. C., tiene la edad de 21 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Agustín tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Agustín G. C. is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase some calves and to feed them well. He wants to take good care of his cattle so that he can obtain the best possible price when he sells them. He also hopes to increase his number of animals and to be able to keep them under better conditions, in a suitable area for keeping and breeding cattle. This is the first time that he has received a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services they have offered him. Agustín has been raising cattle for several years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations sont le riz, l’arachide, le maïs et le petit mil. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Chitan Traoré compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 2 portent toute leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale avec l’aide de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women, on average 44 years old with three children. Most live in polygamous families in Nangola, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture of the Koulikouro region, which belongs to the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to undertake successfully their winter campaign activities. They speculate on rice, ground nuts, corn and millet. This is their fifth campaign loan, and all previous loans were well reimbursed. With this new loan, Chitan Traoré intends to buy seedlings and fertiliser, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate two hectares (approx. 5 acres). Her crop is sold after harvesting in Nangola and the adjoining area, and in the town of Dioïla, to both men and women customers. They hope to attain an average profit of 45,000 FCFA per campaign. The women from the Benkadi 2 group put their trust in a successful progress of this winter campaign, with help from Soro Yiriwaso.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seedlings, fertiliser, small farming equipment and labor costs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a persevering businesswoman who sells fresh yams to customers in the central market of Kumasi. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children aged 1 and 5. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and supporting her kids in school. 

She loves selling and enjoys serving customers. Janet believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful yam traders. She plans to invest the loan to purchase more tubers of yam to fill her demand. Janet is optimistic about the future and she hopes to purchase yams directly from farmers and become a yam wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams in bulk

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es:
Lucina M. E. cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea M.”  con una antigüedad de 3 años ofreciendo mejor producto y a un bajo precio. 
Para seguir teniendo su negocio lleno de variedad requiere de un préstamo para comprar más mercancía para seguir teniendo fluidez de clientes que se vayan satisfechos con el producto que compren. Su esposo la apoya ergonómicamente aparte de ser pensionado trabaja como transportista de camiones para trasladar personas a las maquiladoras.
texts.en:
Lucina M. E. has had a grocery store called “Miscelánea M.” for the last three years. She offers the best products at low prices. In order to continue to have her store stocked with a wide variety of goods she needs a loan to buy more merchandise so that customers will continue to patronize her and leave satisfied with their purchases. Her husband helps her out economically. Besides being retired, he also works as an assembly plant employee bus driver.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en:
Vergilio B. is from the town of Pangal Norte, Echague. He is 51 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Vergilio owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Vergilio is just starting this business.

In 2010, Vergilio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergilio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Vergilio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher K. is sixty-two years old, married to a fish monger, and they have eight children aged between thirty-nine and twenty-one. His business is located at Kakamega.

He has been buying cattle and reselling them at a profit to butchers and other middlemen, who resell them for slaughter. He has been in this business for the last twenty-five years and he says his major challenge is financial capital and cattle dying while in transit from the place he buys them. He is using his loan of Kes 70,000 to buy a cow to resell and make a profit. He hopes to grow his business and buy a plot of land from the profits.

He describes himself as honest, hardworking and Christian.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Porfirio; tiene 73 años de edad; el socio es uno de los pintores más antiguos y mas capos en la zona del valle de Urubamba, el socio nació y creció toda su vida en el bello pueblo de Chinchero, el socio realiza bellísimos cuadros paisajísticos y reconocido por su gran y bello trabajo el socio filmo en varios documentales, entre ellos la national geography, el socio tiene el gran sueño de ver a su pueblo salir de la pobreza y que los valores como él, grandes artesanos puedan tener mayor posibilidad de crecer. El socio ahora lleva una vida modesta y sigue trabajando para poder ayudar a su familias e hijos en su educación, el socio invita a todos a que lo visiten en Chincheros y el los guiara por las zonas arqueologías y en todo su bello pueblo, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pinturas y lápices para sus cuadros. 

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Porfirio, 73, is one of the oldest and most prestigious painters in the Urubamba Valley. He was born in and has lived his whole life in the beautiful town of Chinchero. He paints beautiful landscapes. He has been featured in several documentaries, among them National Geographic, because of his great and beautiful work. His dream is to see his town emerge from poverty and that valuable artisans like himself have the opportunity to grow and develop. He lives a modest life and continues to work in order to help his family and support his children’s education. He invites everyone to visit him in Chinchero and he will guide them through the archaeological sites and everywhere else in his beautiful town. He asks for funds to buy paints and pencils for his art work. Porfirio is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA-CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It is 45 minutes from the city. He avails himself of this forum to express his gratitude for the loan as well as to commit to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paints and pencils for his works of art.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 22 years old. She is married and she has two children, ages 2 and 3. Her husband is a student. 

For the last six years, Yvonne has owned a very well-known local bar. With this loan, she will buy more beverages to sell in her bar.  

Going forward, Yvonne hopes to significantly increase the popularity of her bar. She currently sells 20 crates of beer and her goal is to sell 200 crates. With the profit from her business, she hopes to open up a shop.

loans.use: Beverages to sell in the bar

loans.name: María Dirmania

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí encontramos a la señora María, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 15 años, tiene un hijo  de tres años el cual es su tesoro mas preciado ya que no podía tener hijos y fue como una bendición que a los 12años de relación tuvo a su bebe. Su marido trabaja en Guayaquil.

Ella actualmente trabaja en un restaurant en el cual ha aprendido mucho y ya quiere independizarse, por lo cual ha solicitado este crédito para poner su propio comedor, nos cuenta que ya tiene el local y ciertas cosas necesarias, pero que aún le faltan mas. Con este crédito va a comprar tres mesas, doce sillas, cucharas y platos y otras cosas, para así echar en marcha su negocio.

Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son salir adelante en su negocio y así poder tener lo necesario para darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
The “Dios Con Nosotros” (God with Us) communal bank meets every two weeks in the El Florón neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the City of the Valley because it’s surrounded by many hills.

We find María, 37, here.  She has been in a free union for 15 years and has a three year old son who is her most treasured possession because she had not been able to have children and it was like a blessing that after 12 years in a relationship she had her baby.  Her husband works in Guayaquil.

She has been working in a restaurant where she has learned a lot and she wants to take off on her own and become independent.  For this reason she has asked for this loan, to set up her own eatery.  She tells us that she already has the place and some of the necessary things but she still needs others. She will use the loan to buy three tables, twelve chairs, spoons, dishes and other things to launch her business.

This is her 3rd cycle with the communal bank and she’s liked it because of the ease in obtaining the loans.

She dreams with succeeding with her business so that she can have what is necessary to give the best to her young son.

loans.use: To buy three tables, twelve chairs, spoons and dishes.

loans.name: Kafo Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Kafo sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et habitant le quartier Sokalakono de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le grand marché de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des encensoirs, chaussures plastiques, condiments (boites de tomate concentrée, Sounbala, cubes jumbo et gombo frais) et des pagnes wax. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Tata  K. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 150 paires de chaussures en plastiques pour hommes et femmes. Elle se ravitaille en marchandises au grand marché de Bamako en gros et les revend en détail, au comptant, à crédit, à domicile, au grand marché de Ségou et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Tata K. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les frais scolaires des enfants et les petits besoins du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif de devenir grossiste dans la vente des chaussures au grand marché de Ségou.
texts.en:
The Kafo group consists of six married women living in monogamous families. They average 35 years of age and four children each, and live in the Sokalakono neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). 

They became acquainted as neighbors, through kinship and through their business activities in the big market of Ségou. 

The group members’ activities revolve around the purchase and sale of incense burners, plastic shoes, condiments (cans of tomato paste, Sounbala, Jumbo bouillon cubes, and fresh okra), and wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth).

In order to increase their working capital and diversify their merchandise, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are currently on their fourth group loan.

Mrs. Tata K. plans to use her loan to buy 150 pairs of plastic shoes for men and women. She gets her stocks wholesale at the big market of Bamako and resells the merchandise to a mixed clientele at retail, for cash or credit, from her home and at the great market of Ségou, and on the streets, in the various neighborhoods of the city.

With this loan, Mrs. K. hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 30 000FCFA, which she will use to pay for the children’s school fees and for small household expenses.

She hopes to become a wholesale merchant of plastic shoes at the big market of Ségou.

loans.use: To purchase plastic shoes

loans.name: David Wathuko

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 10 years. He is 40 years old and is married to Damaris Wanja. They have five children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings, and to meet labour costs.

In the future, he hopes to use the anticipated profit to save and buy another piece of land to plant more potatoes; the climatic condition of this region is very favourable for potatoes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim N. has been in the  poultry business since 2008 and already has a wide clientele among local people. Kairm is married and has three children and his wife actively helps him take care of the poultry. Karim buys chicks at profitable prices and then raises and sells them in the livestock bazaar once every three months.  This business is the only source of  income for his family and he put all his efforts into improving his business and generating more income. Now Karim has applied for a 900 AZN loan with the purpose of purchasing more chickens.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Bahatbek

texts.en: Bahatbek H. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. All of his four children attend a local school and his wife is currently unemployed and helps him with the business, working as a salesperson when he goes to procure his products. Bahatbek operates a retail clothing business from his own small pavilion at the local market. He began his business in 2003, selling a variety of clothes in the outdoor stall at the local market. After years of successful operation, he was able to build a small pavilion, where he sells his products, in 2008. Over the years, the business profits have enabled him to provide for his entire family. Bahatbek is a very modest gentleman and hopes to increase his working capital and earn a lot of profits. He is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to increase his working capital for his clothing business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and earn a lot of profits

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en: Juan is 53 years old. He lives in the district of Las Lomas in northern Peru. Las Lomas is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. Juan owns his home. He shares it with his wife and their four children. Juan owns 2 hectares of land in the region on which he grows crops. He has a portion planted in rice, another portion with mature mango trees and another in maracuya (a local fruit somewhat similar to the pomegranate that grows on a vine). He harvests the fruits regularly, selling them in local markets, to wholesalers or to local factories. In addition to the farming activities, Juan and his wife raise animals in corrals behind their home. They raise the animals for their meat and sell them in local markets once they reach the appropriate size. The animals' meat serves an important role in the nutrition of the local population and in the cultural traditions of Peru. The loan will be used to purchase additional fertilizer and pesticides for his crops. He expects that the investment will improve the health and production of his fields, thus improving the family’s income. He hopes to be able to continue to make improvements to their home and provide his children with opportunities off the farm.

loans.use: Purchase additional fertilizer and pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Solidario Las Sumpangueras Group

texts.es:
LAS SUMPANGUERAS  
Las integrantes del grupo viven aproximadamente a 32 km de la ciudad la representante de este grupo quien es Narcisa es una señora muy trabajadora ya que ella le ha dado el ejemplo a las  hijas a trabajar arduamente,  todas se dedican a la venta de tamales  los fines de semana, doña Narcisa Cuenta que los sábados preparan aproximadamente 500 tamales que son vendidos en el mercado por doña Maria Tomasa y Lorenza Estela  que también son integrantes del grupo. Las tres han trabajado con   Fape por mucho tiempo y han sido muy cumplidas por lo que ahora solicitan otro crédito mas ya que se aproximan las fiestas navideñas y necesitan comprar ingredientes para elavorar tamales  ya que los pedidos se multiplican para esta temporada, ellas desean sacarle provecho para poder así darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Sumpangueras

The members of the group live approximately 32 kilometers from the city.  Narcisa is the representative of this group.  She is a very hard-working woman, and she has given her daughters the example of working arduously.  All of them sell tamales on the week-end.  

Narcisa says that on Saturdays she prepares approximately 500 tamales.  Maria Tomasa and Loreza Estela, also members of the group, sell the tamales at the market.

The three of them have worked with Fape for a long time, and they are very dependable.  They are now requesting another loan because the Christmas fiestas are approaching.  They need to buy ingredients to make the tamales.  The orders have increased for this season.  They want to take advantage of the demand in order to be able to improve their children’s lives.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo L. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. He is 54 years old. Romeo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Romeo operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. He also offers chainsaw services. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase wood products and as additional working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase wood products and as additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 36 years old and married with three children. She has been running a salon for 13 years and also does livestock farming to boost her income. Catherine has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. This is because she has been saving her money with Faulu Kenya and has previously taken out a loan that she used to boost her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her salon and start to employ people. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy hair oil, hair gel and shampoo.

loans.use: To buy hair oil, hair gel and shampoo

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El Sr. Gregorio C. de 33 años, está en pareja con la Sra. Maria Fernandez de 35 años de edad, ellos aun no tienen la dicha de tener hijos.
Don Gregorio se dedica a este rubro hace más de 2 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.008; para juntar un capital ellos tuvieron que vender una moto, dicho dinero sirvió para comprar equipos y herramientas para  gomería, que en la actualidad ya es bastante conocida en la zona, ya que el en barrio hay muy pocos que se dedican a dicho rubro.
El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (cámaras, cubiertas, rayitos, etc.)
texts.en:
Mr. Gregorio C. is 33 years old, and his partner Mrs. Maria Fernandez is 35.  They have not yet been lucky enough to have children. 

Gregorio has been doing his work for more than two years, since about 2008.  To get enough capital together, they had to sell a motorcycle.  That money helped to buy equipment and tools for the tire repair shop, which currently is well known in the zone, since the neighborhood doesn't have a lot of people who do that kind of work.  

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise (tubes, tires, spokes, etc)

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (tubes, tires, spokes, etc)

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon P., age 55, is a farmer. She and her husband grow rice, vegetables, and fruit on their own farmland. Farming is something with which the couple has had great success. They are able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both the rainy and dry seasons. 

The couple has three children and the family lives in the Dongkor district of the city of Phnom Penh. Two of her children are employed in different jobs to earn an income. To facilitate the increasing living expenses of the family, Nuon P.'s husband also operates a motor-taxi service. 

Nuon P. is looking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle which will be used by her employed children to commute to their workplaces.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle which will be used by her employed children to commute to their workplaces

loans.name: Malaneh Group

texts.en: Kadiatu T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is 48 years of age. Kadiatu is married to a teacher and the couple has 4 children.  She sells palm oil, rice, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. She has been running this business for more than 15 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, beans, peanuts, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
MONSIEUR MAGUETTE EST ENSEIGNANT EN ARABE DE PROFESSION.PARALLÈLEMENT A SON ACTIVITÉ IL FAIT AUSSI DU SERVICE 
(salle de jeu a Pikine dans la région de Dakar).
il sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son matériel d'exploitation et éventuellement sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Mr. MAGUETTE is a teacher of Arabic. He also has a business. He provides a service (a games arcade in Pikine, in the region of Dakar). He is requesting this loan to augment his supplies and equipment and probably his profit margin.

loans.use: to bolster his supplies and equipment for work

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from the village of Corpus Christi Village, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Marilou is separated from her spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing lotto game cards to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to provide her service and to pay for the utilities. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools and to pay for the utilities.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and married. Charlyn owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling fish in the local community. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Charlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Charlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC.  Now she is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise for sale. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 55 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Grace has been raising pigs for thirty years and also earns additional income as a used clothing dealer and vegetable vender.

Grace is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide for a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 69 años D. edad, esta  casada y no tiene hijos.  No cuenta con educación. 
Lleva trabajando  con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. crianza y venta D. animales domésticos.
Con su  nuevo préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra D. alimentos para el respectivo engorD. D. los animales por dos meses y luego venderlos  en la localidad Carumas. Trabaja junto con su esposo.  También nos cuenta que venden la lana D. los animales, con ello tienen una ganancia adicional.
Su sueño es seguir con los ganados y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the community bank Virgen D. Concepción, located in the C.P. Ayrumas Carumas in the Acora district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 69 years old, married, and does not have children.  She has never gone to school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, and she invested the money in her business raising and selling domestic animals.

With a new loan of 500 nuevos soles, she will purchase feed to fatten her animals for two months, and then sell them in Carumas.  She works with her husband.  She also sells wool from the animals to earn extra income.  

Her dream is to continue working with livestock and increase her income. 

The things she likes about the community bank are the meetings and the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro  vive en la zona de chinchaya que esta ubicada a cuarenta minutos del centro de la ciudad. En esta localidad los comunarios se dedican a la crianza de vacas lecheras y al sembradío de verduras en el caso de las mujeres y los hombres al lavado de arena y piedra para construcción que sacan del rio. El Sr. Pedro vive acá toda su vida y antes se dedicaba a lavar arena pero como ya es un poco mayor de edad ahora trababa realizando el mantenimiento en el cementerio de mascotas. Él llegó a nuestra institución gracias a su hijo Eusebio quien lo recomendó para que trabaje con préstamos, el Sr.  pedro es una persona alegre y muy trabajadora y solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas nuevas, ya que su trabajo consiste principalmente en cavar nuevas tumbas para mascotas y hacer que el lugar siempre se vea limpio.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in Chinchaya area which is located forty minutes from the city center.  In this town, the women raise dairy cows and grow vegetables and the men wash building sand and stone which they pull from the river.  

Pedro has lived here his whole life.  He used to wash sand too but, as he is a little older, he now works maintaining a pet cemetery.  He came to our institution thanks to his son Eusebio who recommended him to work with loans.  Pedro is a cheerful and very hard-working person and he is requesting this loan to buy new tools as his work consists mainly of digging new graves for pets and making sure the place always looks clean.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintaining a pet cemetery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 52 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. Letecia has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Letecia has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Letecia hopes to own hectares of coconut land.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is aged 40 years, and has been in mixed farming for five years in her rural home town of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married with one child aged 15 and currently employs one farmhand. Her produce of maize and milk are sold locally.

Anjelina has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her construct a bigger poultry unit for her birds. She says the house will protect her birds and yield better income that will uplift her family. She remains optimistic she will earn enough income and add more cows to her dairy unit.

Anjelina says finding feeds during dry seasons is a challenge.

loans.use: To construct a bigger poultry unit

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 46-year-old married woman with two children aged 15 and 16. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Esther grows rice and corn crops on her land. Esther wants to increase her earnings so she can sustain her family, especially her children's education.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to sustain her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Guillermina Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel nació en la ciudad de Hidroeléctrica – Machupicchu del departamento del Cusco y tiene 33 años de edad, ella es separada y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 12 año que Isabel vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella trabaja como asistente administrativa  en una clínica odontológica donde desempeña su labor de manera excelente, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, lápiz labial y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in the city of Hidroeléctrica-Machupicchu, in Cusco department.  She is 33 years old, separated, and has two children.  Isabel has been living in the city of Cusco for 12 years and this is where she carries out her business activites.  She works as an administrative assistant in a dental clinic and carries out her work in an excellent manner.  In her free time, she sells cosmetics.  On this occasion, Isabel needs a loan to buy more cosmetics such as, for example, perfume, lipsticks and other products.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, expresa su agradecimiento primeramente por el apoyo recibido de Kiva atravez del préstamo ya que con el pudo comprar insumos para su siembra de frijoles, fueron muy buenas ganancias aunque no las esperadas ya que se le presento plagas pero aun así vendió parte de su cosecha. Ahora quiere seguir sembrando para el siguiente ciclo y por eso esta solicitando este segundo préstamo para sembrar y dar mantenimiento a su siembra de frijoles ya que se acerca una época buen para las cosechas de granos básicos y se puede comercializar a precios justos que le permitan obtener ingresos que le permitan seguir sembrando y luchando cada día por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
First of all, Juan wants to express his thanks for the support he got from Kiva through the loan because he was able to buy farming supplies for his bean crops.  Profits were very good although not quite as expected because infestations affected his crops; even so, he was able to sell part of his harvest.  

Now, he’d like to continue planting in the next cycle so is asking for a second loan to plant and care for his bean crop since a good season for basic grains is approaching and they can be sold for fair prices that make it possible to earn income that will allow him to continue to plant and to strive each day for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy supplements and fertilizer to treat 1 1/2 parcels of irrigated beans

loans.name: Abdulia  Karim

texts.en:
Abdulia is 43 years old and married with six children between the age of one and 17. He runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Abdulia has been in this business for 14 years and sells drinks, cigarettes; milk and mosquito spray at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is a problem with thieves.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks, cigarettes, milk and mosquito spray. Abdulai says that the extra income from this loan will help him to render assistance to his family. In the future, he would like to be a supplier to other partners.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, cigarettes, milk and mosquito spray.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina tiene 67 años, su actividad es el servicio de panadería, hace más de 6 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, pues es muy importante mejorar cada día su medio de ingreso. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, leche, entre otros productos necesarios. Ella ha soñado con mejorar cada día los ingresos de su familia y proporcionarle a su hogar lo necesario.
texts.en: Rosa Argentina is 67 years old and has a bakery business.  She has been in this line of work for more than 6 years.  She has a great desire to get ahead in life and it is very important for her to improve her business every day.  Rosa is requesting this loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, milk and other products she needs.  She dreams of improving her family's income and providing her household with what they need.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Montessa

texts.en:
Montessa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a meat-vending business in the Philippines.

Montessa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more meats to sell in her stall. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Montessa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Bibi used the funds from a previous loan to purchase bundles of handbags for sale. Using the previous loan, Bibi was able to expand her assortment of products and increase her profits. Now Bibi desires another loan because she anticipates an increase in prices and has decided to purchase merchandise in advance at lower prices.

Bibi values the loans she has obtained and considers it unacceptable to be late on payments even by one day.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of handbags for sale.

loans.name: Floricelda Lorena

texts.es:
Floricelda Lorena tiene 35 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Floricelda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 10 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del crédito  podrá invertir en la agricultura y tener un beneficio económico.

El sueño es poder tener una casa.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de visita donde los familiares.
texts.en:
Floricelda Lorena is 35 year old and lives in a common law marriage with two children. She lives with her husband and children, who are 15 and 8 years old, in Canton Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province. 

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” [The Palms] community bank, which is located in the Campo Alegre region of Canton Baba. They make a living doing agricultural work. 

Floricelda has worked in agriculture planting corn for ten years. She buys and sells in Ventanas. She is asking for the loan to plant corn and buy agricultural bonds. 

With the help of the loan, she will put money towards agriculture and have an economic benefit. 

Her dream is to be able to have a house.
She has not had any problems. In her free time she likes to go visit her relatives.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy agricultural bonds.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 53-year-old married woman with eight children, ages 13 to 32. 

Juliet has been in the business of raising hogs for five years. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month with her business.

Juliet has requested a loan to buy more piglets to raise. 

Juliet plans to start an additional business, which is selling firewood. Juliet hopes to succeed in her ventures.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Zuana

texts.en: Zuana is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, all in school. She has had a business selling food in Yambio, South Sudan for the past three years. Zuana is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and groundnuts [peanuts]. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Anita provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy the products she needs for her service, such as nail polish.

Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products such as nail polish that she needs for her business.

loans.name: Ana Dina

texts.es:
Ana, de 44 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura. 

Ana, además de realizar los oficios domésticos en su hogar, también realiza ventas de tamales en la comunidad y a través de este pequeño negocio ha logrado darle lo necesario a sus hijos y también se dedica a la agricultura, este oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres, porque ella le ayudaba mucho al trabajo de la milpa y su horario es de 5:00 a 9:00 a.m.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para pagar mozos que le ayuden a extraer la cosecha de maíz.

Los sueños de Ana, son seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: para pagar mozos que le ayuden a extraer la cosecha de maíz.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Mrs. Regina B. is 43 years with two children.  She lives in an urban area of Benin City in Edo State of Nigeria. She trades in yams, and she started her business in 2000. She plans to improve her business with the stated amount above.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Pau

texts.en: Pau is a married mother of five grown children.  While one of her children has found employment, the other four remain unemployed.  Her family largely relied on remittances from relatives in New Zealand and Australia, but a few years ago, Pau was determined to stop relying on remittances.  She became a member of SPBD and used her first loan to start up her business making banana chips.  Having fully repaid her first loan and established her business, she used a second loan to make necessary improvements to her home.  Now with the second loan repaid in full and on time, Pau is seeking a third loan to make an additional investment in her business.  With these funds, she hopes to ensure a more consistent, daily supply of her banana chips to her buyers and thereby increase her sales.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making banana chips

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin R., 24 years old and mother of 2 children who are students, lives with her husband (pictured here because R. was unavailable) in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works at the local garment factory, and typically makes about $3/day in revenue, while her husband works as a carpenter and contributes around $3/day to his household.

Rin R. is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to purchase carpentry tools for her husband to run his business and the rest to repair their house, which usually leaks during a rainy season. In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to run a shop near a market selling a variety of furniture.

loans.use: To purchase carpenter tools for her husband business.

loans.name: Esmilda

texts.es:
Business Description

Esmilda has a business selling articles for the home. She sells these door to door and on credit. She started the business with $250, and the help of her husband, who proposed the idea. Two of her nieces help her with the business.

Use of Loan

She needs the loan because she wants to be able to buy the merchandise at wholesale prices, and then be able to have better prices and products for her clients. In addition, she has set up a place in her house to showcase the products.

Personal Information

Esmilda is 32 years old and has two children who both go to school. The house is constructed of various materials and she has a stable family. Her main aspiration is to be able to grow her business to secure the education of her children, and finish the construction her home.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Esmilda tiene un negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar a que vende de forma ambulante y a crédito. Este negocio lo comenzó con la ayuda de su esposo quien le propuso la idea. Con $250 dólares, le ayuda en el negocio dos sobrinos

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito porque ha pensado en comprar la mercadería a precio de mayorista y así poder tener mejores precios y buenos productos para sus clientes. Además ya ha adecuado un local en su domicilio para también tener en exposición los productos que expende en la calle y una bodega

Información Personal

Ella tiene 32 años y dos hijos de los cuales dos estudian su casa es de construcción mixta y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos y terminar de construir su casa

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To be able to buy her merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is an artisan. She works in the manufacture and embroidering of tablecloths and napkins which she wholesales to people who later resell them in tourist zones. She is 24 years old, single, and with her income helps supplement her parent's living budget. She belongs to the MACOM 4 group along with doña Juana López López (Artisan) and doña Maria López Jiménez (Artisan). They will invest their loan in the purchase of large quantities of fabric for their handiwork as well as embroidery thread so that they can lower their overhead cost and profit a bit more on their later distribution.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA, es artesana se dedica a la confección y bordado de manteles, servilletas y posteriormente los vende con personas mayoristas quienes las revenden en zonas turísticas, ella tiene 24 años es soltera y con sus ingresos ayuda al presupuesto familiar de sus padres, pertenece a l grupo MACOM 4 junto con doña Juana López López (Artesana) y doña Maria López Jiménez (artesana) Ellas invertirán su préstamo en comprar cantidades grandes de telas para sus prendas y además hilos para el bordado y así bajaran un poco el costo de compra al repartirse después lo comprado entre ellas

loans.use: Craftwork

loans.name: Oltinoy

texts.ru:
Oltinoy H. is 49 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 4 children. She sells children’s clothing and shoes. Oltinoy sells her products at two markets in the Yavan regions – “Panchshanbe” and “Shurcha,” where trading happens once a week and residents of the entire Yavan region and nearby regions travel.

Oltinoy plans to use the loan to purchase winter children’s clothing. Because the markets where Oltinoy trades attracts a lot of people and the products there have lower prices then those at the central markets of the regions, Oltinoy will be able to offer childern’s clothing and shoes to shoppers at lower prices. She plans to pay back the loan over a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Халимова Олтиной, возраст – 49 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Занимается торговлей детскими вещами и обувью. Торгует на двух рынках Яванского района – «Панчшанбе» и «Шурча», торговля на которых проводится один раз в неделю, но на них съежаются жители всего Яванского и близлежайщих районов. Торгует два раза в неделю на этих рынках. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести зимний ассортимент детской одежды. Так как в дни торговли на эти рынки съезжается большое количество людей и товар здесь предлагают по ценам ниже, чем на центральных рынках района, Олтиной увеличив свой товар даст возможность всем посетителям рынка, которые приехали за покупкой детских вещей и обуви приобрести ее по более низким ценам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing and shoes

loans.name: Petronila Segunda

texts.es:
Petronila Segunda it’s a member of El Gran Pajaten a local community bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, in the Province Mariscal Caceres, Juanji District. Her business is located en Jr. Bolivar #277 and she owns a convenience store.

Thanks to the support of her husband and children she managed to grow her business. Before she only had a small convenience store, now she has more products than before and also rents videos, she has a solid client base.

With the loan of 1,000 Soles ($350 USD), which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase canned fish, boxes of crackers, dozens of soap boxes, oil and DVD’s, among other products to increment her line of products.

Petronila it’s always dedicate to get better, she is 51 years old but she never gives up, she keeps fighting for a better life

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Petronila Segunda pertenece al banco comunal El Gran Pajaten, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en Jr. Bolívar Nº 277 y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos logró incrementar un negocio. Anteriormente tenía un negocio pequeño y hoy en día cuenta con mayor número de productos, también alquila videos y tiene gran clientela.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará conservas de pescado, galletas en cajas, detergentes en docenas, aceites en litros, y DVD, entre otros para incrementar los productos ya existentes.

La señora Petronila siempre está con ganas de seguir a delante, tiene 51 años y a pesar de la edad que tiene nunca se da por vencida, sigue luchando para que tenga una vejez feliz.

loans.use: Purchase Inventory for Store

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman H. is 51 years old, married and has three children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Suleyman owns a small stand where he sells household products. He started his business two years ago. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $1125, and he would like to increase the size of his stand.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Kyerinda East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Francis Kabangonza. She is currently in the business of running a beauty parlor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics. Francis is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a banker. She has 4 children ranging from age 13 to 25 and only three go to school. Each week, Francis makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business. Francis has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Francis is joined in her small group by Jennifer M., Aisha B., Alice M., and Cathy N.. Jennifer M. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to boost business. Aisha B. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to add more items. Alice M. operates a retail shop business and wants to add more stock. Cathy N. is currently in the business of selling chicken and is requesting a loan to buy more chicken to sell.

loans.use: To expand beauty parlor business

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum Y., age 34, is a mother of two children and lives with her parents and her husband, Mr. Pok Bun luom, who works as a policeman. She is a market vendor selling grocery products and clothes, and making about $4 each day in revenue. One day each week, she has to import clothes from the city to fill her stock.

Mrs. Sum Y. has humbly applied for a loan to purchase more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony B. sells herbal medicine. He is a single parent of 2 children. His income is not enough to meet the financial needs of the family, so he wants to increase production and sale, but he lacks capital.

He is asking for $525 to buy materials for production.

loans.use: To buy materials for production.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Born March 12th, 1973 in Vogan village of VO prefecture, Mrs. Kokoè T. K. is married and the mother of three children. She sells jewelry and fabric in the Agoè neighborhood; she has been doing business since June 2004. She buys jewelry from Cotonou, Benin and fabric from the main market in Lomé. This is the first loan she is seeking, for 500,000 francs CFA and it will allow her to buy 40 pairs of earrings, 20 bracelets, and 40 necklaces. Her goal in borrowing this loan is to expand her display in order to attract more customers. 
Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.
Née le 12 mars 1973 à vogan dans la préfecture de VO, Madame T. K. Kokoè est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de bijoux et de pagnes dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle a démarré ce commerce depuis juin 2004. Elle achète les bijoux de Cotonou au Bénin et les pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter quarante (40)  boucles d’oreilles, vingt (20) gomettes et quarante (40) colliers. Son objectif, en prenant ce crédit est  d’agrandir son étalage afin de pouvoir attirer plus de clients.

loans.use: Jewelry retail

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra is divorced and has three small children. Because of the pension Alejandra receives, her children are able to attend elementary school. But the pension isn’t enough to cover some of the children’s costs, such as food, school fees, sickness, etc. Three years ago Alejandra decided to start a business and began selling lightly used clothing, which she buys in bundles. Her business has been profitable.

Alejandra needs a loan of $600, which she will pay back in 6 months, to remodel her house and convert one of its rooms into a shop. This way she’ll have more space to display the clothes she sells. She also plans to buy shelves to display these clothes. With your support Alejandra can expand her business.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Alejandra es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños que cursan la primaria debido a que la pension que recibe es muy poca y no es suficiente para mantener los gastos de los niños como: de alimentacion, gastos escolares, enfermedades, etc., hace tres años ella decidio emprender un negocio, empezo con la venta de ropa seminueva la cual compra por pacas, y le ha generado buenos ingresos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses ya que desea remodelar su casa y convertir en local una de las recamaras para asi tener mayor esapcio para la exhibion de la ropa, ademas de comprar algunos estantes para lo mismo. Con tu apoyo Alejandra podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel and buy shelves

loans.name: Tainess

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27 year-old Tainess K..  She is married, and has one child, aged one. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2007, Tainess established her timber selling business. Working six days a week, and five to eight hours a day, she earns about US $70 every month from this business. Tainess requires a loan in order to buy additional stocks of timber in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of timber in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice Musisi‘S Group

texts.en:
Beatrice works five days a week and operates a salon. She buys her merchandise from Kampala city centre. She buys all types of goods from both retail and wholesale and uses public transport to transport her merchandise from Kampala to her salon/shop in Bwaise. She makes the trip twice a week. Her customers are women in her community and those on the move.

Her challenges include paying high taxes, high rental charges, and transport costs. Flooding is a problem during the rainy season as the area where she is operating is prone to floods, which destroys her merchandise. It was once a wetland. Another challenge is that of her business being seasonal. During periods when there is low demand for salons, she switches to selling cereals and legumes, mainly dried beans. She has been operating this business for the last 10 years and was inspired by the way women were moving long distances looking for salons. She has been able to improve her standards of living, provide her family with three meals daily. Her main inspiration is owning a permanent home to operate from and also seeing her business progressing.

Beatrice is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 28 years old and married with 2 children. They are 7 and 2 years old. The one aged seven years is in school. She rents a three-room house in which she lives with 5 people. There is no piped water and electricity. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

loans.use: To purchase more beans

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap D., 40, and her husband, Mr. Cheng-ean Hean, 52, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1984 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Two of their children are construction workers, and two other children are silk weavers. Three children study at the local school.

Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver for 25 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows at home.

Sopheap is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her children's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Maria Verónica

texts.es: Esta señora  desde temprana edad se dedica a trabajar en calzado, ella se mantiene al frente del taller y  su esposo se encarga de la comercialización del calzado que oferta en el mercado municipal de Masaya. El taller cuenta con 6 trabajadores a tiempo completo. Tiene dos hijos que asisten a clases, ella a demás de atender el taller atiende los quehaceres de la casa  Ella espera  que adim le pueda otorgar  créditos mayores que le permitan adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima ya que cuenta con mucha clientela. Su mayor sueño es de  mejorar su nivel de vida, remodelar su casa y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
From an early age, this woman worked on shoes. She maintains the front of the workshop, and her husband is in charge of marketing the shoes that are sold in the city market in Masaya. The workshop has 6 full-time workers. She has two children that are studying. In addition to taking care of the workshop, she also takes care of the housework. She hopes that Adim can offer her bigger loans that will allow her to buy more raw materials, since her has many clients. Her biggest dream is to improve her level in life, remodel her house, and give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Mrs. Kit M., 53, and her husband were married in 1979 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home, two others are silk weavers, one works in a garment factory, and one is a student in grade nine. The family lives in a small village near the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kit has been a silk weaver since 1970; she learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband cannot work because he has a serious illness.

Kit is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose Z. sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables. Rose is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a policeman. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na C. was born in 1980 and she now lives in Takol village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 1 hectare plot of land. She is a 28 year old widow with one child who is attends the local school. Although she works hard, she still does not earn sufficient income to support the family. They also live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Na C. decided to request a loan to add to her savings and build a new house for her family. She hopes to provide a better life for her family with this new loan.

loans.use: requests a loan to add to her saving and build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Hasfa Nakku ‘S Group

texts.en:
Hasfa is the leader of a four member group. She is a 35 year old mother of four children who are between the ages for five and eleven. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented two-roomed house in which four people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Hasfa sells sugar cane in Kalerwe market and works seven days a week. She buys the sugar cane from Kawolo, one of the villages where sugar cane is mostly grown. She uses private means to go to and from Kawolo. She sells both on retail and wholesale to an average of 15 customers a day and has been in this business for 10 years. Hasfa is servicing her fourteenth loan, working all along with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to start buying a full lorry of sugar canes.

loans.use: To start buying a full lorry of sugar canes to sell.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
For the past three years, Mwajuma has been running a small store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar where she sells charcoal and firewood. She belongs to Uvivu si kazi loan group (group code 2005).  She currently realizes an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her place of business for 14 hours. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood. She is hoping that this loan will help her increase her profits and expand her business. 

Mwajuma is 26 years old and married. She has four children, ages 12 years, 7years, 6 years, and 1 month.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Felibretina

texts.es:
Felibretina es socia del Bancomunal  Santa Rosa de Villa.
Felibretina es conviviente, tiene 29 años  un hijo de ocho años que va a la escuela estatal.
Empezó a trabajar desde los 10 años en un mercado, de  joven salió embarazada y no pudo estudiar,  nuevamente se dedico a vender en un mercado; hace dos años puso una bodega en su casa.
Necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para agrandar su tienda falta construir un pedazo, y comprar mercadería, arroz leche, aceite.
El sueño de Felibretina es poner un mini marque, y alquilar un local.
texts.en:
Felibretina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Villa Community Bank. Felibretina lives with her partner, is 29 years old, and has an eight year old son who attends the state school. She began working at the age of 10 in a market, became pregnant at a young age, and was not able to study. She recently began working in the market, and two years ago installed a small grocery story in her home. She needs a loan of 1800 soles to enlarge her store, as there is still a portion to build, and to buy merchandise like rice, milk, and oil. Felibretina's dream is to put up a small awning and rent another premises.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1800 soles to enlarge her store and build another part, and to buy merchandise like rice, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou N. est une commerçante veuve qui habite au quartier SOM à Thiès. Depuis 1998 elle vend des schandwich le soir et le matin et des petits déjeuners devant chez elle. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter de la farine, des œufs, de l’huile, du sucre etc., et également d’une machine à coudre pour confectionner des pagnes. Les revenues lui permettent de se nourrir et de payer les depenses de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou N. is a widowed businesswoman who lives in the SOM neighborhood in Thiès. Since 1998, she has been selling sandwiches in the evening and breakfasts in the morning, outside her house. She is requesting this loan to bolster her little business, that is, to buy flour, eggs, oil, sugar, etc., and also to buy a sewing machine to sew "pagnes" (brightly printed African cloth used as sarongs). The income will allow her to feed herself and pay household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flour, eggs, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Inobatchon

texts.ru:
Инобатчон женщина 25 лет, замужем , имеет двоих детей. Она занимается  бизнесом продажи косметики. Товар привозит с Истаравшана, а также её поставляют поставщики. Инобатчон  имеет одну дочь и сына, они учатся в лицее- гимназии города Худжанда.
Её муж работает мастером по ремонту автомобилей. Он хорошо зарабатывал, но сейчас поток клиентов уменьшился, и его доход значительно, недостаточен для проживания семьи. Поэтому, Инобатчон хочет в кредит увеличить свой оборотный капитал, бизнес
texts.en:
Inobatchon is a 25 year old woman, she is married and has two children. She is in the business of selling cosmetic products. She buys the merchandise in Istaravshan and also from her suppliers. Inobatchon has one daughter and one son, they are studying at the lyceum-grammar school in the town of Khudjand. Her husband works as an auto repairman. He was making good money, but at this time he does not have so many customers and his income is noticeably not enough to sustain the family. This is why Inobatchon wants to use the loan to increase her business working capital.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married, and has six children: ages 15, 12, 9, 6, and 2. Jane has been a fish seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for many years. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish for resale in order to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Jane will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Nandiwe. Nandiwe has her own small business selling milk in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Rafonzel

texts.en: Rafonzel D. is a single resident of Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been a member of Paglaum Coop for almost two years and has had four loans. She operates an eatery beside the sea port.  Her last loan was used to purchase more stocks of meat, fish, spices and other ingredients for her business, hoping to alleviate her life of hard work.

loans.use: Purchase meat, fish and spices for eatery

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio G. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Juan tiene 65 años de edad vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Juan se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropa, su mecánica de trabajo es de manera ambulante  el visita todos los pueblos de sus alrededores en su carro, donde lleva toda la mercadería, Juan obtiene ganancias de 50% en la mercadería que el vende. Ademas de tener este negocio, por ser persona muy trabajadora, también tiene una tienda, muy surtida de artículos de primera necesidad.

Juan solicita este crédito para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio G. lives in the Ahuachapan department. Juan is 65 years old and lives with his spouse and three children. Juan makes a living primarily from selling clothing as a street vendor. He visits the surrounding towns in his car, where he has all his merchandise. Juan makes a 50% profit on all his sales. In addition to this business, since he is a very hard working person, he also has a store, which is well stocked with basic goods. Juan is requesting this loan to be able to purchase more merchandise for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney B. owns and operates a motorcycle transport business providing service to local community members. He is 25 years old and married. He is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rodney has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.
