texts.en:
Joana is 57 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom attend primary and secondary school. She's a farmer and an unofficial trader of farm supplies. She currently works on a farm alongside her husband and owns cabbage and tomato crops located close to irrigated areas in Boane.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets and beams) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets and beams) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Jeluwaida

texts.en: Jeluwaida is a 25-year-old teacher in a primary school in Tanzania. She is an open-minded person with an entrepreneurial spirit. Jeluwaida wants to start a business in agriculture and wants her students to also develop interest in entrepreneurship. As first step, she decided to invest in a solar home system because her small house was not connected to the public power grid. Therefore, Jeluwaida had to prepare her classes before it got dark which didn't leave her time for getting enrolled in her agricultural business. With a solar system in her house she is now more flexible in her time schedule and has improved her daily living situation. Furthermore, she can start with her business in agriculture which gives her a second income that she can use to pay her sister's college fee.

loans.use: to get energy supply via solar system

loans.name: Ogbonmwan

texts.en:
Mrs. I. Ogbonmwan says that life has become sweet and enjoyable since she became a LAPO member 8 years ago. She hopes to improve her business with the loan that she has requested.

38 year old Mrs. Ogbonmwan and her 5 children live in Benin City, located in the Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more hair dressing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two cows and inputs for his farming business

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
M. Mavluda is married and has 2 children. She has been in business for 6 years. She began her business by borrowing small amounts of money from her acquaintances to buy material. From this material she sewed different types of dresses and sold them at the market. Mavluda has been a member of MLF “Microinvest” for 4 years. During these years her business has been successful because she not only sews dresses but also sells different kinds of material. M. Mavluda is asking for $875 to purchase new materials.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Мусабаева Мавлюда замужем, имеет 2 детей. В бизнесе она 6 лет. Начинала свой бизнес с того, что брала у знакомых незначительную сумму в кредит, для покупки материалов. Из этих материалов шила несколько видов платьев и продавала их на рынке. В МЗФ «Микроинвесте» она 4 года. За эти годы она преуспела в своем бизнесе, т. е. кроме шитья и продажи платьев, она также продает несколько видов тканей. Мусабаева Мавлюда запрашивает 867$ для закупки новых тканей.

loans.use:
To expand the business and gain maximum profit

расширения бизнеса и получения максимальной прибыли.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en: S. Sanoat is an active client of Microinvest. She is the mother of three children. She has been trading in the market during the past four years. Her business is to sel men’s clothes and business is located in Panjshanbe market, in Khudjand. She has rented a small area for sale outside of a larger shop. She brings her goods from Istaravshan every week. Today she has many constant clients and she always tries to meet their needs. In September, she would like to be able to purchase warm men’s clothes. In order to accomplish this, S. would like a loan of $400.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Pereta

texts.en: P. comes from a poor family of 12 people. They were poor enough so that sometimes their mother could not afford to send them to school. She is now 32 years old, married, and has five children of her own. She has experienced the difficulties of family life, as she does not have a job to support the family. Her husband is a hard working man and they have put all their effort and time into their plantation. Through days of working in the sun and sometimes in the rain, P. and her husband renovated their home. Through her previous loan she has installed a water supply. This is P.'s second loan, and she is planning to buy a water tank because the water supply in her area is very poor. Sometimes they hardly get water, so most of the time they rely on the rain water.

loans.use: To buy gromoxone chemicals (weed killer), a back sprayer, fertilizers, and a wheelbarrow for her plantation as well as a water tank.

loans.name: Mahmadsoleh

texts.ru:
Mahmadsoleh I., 45, is married and has 4 children. Mahmadsoleh has been in business for 13 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase additional inventory. Mahmadsoleh has a sales location at the central market of Khuroson, about 60 km from Dushanbe. Mahmadsoleh I. plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Искандаров Махмадсолех, возраст – 45 лет, образование высшее, женат, имеет 4 детей. Махмадсолех занимается этим бизнесом в течение 13 лет. На полученный кредит Махмадсолех планирует закупить дополнительно новый товар. Данный район находится в 60 км от города Душанбе, куда в основном ездиют жители района за покупками. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке Хуроссонского района. Закупив большее количество продаваемого ассортимента продуктов питания жители данного получат возможность приобретать необходимые им продукты питания на местном рынке по умеренным ценам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Kolopa

texts.en: Kolopa is a 20 year old married mother from Malie J3 centre. She is one of a newest members applying for a loan.  She sells ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) from her own house.  She sells 100-150 ice cakes a day, which cost 50 sene (20 cents) each and she earns about $100-150 WST ($40-60 USD) a day. Her husband has a taro plantation but that does not stop her from trying to look for another business to support her new family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara S. is a single mother who cares for her three-year-old daughter in a rented house.  She provides for herself and her daughter by running a small grocery store near the house.  She began this business with the help of funds given to her by her ex-boyfriend.

With the profits she has made along and with some savings she had, Genara now owns the store as an independent business woman. Genara is an entrepreneur with the future of her daughter in mind.  In order to make her store more successful she needs to purchase a refrigerator to keep her goods, especially the meat products like sausage, in good condition.  Without refrigeration the meat risks going bad in the extreme heat of Paraguay.

With the improvements to her business, she hopes it will one day lead to owning her own house and having the ability to send her daughter to school.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and freezer

loans.name: Kyerinda East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Florence is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist for work. She has 4 children all of whom go to school. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand business Florence has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Florence is joined in her small group by Cathy N., Mariam M., Christine M., and Jennifer T.. Cathy N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to boost business. Mariam M. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to add capital. Christine M. operates a grocery shop business and wants to purchase more groceries. Jennifer T. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop

loans.name: Abeli's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Abeli, age 28, is married with 3 children (ages 5, 4, and 1). He is a very busy man running 3 businesses. He works daily from 10am to 11pm and sells chips, does masonry work, and also runs a pool table business. He started these businesses 2 years ago and makes a total monthly profit of about $170 from his work.

In the past, Abeli took 2 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to purchase stock for his businesses. He also used the loans to support his wife's business. He now hopes for a new loan to buy another pool table and to also buy more chips. He will share this loan with his subgroup whose members own small general stores.

In the picture, Abeli is second from the left.

loans.use: To buy another pool table and chips

loans.name: Fatuma'ushindi B Group

texts.en:
Fatuma Said, age 32, is married with 2 children, ages 11 and 4. She has a business selling clothes from door to door and a vegetable business. She works from 10am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly income of approximately $85.

Fatuma has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. to improve her business. She hopes for a new loan to open a retail shop. Fatuma will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell clothes, food, plastics and fish.

In the picture, Fatuma is the first person on the left..

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aku A. was born on 3 August 1968 in Aholukopé in the Prefecture of Zio. She is married to Mr. Etsè DOSSOU, who is a taxi driver. Mrs. Aku A. helps her husband a lot in meeting the family expenses. She is a retailer of palm oil in the Adidoadin area of Lomé. She makes her purchases in the areas of Notsè and Tsévié. In this time of surplus, she is asking for a loan of 200,000FCFA to buy 10 cans and 25 litres of red palm oil.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Aku est née le 03 août 1968 à Aholukopé dans la préfecture de Zio. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur DOSSOU Etsè qui est un chauffeur de taxi. Madame A. Aku aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Elle est revendeuse de l’huile de palme dans le quartier adidoadin à Lomé. Elle fait ses achats dans les localités de Notsè et de Tsévié. En ce temps d’abondance, elle sollicite un crédit de 200.000FCFA pour l’achat de 10 bidons de 25 litres d’huile rouge.

loans.use: To buy red palm oil, a very popular cooking oil used to make many delicious dishes in West Africa

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
Sonia started her business on the advice of her mother, who had sold footwear and cosmetics for a long time. Her mom showed her how to sell products by catalogue, and Sonia enjoyed the activity. Sonia was in very bad economic trouble because her husband did not have steady employment, so they were in need of good income. She started about two years ago helping her mother with her sales until she went out on her own with her own clients. Unlike her mother, she's solely dedicated to shoe sales.

Now Sonia is requesting a loan of $250, which she plans to repay in three months, to purchase supplies and have a better product stock so she better serve her customers. With your help, Sonia can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Sonia inició el negocio por consejo de su mama ya que la señora siempre ha sido vendedora de calzado y cosmeticos , animo a su hija a que vendiera por catalogo y a ella tambien le gusto la actividad. Ella tenia problemas economicos muy fuertes ya que su esposo no tenia trabajo fijo, por lo que necesitaba de ingresos fuertes. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 2 años ayudandole a su mama con las ventas hasta que se independizo creando sus propios clientes, ella solo se dedica a la venta de zapatos.

Ahora ella necsita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y tener un mayor surtido de productos y asi darle mejor atencion a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Sonia hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies / Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Eness Y

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Enesy H., 35 is married, and has five children aged between 5 and 20. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. Enesy owns a small shop business. Working six days a week, and sixteen to twenty four hours a day, she earns about US $650 every month from this business. Enesy requires a loan in order to buy more general household goods for sale. She thanks you for your support. 
 
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed uncreditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more home needs items.

loans.name: Ndetomariswa

texts.en:
Ndetomariswa is 49 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 18 and 14 years old. She is a milk and banana seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $135 from her sales.

Ndetomariswa now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more milk and bananas for her business

loans.name: Ghanima's Ibadu Llahi Group

texts.en:
Ghanima is 47 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 28 and 15 years old. She has been a clothes and perfume seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 10:30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Ghanima is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and perfumes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Hamida.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Wema Hauozi Group

texts.en:
Rehema has owned a shop in Zanzibar for three years. She is 30 years old, divorced, and has two children. Her children are 14 and 7 years old. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $130 each month. She is hoping that this loan will help her to increase her profit so that she is better able to support her family.

Rehema has four sub-group members with whom she will be sharing the loan. They also own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El  señor Richard vive en casa de sus suegra con su esposa y su hija  en la calle Eduardo Avaroa de la zona de tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como policía y la esposa se dedica a la elaboración de papas fritas las cuales vende ambulando en la calle.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una computadora y seguir estudiando de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar un nivel de vida adecuado a su familia

Esta será la primera vez que IMPRO aprueba un crédito para Richard, pues su interés por continuar sus estudios lo hacen merecedor de esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Mr Richard lives with his wife and daughter in his mother-in-law house located in Eduardo Avaroa street of the Tacagua area of the City of La Paz. He works as police officer and his wife makes French fries which she sells on the street. The requested loan will be used to buy a computer and to keep on studying. He wants this way to improve his income and be able to give a better standard of living to his family. This is the first time that IMPRO has approved a loan for Richard. Since he is interested in continuing his studies, this has made him deserving of this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer to continue his studies.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en: Khurshed H. is 33 years old.  He is married and has four children.  Khurshed has been working in agriculture for 12 years, since he was a young.  Khurshed works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables.  He works from early morning till late night hoping to have a rich harvest.  Khurshed sells his vegetables in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children.  His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and to grow his business.  For this reason, he has applied to IMON for a loan that will allow him to purchase greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer for sowing more vegetables. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Carlos Ramírez, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, su conyugue se llama Zaida Verón, tienen dos hijos menores, un varón y una nena ambos menores de edad, vive en la ciudad de Mayor Martinez, vive en casa propia, en el centro mismo de esta ciudad, en dicha residencia particular cuenta con las comodidades para el hogar, en el mismo domicilio posee un local comercial denominado Comercial San Carlos , donde se comercializa todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, tienda, ferretería, carnicería, etc.
Es dueño también de dos líneas de trasporte de pasajeros que realiza viajes desde esta ciudad hasta la Ciudad de Pilar.
Es comerciante, esta en esta actividad más de 10 años, posee buena cantidad de mercaderías. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales para faenar.
texts.en:
Carlos Ramírez, 46 years old, is married. His wife is Zaida Verón; they have two young children: a son and a daughter, both minors. He lives in the town of Mayor Martinez, in his own home in the centre of the town. He has all the necessities of home, and runs a business called Comercial San Carlos out of his house, where he sells all sorts of basic goods for stores, hardware stores, butcher shops, etc. He also owns two passenger transports which travel between his town and the town of Pilar. He has been in this business for more than 10 years and has a good stock of merchandise. He is requesting the loan to buy work animals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is 53 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband. Dalal has been selling beauty products from her house since 2004. She sells makeup, cosmetics, perfumes, creams and accessories. Dalal requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is her third loan, and she has always paid on time.

Thanks to her previous loans, Dalal was able to improve her business and purchase more merchandise to satisfy the needs of her clients. Dalal is special in her work because she sells nice products and she knows how to please her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Dalal decided to open her business because she wanted to help her husband by supplementing the family's income. In the future, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Angela has made a living selling food in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for the last year. She earns an average monthly profit of $185, and works for 14 hours a day.  She is seeking her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to sell to her customers. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.       

Angela is 32 years old, divorced and has a ten-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with the other member of her lending group, Faldia D., who also runs a business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To bu more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nelson Ulises

texts.es:
El caballero Nelson C. es una persona muy dedicada al trabajo teniendo su pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es de importancia destacar que el señor Nelson ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel y hoy en día una vez más espera ser beneficiado con un nuevo crédito para la compra de los calzados ya que necesita invertir en su negocio para generar mayores utilidades y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson C. is a person who is very dedicated to working in his small shoe store in the central market of the city of Chinandega. It is important to point out that Mr. Nelson has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel. Today he hopes to get the benefit of a new loan for the purchase of shoes since he needs to invest in his business to generate more profits and this way improve the quality of life of him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline A. is in the business of selling bananas and guava and is requesting a loan to buy more fruit to sell.  She is thirty years old and a widow. She has four children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Mrs. Rebecca P. is an active member of Paglaum MPC. She is married and blessed with eight children.  Four of them are still studying.  Her major activity is backyard gardening together with her husband, and she also engages in selling snacks. Now she asks for her seventh loan intended for cultivating her garden, purchasing of seedlings and fertilizer to support the education of her children and to feed her family.

loans.use: Labor for cultivation, fertilizers, and seedlings

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman who has been an animal feed seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for many years. She belongs to the Nzovwe '1' group loan and currently earns very little monthly profit. She sells animal feed to her customers 12 hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed to add to her current stock, hoping that this will allow her to improve her business. She hopes that she will be able to increase her profits and expand her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha has been an animal keeper and owned of a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to the Fadhlat group (Code 2104). She earns an average monthly profit of approximately $40. Every day she works for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more cosmetics and salon items to add her current stock, to improve her business. She is hoping that her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Aisha is 30 years old, married, and has six children: ages 14, 13, 10, 7 and one year old twins. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and salon items to sell to improve her business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a vendor of vegetables and different snacks in her village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to use as additional working capital for her business. According to her, she needs to do her best in performing her task so that she may provide a good life to the children she will have someday.

She recently married Nixon M. and they are living in the simple village of Barangay Buliwao in Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband works as a bus driver. The couple is saving some of their daily income to establish her planned village store in the days to come.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Nyakatonzi Namaganda Rose Group

texts.en: N. Rose, 50, is a business woman and married with four children.  She has operated a restaurant business since 2000.  She will use her loan to purchase food (bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava, flour, cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, charcoal, etc).  Being a hardworking woman, N. wants to improve her menu to attract more customers and to satisfy them.  She hopes to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: Purchase food for restaurant.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline J., from the village of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis, Occidental, is a 48-year-old married mother of five school-aged children. To earn a living, Evangeline makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 12 years, she earns approximately 2,400.00 PHP a month.

In June 2009, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for making food products. This loan will be Evangeline’s first from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for food products.

loans.name: Damarys Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Villa Adela esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Damarys”, con la ayuda de su asistente de créditos trabajan de forma responsable y puntual.
El grupo esta formado por doce integrantes y trabajan junto a la familia de Pro Mujer hace tres años.
Diversos son los negocios que tienen este grupo, por lo general comercializan productos varios  de acuerdo a la temporada, ahora por ejemplo  venden ropa de invierno y también artículos tradicionales por las fiestas patrias. Ahora desean comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, tienen la seguridad de obtener mejores ganancias y por lo tanto mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Damarys" Association belongs to The Villa Adela Center, which is located in the city of El Alto. Damarys collaborates in a responsible and punctual fashion with the loan assistant of the latter organization. The association is made up of a dozen members who have worked together in Pro Mujer for 3 years. This group has a variety of businesses, but in general they make a variety of products in accordance with the season. Now, for example, they sell winter clothing as well as traditional items for the national holidays. They would like to buy a larger quantity of merchandise that they will use to increase profits, and therefore income, to provide for the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Diana Aimee

texts.es: Diana Aimee R. E. reside en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador. Diana tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su madre, padrastro e hijo de 4 años de edad estudiante de kínder. Diana se ha visto en la necesidad de dejar a un lado sus estudios y planes como profesional ya que por ser madre soltera no cuenta con respaldo económico, es por eso que Diana creó su propio negocio donde vende variedad de artesanía salvadoreñas, sus productos son demandados por los salvadoreños y extranjeros que quieren llevarse un recuerdo de nuestra tierra. Ahora Diana solita un crédito para comprar mas variedad de artesanías para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Diana Aimee R. E. live in the Soyapango municipality in the San Salvador department. Diana is 29. She lives with her mother, stepfather, and her four year old son. He is kindergarten age. Diana saw the need to leave her studies and plans to become a professional because being a single mother, she does not have economic support. That is why Diana created her own business. She sells a variety of Salvadoran handicrafts. Her products are in demand by Salvadorians as well as foreigners who want to have a souvenir of her country. Diana is now asking for a loan to buy a greater variety of handicrafts to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Mrs. Marissa E. is a 45-year-old married woman who is blessed with four children. She has made her living by growing rice for almost 3 decades. As a tenant farmer of a 2-hectare (~5-acre) rice field, she has to work hard to produce a rich harvest and earn a good income. 

Marissa is a member of CEV and is now on her 4th loan cycle. She especially likes the monthly amortization for agriculture and the biblical reflections during meetings. 

Marissa is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase farm supplies. This loan will surely help Marissa to improve the farm that she tends.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Nantume Jane ‘S Group

texts.en: Jane is a 60 year single mother of seven children aged between 30 and 42 years. None of her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Jane resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Jane sells charcoal on Lubaga road one of roads samosas and chapattis in Kawempe and doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Jane has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for also six years, servicing her fifteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of wheat flour and jerrycans of cooking oil. Jane is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting a full bakery.

loans.use: to buy packets and sacks of wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiku

texts.en:
Hannah is married to Paul and they have four children; Charles, Michael, Lydia and Naomi.

Hannah was introduced to KADET by existing clients and she has no previous credit history. She has been in the retail sales business as well as the rental homes business for seven years. In her retail shop, she sells mostly cereals (maize). With her loan, Hannah will purchase more stock to sell from her retail shop.

The clients' area of business is in a slum and her customers are the residents of the slum. With the extra profits Hannah hopes to earn as a result of this loan, she will put up more rental houses. Hannah believes she is hardworking and hopes to educate her children.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals and other items to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria B. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Candelaria owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Candelaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She is married with 3 children, and she is 40 years old. She sells drinks in front of her house in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000. She will use this loan to invest in a business selling drinks which she will buy in bulk to get a better price. She hopes to expand and gives her children a better education. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Vision Plus Group

texts.en:
Brigitte K. is the leader of a community bank named “Vision Plus,” which is composed of 32 entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Brigitte is 42 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Brigitte currently sells spices. She has been in business since 1999, when she started out selling doughnuts. After learning through her friend about IMF HOPE RDC’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups in July of 2008. Brigitte has already received four loans from IMF HOPE RDC that she repaid in full. Currently, her business brings in a profit of $20 per week. With her next loan she is planning to purchase more spices to increase the inventory of her business. Brigitte’s dream is to be a provider of spices in her area. Her spice business is located in northern Kinshasa, which is the most the most densely populated region of the city.

loans.use: To increase inventory in order to reinforce her working capital

loans.name: Nelson Patricio

texts.es: El Señor Nelson  es un cliente nuevo que tiene su casa propia en Chasquipampa, el señor cuenta con dos movilildades una esta a su nombre y la otra a nombre de su esposa, doña Rosmery, las dos movilidades trabajan para la empresa de radio taxis. La pareja recibe ingresos por estas dos movilidades ademas de un pequeño ingreso por venta de comida que realiza la señora. La pareja trabajo muy duro para comprar su casa, tambien mantienen con esos negocios a sus cico hijos. El credito que solicita el nuevo cliente esta destinado a la compra de llantas y baterias para los dos automoviles, tambien realizara la compra de una radio de comunicacion ya que la que tiene no sirve
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson is a new client who owns his own house in Chasquipampa. He can count on two radio taxis, one is in his name and the other in the name of his wife, Mrs. Rosmery. The two taxis work for the same radio taxi enterprise. The pair receive income from these two taxis as well as a small income from food sales by Rosmery.

The pair work very hard to pay for their house and maintain their 5 children by means of these businesses. The loan this new client solicits is for buying tires and batteries for the two cars, and a communication radio, since the one they have no longer works.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR MAINTAINING TWO RADIO TAXIS

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina G. is from the village of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marina has recently opened a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and other products in the local community. 

Last year, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon F. is from the village of Casili, Mallig, Isabela. She is 28 years old. Sharon is married and has 2 school-aged children.  Sharon owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sharon has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $172 US) for these activities.

In 2006, Sharon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sharon from ASKI.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sharon is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product line.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Simone Mbasse

texts.fr: Simone Mbasse T. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Depuis 8 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO et a 17 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va développer un petit commerce de produits divers tels que des effets vestimentaires et de toilette. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et d'assurer en partie la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Simone Mbasse T. is a 52-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children.  For 8½ years, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBORO and has benefited from seventeen consecutive loans.  With her new loan, she is going to develop a small business involving a variety of goods, such as toiletries and clothing-related accessories.  Her goal is to take part in providing for the family and making sure her children have schooling. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her commercial work

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A., 45 years old, is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. She has four children. The eldest is 22 years old and is helping her in manning the store. The income which she gained from selling various goods is very important because it is where they get enough money to buy the daily needs for their home. 

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: For additional merchandise for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina D. is married and living with her three children. She has received senior high education. Her husband is a trader.

Christina sells varieties of body lotions and hair creams at Elmina and has been doing this for some time now. She uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the children and any other expenditures that may come her way.

Christina will add the loan acquired to her initial capital to buy more body lotion, hair creams and other cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more body lotion, hair creams and other cosmetics

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is 38 years old and married with four children who attend school which gives her joy as a mother. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also works to support their home. Omolara sells sarongs and loves the business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger and is requesting a loan of N40,000 to buy more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana F. bakes sweet rock cakes to sell at Akotokyire.  Joana has not received any form of education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake the items she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake

loans.name: God In Woke Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of “God In Woke” group from the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to expand their businesses. In this way, they can make more sales, better profits and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata K. who is pictured on the left. Born in Makeni, the forty-eight-year-old is married and has six children. Fatmata sells locally-dyed cloth (gara lappers) and has been in this business for many years now. With this loan, Fatmata will expand her business: she will buy working materials like cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder, rubber bowls, gloves, etc.

loans.use: To buy working materials like cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder, rubber bowls, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 25 años, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia.Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas de campo pues sus padres le enseñaron todas las técnicas agrícolas necesarias. En la actualidad se dedica al cultivo de maca (raíz con propiedades curativas) que  produce  en abundancia, también cría ovejas que tiene en su establo. Cuando llega el tiempo de la cosecha puede ver con mucha satisfacción la recompensa a su sacrificado trabajo, con su buena producción. Tiene todos los ánimos de continuar adelante y se proyecta a seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, además desea  adquirir sus propias maquinarias (como un tractor) y también  quiere instalar un establo grande.Es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será  muy responsable con sus pagos, también agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Sonia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de alimento para sus animales y además en los gastos de transporte de su cosecha.
texts.en:
Sonia is 25 years old and lives with her husband in a house they own. From childhood she has worked in the field, and her parents taught her all of the agricultural techniques necessary. Currently, she works cultivating maca (a root with healing properties), which she produces in abundance. She also raises sheep in her stable. When harvest time arrives, it is satisfying to see the rewards of her sacrifice and hardwork in her good harvest. Sonia intends to continue moving forward, and she plans to continue working in agriculture. She would like to buy her own machines (like a tractor) and also install a large stable. This is her second opportunity for a loan with MFP, and she promises she will be very responsible with her payments. She would also like to thank all of the people who will make the loan possible, because it will be very useful for the progress of her business. Sonia plans to invest her loan in the purchase of feed for her animals and also in the costs of transporting her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animal feed and payment for transporting crops

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 7, Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and swine raising. Her husband, Charlie V., who is 56 years old, works as a hog raiser to earn his living. They have two children who are 26 and 27 years old. 

Erna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for their future and to improve their living conditions. Erna V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida A. lives in a city called Riawind in Pakistan, which is about 30 km away from Lahore. Her husband runs a shop in a nearby market where he sells betel nuts and cigarettes. He has been doing this business for the last 20 years and it proves to be profitable for him.  Abida has three children, two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is getting her education and is in fifth standard while her sons left their education after completing eighth standard. Both now do jobs to support the family financially. Abida is also a working woman. She does sewing work by taking orders from her neighborhood to supplement her income. She is also a very good mother who takes care of her children very well and gives them proper time. 
She is a regular client of Asasah and her repayment record is very good. Now she is applying for a loan for the fifth time from Asasah. She will invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. He will buy betel leaves and different brands of cigarettes to sell at his shop.  Abida hopes that her experience with her Asasah loan will be as great this time as the previous times.

Note: "She has her sister''s kid in this photo".

loans.use: To purchase cigarettes & betel nuts and leaves

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar de 54 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, alrededor del rió Guayas, y como una ecología en disolución), el tiene un taller de cerrajería para mantener a su esposa y cuatro hijos. 

Desde pequeño Cesar aprendió cerrajería gracias a su papa que le enseño, cuando fue creciendo y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que hacer lo que desde pequeño había aprendido, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener sus propias herramientas suficientes. Pero como el taller lo tiene en la casa el quiere readecuar su casa y construir con el préstamo comprar cemento, bloques, arena. 

En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio para tener mas clientela y asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 54 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area situated near the Guayas River that has a deteriorating ecosystem. He operates a locksmith shop in order to support his wife and four children.

From a young age, Cesar learned about the locksmith business from his father. Growing up he had few opportunities, so he ended up doing what his father had taught him. Over time and with effort, Cesar was able to acquire his own tools that were sufficient for the job. In order to install a workshop in his house, he needs to do some remodeling work and will use this loan to buy cement, blocks, and sand.

In the future, he wants to expand his business and have more customers so that he can secure his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that he can build a space in his house for his locksmith shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fabric for quilts

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona T. is from the village of San Jose, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Jona is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jona owns & operates a specialized retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Jona has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jona is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Seiil's Group

texts.en:
Seiil I. is leader of the group. She is 37 and divorced. Her son is 3 years old and he lives with her relatives. She cannot give her son as much attention as he deserves because she needs to work. Seiil lives with her father, who does cattle breeding. With the help of her father, Seiil increased number of livestock to 150. Seiil, in turn, is a pear sorter. She is planning to move to Karakol and start collecting potatoes. In order to perform field work collecting potatoes, she needs help. Still, she doesn’t have an opportunity to obtain technical provision due to absence of finance. Therefore, she applied for a loan that would assist her performing field work and get higher profits. Higher profits will provide for her son and herself.  

Group members:

Sharymkul Z. is treasurer of the group. She is 61 and married. She has a son. Her son is 17 and he goes to school. Her husband is a pensioner (retiree). Together with her husband, Sharymkul breeds cattle. Sharymkul and her husband started breeding cattle when they were children because their parents also bred cattle. After their marriage, she continued breeding cattle together with her husband. For now, they could increase the livestock number to five, the cattle number to two, and one horse. In line with cattle breeding, they decided to start agriculture. Still, for field work they need help. They are applying for a loan to buy necessary provisions. During autumn, Sharymkul with her husband are planning on doing crop gathering. With the profits, they are planning to give their son a higher education.

Gulkaiyr Z. is 30 and married. She has six children: her daughters are 13, 12, 11 9 and 7 years old, andher son is 5 years old. Her husband earns money fishing. He also breeds cattle. Gulkair, in turn, assists her husband in cattle breeding and in taking care of their house. Her husband started cattle breeding when he was a child. After his marriage, his parents gave him a significant number of livestock. Thus, he decided to continue. For now, they have 5 cattle and 2 horses. The academic year is starting soon, therefore she needs to buy her children school supplies and clothes.

Zharkynai K. is 33 and married. She has four children: her daughters are 13, 11, and 3 years old, and her son is 5 years old. Two elder daughters go to school and the younger daughter and son are at home. Her husband is a worker in the village. Zharkynai is pear sorter, and she is planning to start farming. They started cattle breeding together after their marriage with the cattle that her husband had before their marriage. Now, they have two cows. She needs to prepare her two elder children for the academic year. Therefore, she is applying for a loan in order to buy school supplies. They wish to give the best education to their children so that they could become specialists in their chosen fields and get out of poverty.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=13.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To hire help for collecting potatoes

loans.name: Marta Magdalena

texts.es: Marta Magdalena T. D. S. es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable la cual tiene 59 años D. edad, vive con su esposo, hijo y sobrino; el negocio es una pequeña tienda llamada “tienda Magdalena” que se ubica en su vivienda en el municipio D. Soyapango. Marta, es una persona muy emprendedora y decidida a ayudar a su familia, poniendo su pequeño negocio el cual es D. gran ayuda para poder cubrir algunas D. sus necesidades. El préstamo ha sido solicitado para cancelar pedidos pasados, además D. invertir muchos más en nuevos y variados productos que se necesitan en la tienda y sus clientes piden, Marta es una persona humilD. pero D. gran corazón, emprendedora y trabajadora, que vela por el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Marta Magdalena T. D. Solorzano is a very hard working and responsible woman. She is 59 years old and she lives together with her husband, their son and her nephew. She owns a small store named "Magdalena's Store". It is located in a section of her house in the municipality of Soyapango. Marta is an entrepreneurial woman, focused on helping her family. Having her little store has been a great help in meeting some of their needs. The loan requested will be used to fill orders and to invest in new products for her store, as requested by her clients. Marta is a humble person but she has a big heart, entrepreneurial, hard working and always in search for the best for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 47 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Hace más de 8 años Lucia se dedica en la venta de productos comestible de primera necesidad e incluso chocolates y bebidas en general. Su negocio esta situado en el primer ambiente de su casa, en donde atiende con mucha amabilidad a sus clientes, es así que su día laboral empieza desde muy temprano por la mañana, ya que en esa hora es cuando más gente acude a su establecimiento. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es la sección de verduras y frutas; por lo que le deja mayor utilidad que otros productos, por ello procura siempre de abastecerse de estos productos alimenticios. Para el futuro desea ampliar su negocio y proveerse de diversos productos. Es su dieciochoavo crédito con MFP y se comprometen pagar todas sus cuotas como hasta ahora, ya que esta ayuda le es de mucha utilidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, azúcar y productos lácteos, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Lucia, 47 years old, is a hard-working mother.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children, the reason for all her efforts.  More than 8 years ago, Lucia began selling basic food products, including chocolate and refreshments, in general.  Her business is located at the front of her house, where she attends to her customers with great care and attention.  She starts her day very early in the morning, since this is when the most people frequent her establishment.  What she likes most about her business are the sections of fruits and vegetables, which gets more turn-over than any other items in her store.  As such, she is always re-stocking this section.  For the future, she hopes to expand her business and provide a more diverse range of products.  This is her eighteenth credit with MFP.  She promises to make all of the payments, like she is currently doing, and recognizes the helpfulness of this financial assistance.  With the credit that she is seeking, she will purchase rice, sugar, and dairy products to stock her business.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and dairy products.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is married and lives in Prk. Isdang Bato, Palawan. She and her husband make a living by buying and selling dry goods. They have three children who range in age from 13 to 18. Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With lots of hard work and 23 loans from our organization, she has slowly lifted her family out of poverty. She is applying for a new loan, her 24th, to expand her business by buying additional dry goods to sell. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is allowing these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their wildest dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand a small dry goods business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años vende  ropa y bisutería, productos que ofrece a su compañeros de trabajo, ya que es enfermera de profesión y trabaja en un hospital de su ciudad. De esta manera vende sus productos a crédito, además conoce la calidad de clientes que tiene, por eso no se preocupa, sabe que ellos son muy puntuales en el pago. Se siente satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, ya que le permite tener un ingreso adicional para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, asimismo desea en el futuro seguir implementando su negocio con nuevos productos. Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir y bisutería.
texts.en: Elvira is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in their own house. She has sold clothing and jewelry for 10 years, offering products to her coworkers. She is a nurse in a hospital in her city. She sells her products on credit, and since she knows the quality of her clients, she isn't worried--she knows that they will be punctual with their payments. She feels satisfied with the work she does, as it allows her to have an additional income to cover her home needs. In the future, she hopes to keep augmenting her business with new products. This is her eight loan from MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support and that they know she is a responsible person with her payments. She is also thankful to be part of their communal bank because all of its members have a lot of solidarity. She is also thankful to the people who will manage the loan she is seeking, since they will help the progress of her business. With this loan, she will invest in merchandise such as clothing and jewelry.

loans.use: Acquire more outfits and jewelry

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Anselmo es un hombre, dedicado al trabajo, de edad ya avanzada, pero con mucho deseo de seguir creciendo en su joyería que logro poner hace varios años.
En donde vende en un mercado prendas de plata. Ha venido evolucionando gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado e invertido más en plata y oro,  logrando pagar sus cuentas.
Ha tenido tiempos difíciles en enfermedad y gastado en sus medicamentos, lo que tiene poco inventario para realizar su trabajo, ya que él hace prenda y compra hecha también.
Con este préstamo invertirá prenda de platas, y prendas de oro, para seguir aumentando las ventas, y lograr mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Anselmo is a man who is dedicated to his work.  Although he is older, he has a strong desire to continue to grow his jewelry business, a business that he started a number of years ago.

He sells silver accessories in a market.  The business has been developing thanks to financings provided by Afodenic, which he has invested in purchases of more silver and gold, so that he could manage to pay his bills.

He has had health problems and expenses for medications which have left him with little inventory for his business, since he both makes and buys the jewelry that he sells.  With this loan, he will invest in gold and silver jewelry so that he can increase his sales and achieve better earnings.

loans.use: he will invest in the purchase of silver and gold so that he can continue to increase his sales and achieve better earnings

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao S. is 28-years-old, married to Ipanoi Ene Mpakwanik and the father of four school-going children. For the past six years he has been growing wheat on his own piece of land.

Patao learned about KADET from a colleague who was already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan which he will use to purchase and prepare more land and buy chemicals and fertilizer. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy animals to fatten and later sell at a profit.

His dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and become a commercial producer. Patao is hard working, and with the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To purchase more land and prepare it for planting and buy chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
G. Kodirjon is 30 years old. He is an optimistic and hardworking husband. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent crops. In fact, he draws strength and vitality from his work, which help to make his products the best in the city. Kodirjon has been working in agriculture for more than five years. His loving wife is also involved in the business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. He is requesting a loan of 8000 TJS and appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.     

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Wenefreda

texts.en:
Wenefreda F. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan,  South Cotabato. She is 62 years old. Wenefreda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Wenefreda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste & junk food in the local community. Wenefreda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Wenefreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wenefreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Wenefreda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Wenefreda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel  P. O. vive en la cabecera municipal del municipio de Axochiapan, Morelos, México.  Actualmente tiene 23 años, concluyó  un año de nivel medio-superior. Tiene un negocio de venta de antojitos y su crédito lo va ocupar para comprar insumos para su negocio (aceite, manteca, verdura, condimentos, etc.). El se enteró de los préstamos de KIVA y fundación Realidad por medio de un amigo que lo invitó a unirse un grupo. Tiene 5 años con el negocio y ha ido creciendo en número de clientes.  Su esposa es la que elabora la comida y él ayuda despachando a los clientes. Es su primer negocio, lo tiene en su casa y lo  considera muy importante porque se mantienen  del negocio
Siempre le ha gustado atender  a sus clientes   y le da gusto que con su trabajo se mejora su economía, un momento de orgullo para él cuando sus clientes no se quejan y les gusta lo que ellos cocinan. En su establecimiento generalmente atiende a sus vecinos y personas del rumbo, considera que su negocio es popular porque a la gente le gusta la comida, aunque recientemente se han abierto más negocios como el suyo dice que a él no le afecta mucho y que sus ventas son buenas. Las ganancias regularmente las reinvierte en su negocio, tiene como meta construir o rentar un local para establecerse adecuadamente y aumentar sus ventas.
EL señor Israel es casado, su esposa participa en el negocio elaborando la comida, tiene un hijo Jonathan Alexander de 1 año y 4 meses. Nos comenta que le gusta mucho su localidad porque es tranquilo y el clima es muy caluroso y no hace frío. Su negocio es muy importante porque le ayuda a salir adelante económicamente a su familia e ir haciendo algunos detalles de acabado a su vivienda. En lo futuro desea ampliar su negocio y hacerlo un mini restaurante con más servicios que ofrecer y diferentes tipos de comida. Se siente muy contento de recibir el préstamo de KIVA y Fundación Realidad, porque a través de estos apoyos va a poder realizar sus metas, y más que nada construir un patrimonio para su hijo y que no le falte nada. Sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA y Fundación Realidad fueron las siguientes: “muchas gracias me han ayudado mucho (los préstamos)”.
texts.en:
Israel  P. O., 23, lives in the municipal seat of Axochiapan, Morelos, México.  He finished 10th grade.  He has a fast-food business and will use the loan to buy ingredients for the business (oil, lard, vegetables, condiments, etc.)  He found out about KIVA and Fundación Realidad loans though a friend who invited him to join a group.  He has had the business for five years and the number of customers has been steadily growing.  His wife is the one who prepares the food and he helps tending to customers.  This is his first business.  It’s in his house and he considers it to be important because that’s how they support themselves.

He has always enjoyed taking care of his customers and he is happy that his work improves his economy.  A moment of pride for him is when his customers don’t complain and they like what they cook for them.  He usually takes care of neighbors and people from the area in his establishment. He considers that his business is popular because the people like the food. Although recently businesses similar to his have opened he says he hasn’t been affected much and his sales continue to be good.  He regularly reinvests profits into the business.  His goal is to build or rent a locale to set himself up adequately and increase sales.

Israel is married.  His wife participates in the business preparing the food.  He has a son, Jonathan Alexander, who is a year and four months old.  He comments that he likes his location a lot because it’s calm and the weather is warm; it’s not cold.

His business is very important because it helps his family get ahead economically and makes doing some finishing touches to his house possible.  In the future he’d like to expand the business and turn it into a mini restaurant with additional services to offer and different types of food.

He feels very happy to get a KIVA and Fundación Realidad loan because through this assistance he will be able to reach all his goals and, more than anything else, build a patrimony for his son so that he won’t lack anything.

His words for the KIVA and Fundación Realidad teams are the following:  “Thank you very much; the loans have been very helpful.”

loans.use: To buy oil, lard, dishes, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Uugantsetseg

texts.en:
Uugantsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in one rented room in a public apartment. Her son lives on his own, separate from his parents, and her husband is disabled. 

She graduated from a trade vocational school as a cashier in 1985. Uugantsetseg operates a construction materials trading business out of a stall at the construction market in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 2007 and has built a stable and successful operation. 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital so as to increase the amount of her products to sell.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Masaya labora arduamente el señor Juan José L. , quien ya tiene tres años de desempeñarse en el cargo de Fontanero en una empresa ubicada en esta localidad, con el ingreso de su trabajo logra sufragar los gastos que requiere su familia el cual la conforma su esposa y su hijo.

Este señor tiene un gran sueño que es el de ir realizando mejoras en su vivienda para crearle un techo digno a su familia, es por esta razón que ahora visita Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para comprar los materiales de construcción y así dar por cumplido sus anhelos.

Lo que en realidad quiere es que su hijo se desarrolle en su casa con todas las comodidades y tenga un crecimiento sano.
texts.en:
In the town of Masaya, Señor Juan José L. R. works hard. For three years he has worked as a plumber for a business located in this community. With his income, he has been able to pay the costs of the things his family needs. His family consists of his wife and a son.

This man has a great dream, which is to continue completing the improvements in his home to make it a worthy home for his family. It is for this reason that he is now visiting us in our offices at CEPRODEL to apply for a loan to improve his house and thus fulfill his dreams.

What he really wants is for his son to grow up in his home with all the comforts and have a healthy development.

loans.use: Improve his home

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita R. is from the village of Babanuang. She is 39 years old. Melita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Melita runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and drinks and tending a canteen near the school. Melita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2007, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Melita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Melita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang S., 44, is married and resides with her family in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for the most populated city in the country. S. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 82 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Thay

texts.en: Thay M. is a 40-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Siem Reap province. She is a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes in front of her house. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee. She has a life partner in her husband who works as an internal staff member in a private organization in Oddar Meanchey province. The family has only one kid who is attending school. Thay M. would like a loan of $500 in order to purchase more cloth for providing her clothing service.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for providing her clothing service.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 33-year-old married man with two children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda, with the eight people he takes care of. He is a produce trader, a business in which he has been involved for ten years, having begun with 600,000 UGX that he had saved. He now boasts of a capital of 6,000,000 UGX. John wants to educate his children and build a permanent house. He is requesting a loan to buy maize produce for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Fuentes Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Graciela B. una integrante del grupo "FUENTES", que esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve al grupo de señoras al rededor de Graciela en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar mas mercancia de temporada y así ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientas para todos los gustos y tallas. Sus compañeras y vecinos la conocen por ser persona responsable, trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha ya que podra incrementar sus ventas y tener mas clientes lo que le permitira incrementar sus ganancias y poder de manera apoyar a su familia. Tiene 24 años, estudio la carrera tecnica en enfermeria, es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos. Quiere este prestamo para comprar ropa de temporada. Tambien espera más adelante poder realizar unos arreglos a su casa y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan un mejor futuro y logren sus sueños y así nunca les haga falta nada.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Mrs. Graciela B.’s house.  She is one of the members of the “FUENTES” (Fountains) group located in the State of Veracruz, México.  The group of women can be seen surrounding Graciela in the photo.

She started selling clothes five years ago.  She is asking for the loan to buy more seasonal merchandise in assorted styles and sizes to have more variety available to offer her customers. 

Her fellow group members and neighbors know her for being a responsible, hard working woman who is devoted to her family.  She feels very satisfied with the loan because she’ll be able to increase sales and have more customers which will make it possible for her to increase profits thus supporting her family.

She is 24 years old and studied Technical Nursing.  She’s married and has a total of three children.  She wants this loan to buy seasonal clothes.  She also hopes later on to get ahead on home improvements and to continue supporting her children’s schooling so that they will have a better future, will see their dreams come true and so that they will never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.
